Reviews.Title: “A complete hotel”
Reviews.Author: malvett
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying again at the Miami Intercontinental Hotel last February 2012. I had not been there in a year and I noticed that it has gone through a major renovation, my room was totally refurnished with a great king-size bed, large flat TV and many other amenities; it is indeed a complete hotel. The great views of the Bay remain unchanged and the staff continues to provide great service 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel and Conference Facility”
Reviews.Author: Charity516
Reviews.Content: I attended the 2011 World Spinning and Sports Conference at Hotel Intercontinental. I was incredibly impressed with reception--even though my room was not ready, they were able to accelerate the process so I could check in. The rooms are huge and spacious with nice finishes, a large closet and a mini fridge. I really enjoyed the pool floor (5th?) outside the spa. Nice deck loungers to relax in and staff around to help rearrange chairs or move cushions. The main restaurant, Indigo, was pricey and not great...perhaps better as a bar. I didn't appreciate a $20 club sandwich. The conference facilities were impeccable. Ballrooms were kept clean and stocked with water (very important for a sports conference). If you are coming to Miami on business, or just planning to stay in the hotel for a conference like I did, this is a great hotel. However, if you're planning on doing some sightseeing or hoping to lay on a beach, this is not the best choice. It's on the bay, so no sand, just concrete walkways, and it's in the financial district, so to get to any quality restaurants a car is required. There is very little within walking distance of the hotel. There is a nice grassy park next door full of palm trees, but otherwise the neighborhood is rather dull.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe G
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the InterContinental for Ultra Music Festival and all I can say is that I was thoroughly impressed. Arrived early for check in but the staff let us into a room early instead of waiting around. Angelica is especially extremely friendly and helpful. Perfect location, perfection hotel..I would only stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: v_starMiamiBeach
Reviews.Content: Great location! Redone room! And the best part is the staff - some of the most helpful in the city of Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Has upped its game to continue to compete”
Reviews.Author: tdcCT
Reviews.Content: At one time, the Intercontinental was the only really nice hotel in the downtown area. Over the last several years, several new hotels have been built. I had not stayed at the Intercontinental recently and was impressed. They have replaced all the soft goods, updated the bathrooms and tweaked the lobby. Definitely a contender, especially as Miami begins to have a downtown scene.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel..”
Reviews.Author: AjaKing
Reviews.Content: Amazing lobby, great service from concierge to the restaurant. Our room was modern and had the most amazing ocean view. But the best part was our bathroom wich was huge with a wonderful shower tub, I didn't feel like getting out. We ate most of our meals at the restaurant downstairs or the cafe by the pool, the food was delicious and reasonable priced. Only thing I'd change or wish to be different is the amount of sun you get at the pool, because the surrounding buildings block it for the most part of the day. There is no self parking so paying valet is little steep. I ranked the value lower because we felt that hotel nickel and dimes you by charging for use of the gym /$15 per person/.. Which is fine for couple of days but longer stays would bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: Launcherman
Reviews.Content: I would probably give this review a 4.5 rating if available. The hotel is very nice and clean and has an attractive, fairly large, modern lobby area with lots of marble and a fountain. First, I will run through the goods. Rooms were nice and well appointed and the bed very comfortable. We had a corner room which is a bit larger and we had a beautiful view of the bay. The hotel is located in a great spot and is walking distance from Bayside Marketplace and across the street from the free PeopleMover public transit system. The pool is average size and faces the bay and has a nice tropical style pool bar and a covered sitting area for casual food. The hotel is minutes away from the cruise ship port and South Beach is right across the nearby bridge (about 10-15 minutes with light traffic and 30+ minutes on weekends and when busy). Coconut Grove shopping/dining area is also fairly close at about 15 minutes by car. If you upgrade to a Club access room you get access to the Club Lounge (hours are 0700-2000) with free water/soft drinks/snacks along with a free happy hour and breakfast offered. Just a couple of negatives. The valet staff were courteous and efficient but overnight parking runs about $35 and there is really no other choice. Entrance drive is fairly small and traffic is kinda crazy. Front desk staff is also friendly and helpful but front desk area is rather small and awkwardly located which means lines almost always for the desk and folks have to walk through the waiting guests to get to the elevators. There is a mini bar with a variety of items at an expected high cost but beware not to move the items as they are on motion sensors. There is an exercise facility which costs $15/day per person. Internet access also comes with a fee of about $12/day. For a fairly pricey hotel, it seems a little tacky to nickel and dime you for every little thing and detracted from an otherwise pleasant experience. One other item to keep in mind is that the restaurants and bar at the hotel add an 18% tip in all the time. This is also pretty standard at the restaurants at Bayside and South Beach so check your bill or ask before tipping. Overall, we did like the hotel and the location very much.

Reviews.Title: “The worst IC!!!”
Reviews.Author: alexzhdanov
Reviews.Content: There is my official complain to the property Didn't have any answer. Good afternoon! My name is Platinum Ambassador Member since 2006 Well, I would like to infrom you that we've stayed 1 night in IC Miami downtown and it was the worst IC experience for last 5 years. Some facts: 1) we'd arrived about 11pm, bellman was by the door, but nobody helped us with heavy huge luggage (!). Wherefore, bellman was smiling all the time while we had to pull our bags up the stairs. 2) the room was very smelly like salt fish for beer. Disgusting. 3) during check-in, smooth and very welcome, receptonist said about opening hours of restaurants and bar. BUT! When we came for couple of drinks to the bar (works till 1.00) at 0.24 (!) the lady saind: Bar is closed. Why??? Closed. Ok. At the reception the lady said I dont know, why they close. Thats all about!!! 4) I took a beer from the minibar. It was warm. Yes, guys, warm beer(!!!) in IC!!! 5) We used the Business center option "Printing". So, we had to pay for internet and 6 pages 11.00$ But my Visa has been charged for 20.00$ ,nobody answered me. 6) Room service food. Hotdog - real shame, 1 bread, 1 dry sausage and nothing more (see the menu!) with disgusting thin oil-smelly french fries. Excuse me, but for 14-hour (!!!!) stay little bit much bad things, right? It is a shame, and we would like to ask you - first time for 5 years - any redeemtions. Officialy,

Reviews.Title: “Helpful service, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: wickedlywhimsy
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at Miami's Hotel Intercontinental. I know this is a good chain because I stayed in the one in Prague. I had a lovely room with a great view. And when I had an issue with the internet, it was solved quickly and politely by a woman named Kerryann.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel-and-dimed to death”
Reviews.Author: JamesBeswick
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms and low rates on Hotwire but they sting you on every little thing inside the hotel. $35/day to park. $15/day *per person* for the fitness center. $12/day for slow Internet. $5 to have two empty bowls delivered to the room. A minibar on motion sensor which they will empty for a bargain $25 (better than $10 for a mini bottle of liquor). They would only provide one bathrobe for the room, despite having two guests. The restaurant and bar have a compulsory 18% tip, so no discretion there. The valet, as others pointed out, is incredibly slow, as was the bellhop at delivering the bags upon check-in. I'd like to say this was a great experience since the rooms are good but the endless charges made this an exercise in avoiding doing anything to enjoy any of the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ChatVoyageur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really convenient for business travelers as well for vacationers! The location is unbeatable. The Bayside is a few minutes walk from the hotel and Miami Beach is not far away by car. The room is very spacious, comfortable and modern with nice views from the city. But ask first for the refurbished rooms. I was given a newly refurbished room, but a colleague was given and old one. He told me the room was nice, but no so modern like the one I had. The bathroom is pretty big, and is provided with a separate glass shower and a bath-tub. In the vanity cabinet you will find the hairdryer and in the closet is stored the iron and ironing board. The staff is really helpful and they try their best to make sure you're having a nice stay. If you have the chance, don't miss the breakfast, the quality is good and you can find good fresh products, but if you don't get a good deal with breakfast included don't worry, there is a Starbucks located inside the hotel. My only negative point to add, would be that the A/C in the lobby was set too high. I truly recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stellar customer service, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: EJ C
Reviews.Content: Guest relations and customer service at Hotel InterContinental Miami have been fantastic. I've travelled around the world and never had such thorough attention paid to ensure a great stay. Leo Perez, guest relations manager, went above and beyond expected calls of duty, even for a five-star hotel. Part of this trip was a comp, after a terrible experience at a different Hotel Intercontinental altogether. Leo and the team at Hotel InterContinental Miami redeemed this hotel chain for me. The views, room, stay, amenities: cannot recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Dull, depressing and pathetic customer services”
Reviews.Author: Ashmdy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Intercontinental Miami for 7 nights in March 2012 and I couldn't have asked for worse in Miami, especially on a business trip. The hotel is dim, dull and depressing and destroys the colorful and vibrant Miami impressions that bring from outside. The customer services is pathetic - hadn't expected such from a five star hotel. I had to wait for 20 minutes at the reception to get a security guard walk me to the gym at 9:20pm; yes, the gym is closed 9pm and to use it after 9pm, one needs to sign a waiver form that the hotel is not responsible if the user is injured or dead. To add to that, I reached hotel 12:30 am in the night with a completely tired body and big suitcase in my hand and nobody from the entire hotel staff even offered a courtesy luggage help and I had to drag it along, all the way to my room. I would strongly recommend anyone coming to Miami to stay at the similar good hotels in South Beach - they are vibrant, colorful and much more lively. I realized this when I made a trip to South Beach and I regret not staying there. This hotel is waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar hotel from service to rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JALeklem
Reviews.Content: A premier destination in downtown Miami. At the front desk Robert was so kind to us to upgrade to a beautiful water view. Ask for one if at possible. Great rooms althought Internet access was overpriced. Try the lobby bar for a nightcap.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay so far!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica k
Reviews.Content: At first seeming over priced, the excelent commodities of this hotel were very well worth it. Not only were the employees and staff members amiable and friendly but they were very helpful and eager to be at your service. To say the club lounge was fairly alright would be cutting it short, since it was the best service I had ever received. There I had the pleasure of being directed by one of the staff members named kathleen, and two fine gentlemen by the name of Elvin and Killi who helped me a great deal during my stay. This was back in my trip to miami back in February, needless to say I will definitely be booking there again and recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes a pleasant stay with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Overated !”
Reviews.Author: TishTish1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise out of Miami. The public areas of the hotel are fine ( but not great). The room I had was shabby and dated, the windows were dirty and for the price I paid I was very disapointed.Breakfast was ok but again very pricey. The only thing this hotel has going for it is its location to Bayside and The Port. There are much cheaper hotels nearby, book one of those !

Reviews.Title: “Our Miami Boat Show trip”
Reviews.Author: scuff66
Reviews.Content: Until 4 years ago this was our 'go-to' place to stay for the annual Miami Boat show as it is located right beside 'Strictly Sail' located at MIAMARINA AT BAYSIDE. The room prices went up and up and when we were quoted over $500+ for a concierge room a few years back, we decided to skip staying at the InterContinental. Fast forward to a few months ago when we thought we'd try the hotel again for the 2012 Boat Show. The rate was aprox. $400 a night for concierge floor, valet parking at $36 a night, and the State/City tax combined was over $50 a night (ouch). We were pleasantly surprised that the room had been redecorated and the 'Club' Room re done as well. The staff, as always, was helpful and we enjoyed our stay. The view of the cruise boats arriving and departing as well as the sail and motor cruisers passing the hotel was mesmerizing. Our one issue is that they keep the lobby so cold that it's a race for the elevator to warm up. All in all a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business conference hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chrisbpower
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would consider this a very good business conference hotel. It has great meeting spaces, spacious guest rooms and is close to the Bayside Market for a quick stroll, drink or bite to eat. The hotel is clean and public spaces are well maintained. While my room was large, it left a bit to be desired in the cleanliness department. Speaking of cleanliness, the oddest housekeeping experience occurred during this stay. While in the room, housekeeping just entered the room without knocking. They quickly left after discovering I was in the room, but never returned to clean the room that day or the next. A call to the hotel operator assured me the situation would be investigated and I'd receive a return call. Unfortunately, the call never came and the room was never cleaned. Despite this one service snafu, I'd still consider it a very good hotel--especially for business trips--and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Rob R
Reviews.Content: Well located downtown, the Intercontinental offers just the right amenities for the business traveler. The room was comfortable and well equipped for the business traveler. Great bathrooms with double-headed showerheads and plush bath sheets. Great conference location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AyannaFlorida
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here for a conference. It was large and close to many places to walk to outside the hotel. Right on the waterfront. The only thing I had a LOT of trouble with was cell phone reception. I have Verizon and my phone kept searching for signal so much it went dead every day by 6 pm though fully charged each night. Ate at the restaurant there and got excellent service from Alex the waiter the first night. The second night, we went back and got another waiter and were IGNORED for a long time. I asked a question and it took the guy 10 minutes to answer a question about the fresh catch. We had an 18% automatic gratuity despite it only being 3 people with individual checks and it was one of the worst services I'd ever received. Restaurant less than 1/4 full, so it wasn't due to being overworked. I did NOT eat dinner there the 3rd and final night. Beautiful hotel. The bathrooms were very nice with granite and granite shower stalls. Rain shower heads. 4 star quality rooms with nice work station desks. Nice linens. I liked it except for the infuriating cell phone problem - EVEN in the rooms! Besides the parking fee mentioned otherwise, it is $15/day to use the meager workout room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: Last week stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel - Miami and just had an excellent experience. The room was comfortable, the Priorty Club lounge had a wonderful breakfast and in the Happy Hour in the evenings had a party atmosphere. All-in-all I would tell anyone headed to Miami to give it try; you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: kaf1968
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on November 4, 2011 right before a cruise for one night. We booked it through Last Minute Travel and got a decent rate. As soon as we arrived at the hotel, we tried to check in. Granted, it was early - 2pm. They claimed not to allow early check ins, but a friend had checked in early just minutes earlier. Of course they have early check ins....for a price. This then started the upsell that continued throughout our stay. They asked if we wanted to upgrade to a bay view for $20. I asked if that would get us into a room now. Of course it would! So, we took it. We figured we had already saved about $60 by booking through another site and we were super tired from traveling. We were also offered an upsell on some other frequent traveler thing, which we declined. We got to the room, which was quite nice at first glance and was well-appointed with furnishings, a mini bar (which we did not partake in), toiletries, etc. Nice big bathroom. Great view and worth the money. We rented a car right from the lobby to go to an event in Boca Raton. That was super convenient, but the hours are very limited. Be prepared to pay $35 per night to park. Yikes. We went out for the evening, came back, went right to sleep. We woke up to our cruise ship in view. That, and a very close look at the dust and peeling wall paper, scuffed walls in the room. The sunlight showed the wear and tear on the room. All of these things could be fixed in a couple of hours, but it was clear that the attention to detail was completely lacking. We got Starbucks for breakfast, also in the lobby and very convenient. Upon checking out using the service on the television, another person's account popped up on OUR screen. What was completely strange was that it was the account of a friend who was on another floor! She had been in the room about a hour prior to our checking out. Very very odd. We mentioned this at the front desk. They did not seemed surprised. Would it be possible that the key cards have a chip in them of some sort? It was way too much of a convenience. So, all and all, a pleasant stay, but not one that I was very impressed with.

Reviews.Title: “Great view...plumbing needs attention”
Reviews.Author: mjpino
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this downtown Miami hotel for one night. We were offered an upgraded room for an additional $9 upon check-in, which we accepted. We stayed in room #2506 and the view was incredible. We lived in Miami and are used to the scenery, but this was something special. The room overlooked Biscayne Bay and we could see all the way out to the Atlantic; it was just beautiful. The room appeared to be recently renovated, but the plumbing was a problem. I really liked the shower head, but the water didn't drain well in the tub, so when you shower, you're standing in ankle-deep water. It doesn't make you feel very clean when you get out. After flushing the toilet, the tank kept running, but stopped after I jiggled the handle. I didn't report the issues to hotel because we were only there one night. The minibar wasn't restocked before our arrival. My husband took a Pellegrino and water out, but the water was half full, so he put it back. Since the fridge has a sensor, we were still charged for it. After explaining the situation to the front desk, they quickly took off both items, which was nice. Although the valet was expensive ($36/day), they were quick and friendly. All in all, it was a good hotel. It's centrally located, clean and the staff was customer service oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: Lawtraveler084
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here the night before and night after our cruise. We reserved the club floor and found out upon arrival that the floor was being renovated. We were immediately upgraded and spent our last night in an incredible suite overlooking the bay. The staff was exemplary. We utilized the spa, restaurant and lounge ares as well as the pool restaurant. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent,huge hotel,but a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: nippnsc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is huge. We stayed in a suite, which, in our case ws little more than a regular room,and well worth it. The suite was huge, and very comfortable, and totally quiet. We also had access to the Club Lounge, which included a free very nice breakfast buffet, and an equally nice free cocktail hour. The staff here is superb-uniformly pleasant and helpful, especially the doormen and valet parkers. Downsides: The hotel has many inappropriate charges: 1) $24 per day for Internet usage 2) $36 per day for valet parking, which is the only choice 3) $15 per day to use the workout room 4) $3 per day maid charge These were galling, and clouded an otherwise excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: WesternGardener
Reviews.Content: Good quality hotel. First time at an InterContinental hotel and was very pleased with the standards maintained at this location. Excellent staff and location. Quiet room with comfortable bed. Free parking, easy check-in and check-out. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location best view in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Diazcruz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved it,great service very friendly awesome view and,lots of things to do business wise and pleasure awesome......

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Miami weekend”
Reviews.Author: tbecker2359
Reviews.Content: These folks went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. Spectacular easterly view of the cruise ship terminal from our 30th floor Club Level King with walk-in shower, super comfy bed, electric blackout shades and access to Club Continental on 29th for great breaskfast and Happy Hour. Two room-service diners from Indigo were unspectacular but tasty none-the-less. However the staff is A+ on every floor! The hotel is geared to business travel, events, conventions, etc. We're both artists so this is really not our scene.

Reviews.Title: “pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: sk84fungirl
Reviews.Content: Entire party loved the hotel. Visit was excellent. There were 4 in our part and we had two rooms the Friday night before Labor Day. We took a taxi from MIA to the hotel for about $25. There was some traffic, but nothing major. Two in my party had never been to Miami before and loved everything about the hotel and the location. Our view was of the downtown skyline. It was very nice. The room was very clean and beds quite comfortable.There is a small store in the lobby. Looked to have some specialty items and was a little pricey. We walked to Bayside for drinks and hung out for a while. As we went back to the hotel, someone was having a white party. A boat was docked next to the hotel where many were parking before boarding. Lots of lobby foot traffic. My sister thought the breakfast to be the best she's had a hotel. We purchased the buffet because it was the easiest thing to do as one in our party is not very mobile. While I cannot recall the exact cost, it was quite pricey. The front desk staff, bellman and concierge...were all SUPER EXCELLENT!!! It is because of their service that I wanted to ensure to get this review posted. There were all so kind and friendly. My hotel of choice for a pre-cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel option in downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: davidbruce
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental for just one night for business, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The rooms have apparently just been upgraded, and everything was stylish and clean - with a great view. If you're doing business in downtown Miami, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfection”
Reviews.Author: MonicaMiami
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1/28/12 along with 3 girlfriends for a bachelorette party. From the start everything was flawless especially considering the hotel was sold out due to the ING marathon. We were staying in a suite on the 31st floor - amazing view!!! The room had a separate sitting area with a sofa, 2 chairs with a big coffee table and another small cafe table with chairs. Plenty of room to have guests over. There was a flat screen tv and a bar. The room had a half bath on one side and on the opposite side was a full bath with shower and a separate bathtub. Our favorite part, besides the two huge windows for the city and water views, was the makeup spot next to the room. They had a mirror and stool so all the girls had there own space to get ready. As you can see we looooved the room. We also had a massage at the spa and that was a hit too! Even though it's a high end hotel, you felt comfortable and welcomed, not stuffy. The spa was beautiful and lots of things to choose from. It was only for 1 night but oh what a night!

Reviews.Title: “An extraordinaire Brazilian Culinary Festival experience...”
Reviews.Author: Jose B
Reviews.Content: As part of my Local Business, I normally invite Clients of have Lunch to go into further details for their Events. I'm extremely glad to have decided to bring them over this time around to the Magnificent Hotel Intercontinental Miami for Brunch where we were received by Brazilian Costumed Hosts and Hostesses. Then we enjoyed from a very wide range of Salads, Entrees, and Desserts under a very nice and elegant touch of a LIVE Band playing tunes from Brazilian Jazz(Bossa Nova). I'm always amazed by their Hospitality, wide selection with a great taste on their Menu, and excellent service with high standards. I highly suggest you to try and enjoy The Intercontinental Hotel Miami... Excelente!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ted P
Reviews.Content: I am Priority Platinum and i travel a lot because of my work , i stayed at this Intercontinental every time i go to Miami, the last one was on February 3 for one night. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable and lets not forget the amazing view of the Port of Miami, but also the service is wonderful, the staff is professional and friendly, Thank you Paula for all your help during my short stay I hope to meet you next time, and Shary thank you for your beautiful smile.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your bill”
Reviews.Author: Elllie E
Reviews.Content: AS frequent client of this hotel, it was sad to see how they socked it to us in one of our recent stays in charging outrageous prices ($380 per night, plus parking, taxes etc = >$450 night) when we normally would pay half. The recent renovations are not becoming and so they must be making loyal patrons pay up. Club floor looks like a Motel 6. Will consider the Biltmore next time and start giving them some of our business. Stayed at the Intercontinental in NYC (across from the Waldorf) at Christmas and it wasn't even this high and we got a Jr Suite for so much less.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious sleep”
Reviews.Author: NickyWLondon
Reviews.Content: We had just a brief one night stop in Miami, and found the hotel to be extremely comfortable with a generous sized room and bathroom. We had a pleasant evening walking along the waterfront down to a restaurant area and good atmosphere. The most memorable thing about the hotel was the luxurious bed linen. It was the most amazing sleep I have ever had, literally melting into bed. It is not very often my two young children are asleep as soon as their heads touch the pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service”
Reviews.Author: DavidmWigan
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a two week stay with friends. Our mission being to explore Miami and the surrounding areas. The hotel was ideally situated, our suites were fabulous, spacious, quiet and lots of storage space. We had access to the newly refurbished club lounge, where we were able to enjoy breakfast, during the day coffee and afternoon tea and early evening pre dinner drinks and substantial hot and cold snacks. Our only criticism would be does the lounge need four television screens: three next to each other all showing different channels and one on the opposite wall. We wish that the Barclay in New York had a club lounge. The staff in the Miami club lounge were excellent, as were all the hotel staff we dealt with, but we had most contact with the following who deserve a special mention. Club Lounge - Leonardo, Kathleen, Elvin, Aristides, Laetitia and Killy . Doorman- William. Restaurant - William. We hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property, Great Service, Club Access!!”
Reviews.Author: ChudSandwich
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in Downtown Miami. The gentleman that greeted us in the Valet drive was wonderful and was extremely helpful with all of our luggage. He made sure the luggage that didn't make our flight was delivered promptly. Alejandro at the front desk was awesome, yes sir yes sir! We were given access to the newly remodeled club lounge. Join the Ambassador program!! The club breakfast was well stocked and delicous. We regret never making it for the happy hour! Our harbor view rooms were very comfortable, serviced well and even had turndown. Look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!!”
Reviews.Author: M P
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel twice last year, I didn't learn my lesson the first time! I should of know better. First time they booked us in a room next to a soccer team visiting from south America, they were young kids (late teens) if not early twenties but acted like it was spring break in that floor. We called at least x4 times which included a visit from security to their rooms but still they kept being roudy, we were told that they had done what they could to calm them but if we wanted to they could move us to a different floor. Needless to say we didn't do that, we were already unpacked, in bed and extremely upset about the situation. No apologies were given the following morning during checkout. Later during the year I booked again, mainly becuase it's close to restaurants I like in the downtown area, but it was as dissapointing as the last time. The room was dirty, unkept bathroom, and what's more it was missing pictures hanging from the wall only the nail was there hahah!! The mini bar was empty as well. We didn't even bother complaining, like I said i should of know better. The quality of this so called 5 star hotel is not up to par, extremely deceiving from the outside, because once you go to the rooms it is something else, and the attention from the personnel is just as bad. Also!! Do not eat at the restaurant inside!! Not good quality food at all. Im just very very disappointed at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service and location”
Reviews.Author: AlanwManchester_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for two weeks while we were exploring the greater Miami area.Yes it's a busy hotel but this never once affected the four of us.In fact it was great being able to people watch in the lobby! We had suites on the 31st and 32nd floors and they were fantastic.Recently renovated with nothing extra you would want.Being in the hotel for two weeks with time on our hands the staff got to know us from William at the door who called us his family,William in the restaurant who remembered what we drank to the crew in the Club Intercontinental Lounge who all deserve a name check so here goes-Leo,Kathleen,Laetitia,Elvin,Killy and Aristides.This lounge certainly adds to the enjoyment of a stay providing facilities for breakfast to evening drinks and snacks.A pity there is not one in The Barclay New York. Our bedroom and lounge were kept in perfect order by our housemaid Lucy. Fabulous stay and the great benefit of 14 nights is you get to know the staff. We look forward to our return when we want to escape the UK winter.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandCountryboy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very comfortable. We could walk, or catch the shuttle to the finest restuarants! the view was great and I slept like a baby! Our room reservation was messed up a bit, but quicly resolved by the front staff. Like my fiance and I were going to sleep in seperate beds? hahaha noooo! They gave us a King and waterfront room! I would stay there again in a minute! I'm heading back to Miami now to complete the Marriage!

Reviews.Title: “Decent-upmarket, no value!”
Reviews.Author: Alcoholix
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, can't go wrong if it's being paid by your company or business trip. Almost 400$, not worth the money at all. Ad ons are the following: Internet, Gym, Parking, breakfast. Clean, convenient and nice location. For an Intercon, no bathrobes nor room slippers, which is usually a standard at ever Intercon I've ever been to. Save your money, and get something for half the price a little into town and rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Classy but missing some important qualities”
Reviews.Author: WindyCityFinest
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental last year for a conference and was very impressed with the class and cleanliness of the hotel. Everything speaks to luxury from the floors to the elevators. It's ideal for conferences and large meetings as there is simply space galore. But being on the beach - I really want a balcony with some fresh air. Also...it's quite a trek to the beach. Though - it's just a hop and a skip to Byscane Bay - an outdoor mall with a ton of things to do. In the evening, there's usually some band providing live music and you just can't beat that! Back to the hotel... The staff were all generally very helpful, but being a Platinum member I was surprised I didn't get upgrades and some other perks I've come accustomed to at other IHG hotels. Everyone was very nice, quick to respond and I definitely felt important! Overall - for the business traveller, I would recommend this hotel - maybe not so much for the casual traveller or someone with kids - but definitely for those in the area on business - this would be an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Room is fine but incompetent and irresponsible staff”
Reviews.Author: Alf R
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room for 1/22-1/26 to attend a conference. I was told to submit a credit card authorization form, as well as an image of my credit card, which I did. My credit was then charged for $989.88 on 1/9, which is 2 weeks prior to my arrival. I didn't want to make a big deal out of it. However, when I arrived, I was told that there was no room reserved under my name. I was given a room to stay for 1 night and that I need to check with the front desk the next morning to see if there's going to be a room for me or not. My credit card was charged for almost $1000 2 weeks earlier, and yet I'm getting kicked out of the hotel? In addition, throughout the process there's never anyone who offers an apology or even offer to find an alternative solution. It's just "there's nothing we can do". If you don't know what to do, then don't tell me I have a room reserved and don't charge my credit card in the first place. By far, this is the most incompetent and irresponsible hotel staff I've ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pre cruise stay. Just beautiful”
Reviews.Author: cwuer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night pre-cruise back in September. Lucky me got upgraded to water view room and the view was gorgeous. Loved it at night with when the yacht's were coming back in. Beds were heavenly. Huge room with fabulous bathroom with marble and large closet. Front desk friendly and check in quick and efficient. Happy hour in bar with free finger foods. Good drinks and service in the bar area. Close to cruise port so easy trip next morning. We ate dinner at a wonderful, family owend Italian restaurant about a 10 minute walk away. Don't remember the name but I read about it on this forum so read around and you will find it. It was small and locally owned and absolutely delicious. There is a Wal-greens and also liquor store within walking distance of hotel if you want to pick up some wine before your cruise. Starbucks in the lobby area. Staying here was the perfect beginning to our cruise and certainly set the mood. Thanks to this wonderful staff!!! Miami is so fun. Would return here in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “good location, good beds but no sun at the pool in winter”
Reviews.Author: GypsyGirl21
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 3301 which was very spacious with a King bed, chaise lounger, and a nice view of the cruise port. Bed was very comfortable, nice amenities in the bathroom, lots of towels, bathrobes and a fruit basket on arrival. I was here for a conference so little time to play but here are the best things about this hotel Starbucks in the lobby 5 minute walk to Bayside shops and restaurants $7 cab ride to Mary Brickel village $15 cab ride to South Beach Free Metro Mover across the street which you can take to transfer to Metro Rail for a 20 minute ride to Dadeland Mall. $10 Shuttle to the Dolphin Mall (Outlets) with pick at the lobby. If you're here for sun, please note that the pool only has sun between 10 and 12 at least in Jan/Feb. The highrises on 3 sides block the sun after that. WiFi costs $17.95/day which is outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for short stays with downtown Miami and the marina close by.”
Reviews.Author: CJMarbella
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here but this time just for a one night layover before leaving for Spain. Hotel is in a great location for business and pre/post cruise stays and is only 20 mins from Miami International. It's really a business hotel and caters for conferences so if you are looking for a resort type property this is not for you.that said its location on the waterfront and a short stroll from the Marina with an array of shops and restaurants make it an ideal base to rest and relax before continuing your journey. Did find it a bit pricy for one night but rooms have been refurbished and are large offering excellent panoramic views.

Reviews.Title: “Great beginning of the New Year”
Reviews.Author: Lynn G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental Miami with my family on New years eve and we had a wonderful time. The room had a gorgeous view of the fireworks and Miami skyline. There is a party going on right outside of the hotel and you can watch the midnight fireworks and the Orange drop , VIP style from your room or steps sways from the hotel. After midnight, the lobby becomes a disco party and the fun lasts until late hours. Great service and kindness from valet,frond desk an the restaurant on the pool area. It was fun for the entire family. I'm looking forward to return soon !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convention heaven, almost”
Reviews.Author: pbolland
Reviews.Content: I'm not a big one on conventions ... they overwhelm me ... so when I find a hotel that serves a decent buffet at lunch, good canapes at cocktail hour, has a busy-enough bar and provides a decent bed in a spacious room ... well it makes it easier to take. The room was the icing on the cake: nice soaps in a roomy shower, good snacks in the private bar and wireless access all make business stress fade away. The water nozzle could have been better and the room lacked art, but generally it was a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great for pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: christy8_77
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends the night before a cruise to Bahamas. Very clean..beautiful decor, large rooms. Starbucks in hotel and outdoor patio. Food at buffet was ok...wouldn't invest in that again. Close to dock.

Reviews.Title: “a place to stay before your cruise leave”
Reviews.Author: mammajo
Reviews.Content: This was a very friendly hotel. There was a problem with our reservation so they gave us a drink voucher to have a cocktail while they worked it out with our credit card (made the reservations using points) and then they gave us a very nice room with a view of the port. It was in walking distance of other dining options and places to buy some forgotten items for our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Complete satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: mlam218
Reviews.Content: The last time we visited the Intercontenental in Downtown Miami a couple of years ago there were new condominiums being built all around it and the hotel was definately showing it age. What a nice surprise to find not only that the constrution around the hotel completed but that the hotel had been renovated as well. We were greeted by the ever present and efficient valets who checked our car and bags and then recieved the VIP treatment from front desk clerk Yael who placed us in a beutiful room on the 22nd floor with an amazing bay view. The view however was overshadowed by the new room. Every inch of the room appeared to have been redone. Spacious and tastefully done with lots of extras such as roll up/down shutter controls bedside and gorgeous bathroom. The conceriage staff was knowledgable and effective and we made sure to put a couple of hours a night in at the Indigo Bar with the entertaining and hard working Joey and Josua team. Our stay was a seamless event of total satisfaction and we look forward to visiting again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best new years ever at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fernando P
Reviews.Content: If your are looking for the best hotel for your next new years .you don't have to look any further , the intercontinental hotel miami is the best place to be . The service the room the view it's just amazing. Try it for your self , you will not regret it .

Reviews.Title: “My Front Desk Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tom S
Reviews.Content: I wish to thank 2-Front Desk Representatives on their great professional behavior and great service as I walked in, for the first time. There names are Marilia Gerlein and Roberto Laxamar. They provided me with a great overview of this downtown property that helped me, both as a Travel Agent & Agency to give this site return client business as well for myself. I wish them all the best in the Hotel Service Industry. Although some would find the price on the high end. It is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time !”
Reviews.Author: ranong
Reviews.Content: We stayed in InterContinental during the Thanksgiving and had a great time. Friendly staff, clean room, great view of harbor. We were surprised to find a complimentary bowl of fruits in our room. Thank you InterContinental for making our stay so memorable!!.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful start to the new year”
Reviews.Author: ManagerCoralGables
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to the hotel and it was a great way to start the new year. I had a gift certificate, and what a wonderful gift that is! When we arrived to our rooms (a suite on the club floor), we found that they faced the city - but a room change to a harbor view was quickly and easily arranged by the front desk. As the Club was closed we received complimentary upgrades to the breakfast buffet at the Indigo Restaurant and vouchers for drinks and an appetizer at the bar - quite an upgrade from the comp continental breakfast on the club floor! The food at both places was fresh and delicious. When we got to our rooms a gift of a wine and cheese plate awaited us from the concierge Eduardo, who (along with Stephanie from the Executive Office) was so gracious in arranging all the details of our visit. We had massages at the spa, which were among the best I have ever had at a spa. Also, the spa was very quiet and really beautiful with the stone floors and mosaic walls - the relaxation room is cozy and really relaxing with its little waterfalls and low lighting - and there is a steam room, sauna and drench shower as well. Finally, the bed was exceptionally comfortable and makes for a restful nights' sleep. Although I am from Miami, I highly recommend the IC Miami for business, a staycation or a spa experience - and it makes for a wonderful gift to give someone as well. You'll be well-cared for at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the Intercontinental Miami - Thanks to Shari Davis”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Interncontinental Miami for New Year's Eve. It was an amazing stay from start to finish. From booking the reservation to check-out everyone was amazing but especially worth mentioning was Shari Davis at the front desk. My family and I could not get over how pleasant and helpful she was when we checked-in. She even followed-up with us during our stay based on something we just mentioned in passing and then again when we checked-out. I travel about once every two weeks but I have never been as impressed as I was by Shari Davis and the hotel right next door to my law office. I will recommend it to my clients without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A bit underwhelmed...”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous007_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, local south Florida residents, stayed at the ICH hotel in over New Years weekend because we wanted to ring in the new year at a fabulous hotel with a fabulous location that would allow us to enjoy the fireworks without fighting the crowds. The location of this hotel is excellent. Right on the bay, steps away from Bayside on right on Biscayne. Without a doubt the best location of any other hotel in downtown Miami. The unfortunate part is that the experience was a bit of a disappointed. The hotel is obviously in an older building that they have did some upgrades on. I felt that the experience should have been a bit grander, especially considering the $200+ a night price tag. The room wasn't really worth $200 a night and the biggest shock was the amount of mold and mildew that was visible in the shower! With this hotel your simply paying for the location, don't except much in the area of overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to Celebrate New Year Eve”
Reviews.Author: ergong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at InterContinental Miami on New Year Eve. Our room was a ocean view one and that was a perfect place to celebrate New Year Eve. We could enjoy a spectacular fireworks from our room. Not only bayfront park firework but Miami beach fireworks could be seen from the room. That was a perfect beginning of the new year. Thanks for InterContinental Miami.

Reviews.Title: “A Milestone Birthday Experience to Remember”
Reviews.Author: Mumzy22
Reviews.Content: A very speacial person in our lives reached a milestone birthday in December 2011. After brainstorming of how we would commemorate this speacial day, we reached out to the staff at the InterContinental-Miami and told them of our plan. They took our idea and turned it into an experience worthy of boasting. Upon arriving to the hotel, our birthday girl was totally speechless. Everyone, from the concierge staff to department managers were equally warm as they took the hospitality concept to the extreme level. The view from her suite was breath-taking and the food was impeccably delicious! Our birthday girl described her experience as "the BEST birthday celebration EVER!" We've started a tradition of milestone birthday celebrations at the InterContinental Hotel as it offers an experience to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: RajenLondon
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3-night stay at this hotel. The hotel is located on the water, with a park and path around the bay. If you can get the water-facing rooms, they are ideal as the view is just amazing. The staff are very good and never said "No" to any request. The rooms are a good size, with very comfy beds. Decor is a little dates, and noise from adjoining rooms, especially upstairs, can be a problem in the morning with all the showers and flushing. Concierge is very knowledgeable and helpful, as are the bell and door men. The only problem is with the offering of the restaurant. The choice is limited and not that healthy - we were vegetarians and we found little on the menu for dinner except for pizza and salads. The staff were not willing to make something vegetarian. For breakfast, we found a really good French cafe called the ArtCafe - it served excellent buckwheat pancackes just as you would get in France. The hotel pool is heated, but was a bit chilly in the evenings in December. But, it is a nice pool and good for doing laps and getting some exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of thanks to Emelie Anderssson!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leblom
Reviews.Content: I was there for work and these are the things that made me enjoy my stay at this hotel, but my warmest congratulations to the hotel for their choice of personnel and particular, Emelie Andersson! She know how to really make you feel at home, and if you need anything it is like asking a family member. Congratulations from the heart, you were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Special Events”
Reviews.Author: Carlos S
Reviews.Content: I live in Miami and I am so pleased to have such a pleasant hotel to go to celebrate a holiday or special occasion. What I like the most about Hotel Intercontinental is that they always have an event going on such as Motherâ€™s Day brunch, barbecues and food festival. I go every time I can and also take all my friends with me. The hotel has a great atmosphere to have the family and friends together for a special date. Besides being well located it has a very efficient valet parking service and a friendly staff. The Hotel Intercontinental Miami is certainly a wonderful amenity for Miami town. Carlos Silva Miami, FL

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way”
Reviews.Author: gcaver
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights starting Dec 10, 2011. There is a valet only policy so we were met as soon as we pulled up in front. Several valets were on duty, doors were opened, bags were handled right away. Check was a breeze. The lobby was huge and decked out for the holidays. The room was surprisingly large , clean, and well laid out. The view was very nice of downtown Miami and the bay. This was our first time in Miami so we were unfamiliar with the area. We were very surprised to find that there was a beautiful park right next to the hotel and just beyond that the Bayside mall area. The Bayside mall is worth a trip to Miami by itself. My wife was in shopping overload over there. Everything from Victoria's Secret to Haagen Daz was represented there. Over a dozen waterside resturants provided food for almost every taste. When the sun went down Hard Rock Cafe, Bongo's, Hooters and other night spots kept your attention. There was also a waterside bandshell that had live music throughout the night. Back at the hotel there was entertainment available as well as resturants but to be honest the lure of bayside and other nearby resuturants and entertainments was stronger than the desire to stay in house. The location of the hotel could not have been better. We were in the very heart of downtown, within walking distance of hundreds of points of intrest. The causeway was less than a mile away to hop over to Miami Beach. The only thing that stopped the experience from being perfect was the $36 per day parking charge. I still prefer to decide what my cost are and tell me upfront and stop with the add ons. Pet peeve of mine. Other than that we had a marvelous time and would definatly reccomend Intercontinential Hotel when you want to go first class.

Reviews.Title: “The happiest Porters and Waiters ever! :)”
Reviews.Author: KakaKarlinhaKarla
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure to enjoy the quality service of Hotel Intercontinental Miami when I stayed there for the Brazilian Food festival. It was such a memorable stay that I went back again for the German Food festival and for the 4th of July barbecue. There I am always greeted with a big smile from the porter. Up to my room I had the best view of the Bayside area due to wonderful location the hotel is at. They have a restaurant with glass view to the bay and the happiest waiters ever! You can tell that the employees enjoy to be assisting you. The hotel also has a Luxurious Spa which delivered a very tranquil and relaxed afternoon. As I live in Miami I have the privilege delight myself throughout the year at Hotel Intercontinental! Karla Almeida

Reviews.Title: “The bed was perfect”
Reviews.Author: PatySalto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for 4 nights and received a room with a great view. The location is very nice, because one can walk directly to Bayside and there are many stores in the neighborhood. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the food was not that bad, but wasn't great either. But the bed I slept in was GREAT. It was the first time in a very long time that I woke up free of backaches. The mattress seamed to be new and it was a Simmons Beautyrest. I wish I could get one of those at the store. I recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Stay at the Intercontinental.”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseOklahoma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for one night before we left on our cruise out of the Port of Miami. The port is a short taxi drive from this hotel. There are plenty of taxi's available to take you to the port when you are ready to head that way. No need to worry about setting up transportation. The Intercontinental is a large hotel set right on the bay. The Bayside market is with-in walking distance from the hotel. We felt really safe walking around the area. Lot's to see and do. There is also a Walgreen's with-in a few block's of the hotel also for those last minute pre-cruise purchases. Check-in was really pretty fast considering how busy the hotel was. We were upgraded to a newly renovated room on an upper floor/bayside since we are Priority Club member's. Priority club is one of the few reward's program's that consistently offer's us upgrades. The room itself was really nice with a huge picture window with a direct view of the cruise ship port. We had a king size bed with lot's of pillow's that was really comfortable. Also had a nice size flat screen tv. The bathroom itself was really nice with a separate tub and shower, hair dryer and some nice amenities. The only problem's we had with the room were we couldn't get the safe to work and they don't give you much coffee for the coffee maker. The coffee maker is one of those new Keurig single cup coffee maker's. We requested extra coffee from housekeeping, but they seemed really reluctant to give us any extra. Not sure what the problem was with that. The mini-bar was fully stocked with beer, wine, snack's,etc. and of course the ridiculously high mini-bar prices. We decided to just eat in the bar area for dinner since we were wanting to watch a football game and just relax. They have a nice menu selection with appetizer's, pizza, sandwiches,etc. My cuban sandwich was huge and came with a nice size salad also. The drink's were also really good. The place was packed so service was kind of hit and miss. The prices were to be expected from a hotel bar. We got a 15% discount in the bar since we are Priority Club member's. Didn't try the Indigo Restaurant. It is located right next to the bar. Heard they served good food though. Check-out was a breeze. Just looked over our final bill and got our statement.You can charge most thing's to your room, including the restaurant/bar tab. The hotel does put an initial hold on your credit card for I think $75. It seem's most hotel's do this anymore for incidental's. Over-all this is a really nice upscale hotel in a great location. I would have liked to have spent more time here and got to explore the area a little more. Lot's to see and do!!

Reviews.Title: “Poorly Staffed”
Reviews.Author: surrealus
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. I had booked two rooms for one night and the rooms and views were lovely. Unfortunately, the only excellent service we received at this hotel was from Paola in the bar. The poor service started at check-in. Upon arrival the first thing the receptionist told us was that there would be a $100 charge to check-in. This was before even asking us our booking information. As we were on the club level (which we were informed was under construction at check-in, not at booking) and members of their frequent stay program, there should have been no mention of a fee for early check-in. This is not the warm welcome you expect at a deluxe hotel. One of our rooms was charged at the wrong rate. After pointing out the discrepancy, we received a blank look from the receptionist. We actually had to explain that we expected the discrepancy to be corrected. The beds, bedding, and pillows were clean and very comfortable. The bathrooms were in good working order, large, and generally clean. Luckily, I hadn't planned to use the tub. I say luckily because it wasn't particularly clean. Also, they kindly stock shampoo, conditioner, soaps, cotton balls, etc.; however, the decorative case that holds the cotton balls, q-tips, and nail file was not recently inspected by housekeeping. There was a half empty packet in the case. The fruit bowl consisted of a banana, an apple, and an orange and was a welcome snack. As the club floor was under construction, we were given coupons for appetizers and drinks in the bar. The appetizers were larger than expected and all delicious. The drinks, especially their own specialty cocktails were also quite good. Our server, Paola, was warm, attentive, and quick. Breakfast in the restaurant: The breakfast buffet included a very nice selection of fruits, meats and cheese; omelet station; breads; etc. The servers are supposed to provide beverages and clear the dishes. We had to repeatedly request drinks and drink refills. The server didn't seem to notice that we didn't have water or were out of tea or coffee, etc. Check-out was efficient and quick. Valet: The first night getting the car was no problem and we received our car in good order. At check-out, we received the car filled with the heavy smell of smoke which persisted for the majority of our 40 minute drive even with the windows open. We ultimately discovered a cigarette butt on the floor! It took over a day and some Febreze to get rid of the smell. I tried contacting the hotel manager, Robert Hill, but was directed to Elizabeth Perez's voice-mail until finally reaching the duty manager, Pedro. He apologized for the valet service. Instead of immediately offering to reimburse me for the poor valet service, he assured me he would talk to the valet service first and then get back to me - as if I would bother to contact him about this event a day after the fact if it hadn't actually happened and upset my family. Bottom line - if you get a great price, stay here, but don't expect the service to match the deluxe decor or brand name.

Reviews.Title: “Ice Skating”
Reviews.Author: 0Lexy0
Reviews.Content: I recently went with my kids to the hotel for the Ice Skating Rink Experience. My children loved the idea of an outdoor rink in Miami and enjoyed the music. We later went inside to find out about the activities for New Years Eve. Kathleen was glad to explain the events that will be taking place. She was thoughtful enough to offer my kids holiday cookies. Overall, my kids were happy and I was happy with such attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Renata D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to a cruise. All the staff was very welcoming. Had some misunderstanding regarding the mini fridge, which was solved by Shari Davis in a heartbeat with no fuss. The room is beautiful and very cozy. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “PRE-CRUISE STAY”
Reviews.Author: nc-1traveler
Reviews.Content: me and my wife stayed here the night before our cruise. we really loved the place and would go back in a second. the location was perfect and had a bay view room the was perfect. the bayside village area with the shops and entertainment was so much fun. many places to eat and a cvs near by. would even go for a long weekend to enjoy this area again. will stay here before my next cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ABispo
Reviews.Content: The outstanding experience at this hotel is mostly related with the sleeping quality provided. If you have sleeping disorders or is in a busy week this place definitely will not be blamed to be the cause of any poor sleeping night. Although the hotel was fully booked during my stay, at 26th floor I couldnÂ´t hear anything from Miami streets, nor from neighboring rooms. I had a friend with some noisy neighbors but he was moved to another room in a short time. The bed is magnificent, very clean, with a full set of pillows and comfortable. Room size is great, with a nice desk to spread sheets of documents, a laptop and everything else one may need to work during the stay. ItÂ´s not mentioned that there is a clock alarm that recharge your iPhone during night. Internet speed is sometimes slow, but works. Bathroom is nice, spacious and fancy. Staff is just ok as reception does not reflects the quality of the rooms and reception attendees were perceived as being sometimes confused with the magnitude of the hotel (more than 600 rooms). Breakfast was also considered poor for a five star and the price paid (at Indigo restaurant). I would recommend this hotel for businessmen and those that want a 5 star experience at a price.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: richards521
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel prior to a Caribbean cruise. On our arrival there was a problem with our booking and that of three other couples. The duty manager was excellent, no fuss, no dramas, he was professional and quickly sorted out the issues. This high level of services was displayed by all the staff we came into contact during our stay. The hotel is in an excellent position with fantastic views over the waterfront. I could not criticise his hotel everything was presented and prepared to the highest standards. When I return to Miami I will certainly be staying at this hotel, great service and most importantly fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: JoyMia
Reviews.Content: I strongly recomend this Hotel to anyone, viziting or living in MIAMI.The location is great, the room is very clean and has an amazing view of the bay and city. The food is excellent and the staff is so sweet and efficient. Thank you for the amazing time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Dunny0578
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days prior to a Caribbean cruise. Hotel was excellent, rooms clean and well maintained, bars and restaurants all to a high level. I would recommend this hotel if visiting Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edgar49er
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I stayed there for my anniversary and it was excellent. Booking a package is the best value at this hotel, as parking and other stuff gets expensive. The location is great, it's on the same side of the block as Bayside Marketplace, and the Monorail station is accross from the hotel. The pool is on the fifth floor and there is a nice jogging track on the same floor. American Arlines Arena is within a short walk from the hotel. The rooms are clean, and comfortable with nice views of the city or the bay. Overall it was an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL OF SOUTH FLORIDA”
Reviews.Author: Jorge A
Reviews.Content: i loved the promotions that this hotel make, Brazilian food, ace skate ring. I joint this events

Reviews.Title: “TV GLOBO EVENT”
Reviews.Author: Jenny S
Reviews.Content: Visited last Saturday for the traditional TV GLOBO Fijoada, it was amazing, loved the show, food and service was excellent. Congratulations to all the staff! Very friendly staff and made me feel like at home. Will definitely go back to stay for at least one weekend! I have to go to that great spa! Jenn S

Reviews.Title: “TV GLOBO FEIJOADA”
Reviews.Author: arminator1124
Reviews.Content: Last weekend I had a great experience at the Intercontinental hotel in Miami while attending the TV Globo feijoada. I was really impressed with the beautiful view of our meeting room and it was so great to be seated right next to the Miami Bay in a beautiful sunny day. It was my 12th time attending this festival in Miami but by far this was the best one. There were 400 people attending the festival and when the buffet was served I was really impressed with the way it was set up and how easy it was to be served. the hotel staff was wonderful and very polite. Since the moment I parked my car until the moment I left the hotel I was treated like royalty. My daughter is getting married next year and I am planning to have her wedding party at this beautiful hotel. Ana Lucia

Reviews.Title: “Brasil Food”
Reviews.Author: Bruno F
Reviews.Content: I went to Brasil Food in Intercontinental Hotel. Its very delicius and nice place. Its realy nice hotel in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Fantatisc”
Reviews.Author: SMENEZES34438
Reviews.Content: Went to the Brazilian Food Festival last week and loved it. The food was great and the music was excellent. Being Brazilian I can say that it really excedeed my expectations. The best Brazilian food I had outside Brazil ever. The hotel is beautiful and the employees make you feel special. I live in Miami and always go to Brazilian festivals and this one was the best. Sonia

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Miami.”
Reviews.Author: Mountmellick
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience. We have stayed in many 5* hotels, this Hotel was outstanding. Spotlessly clean (and i am really fussy), beautifully situated with marvellous views, watching the cruise ships coming into dock. Their eye to detail was excellent, Elemis toiletries, fluffy large towels. I suffer with food allergies and the chef prepared some American soya pancakes, which were the best I have ever tasted. Nothing was too much trouble. My only regret was we didn't stay longer, but we will definitely be back. Cannot recommend this Hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great food not so”
Reviews.Author: Katnden
Reviews.Content: We had checked in to the Hotel InterContinental Miami on Thanksgiving Day prior to departing on a cruise. The room and view were fabulous looking for a place to eat on Thanksgiving we decided to eat at the hotels restaurant/ The buffet was sparse and the food dry, not worth the $40 plus per person. On the Friday after Thanksgiving at about 12 midnight a humming noise started up waking me up. After calling the front desk they up security and they said that there was a noise and they would ask engineering. To make a long story short I finally fell asleep and the front desk said they were sorry, but I donâ€™t know what the noise was. I would stay there again, only if the noise didnâ€™t!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: fdm-Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days, as an Ambassador Gold was treated to an amazing waterfront view overlooking the bay, with lots of extras that now feel as standard. Free wifi, water in room and staff that simply could not do more to assist. Bonus of having an Andy Warhol exhibition in the lobby and an ice rink that's open for the holidays. Hotel is busy, but I like the ambiance that it brings. Would be good to have breakfast included in price, but lots of places nearby. This was a pre-cruise stay and glad that I'm returning in a week for another three days.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: citygirl36
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved our stay here. Our room was exceptionally nice, as you'd expect from any Intercontinental, but this location delivered a little more than expected. The staff stood out to me as really superb. From the moment we arrived at hotel, to front desk (thanks especially to Leo), to room service, they really went above and beyond. I spend almost a quarter of the year in hotel rooms for business travel across the country, and Intercontinental Miami ranks among the top in my opinion. The only thing I can't vouch much for is the location if you're in Miami specifically for touristy activities, you'd probably want to rent a car .. however, it's definitely a nice, safe location with very good restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special here. Too many other good options in Miami.”
Reviews.Author: Ga12345
Reviews.Content: Stayed here pre and post cruise. Staff was friendly, but overall hotel was a disappointment. For the price it is missing too many features (i.e. No bath robes, not enough towels, pillows, high charge for slow internet, pool bar/grill no open past 6pm, service fee + gratuity for room service - seriously?) Recent stay at downtown Marriott was better and same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very Fancy Hotel, friendly staff!! Food not so good :(”
Reviews.Author: steph86727
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Nov. 21-24 because I won a trip to Miami to see the Black Eyed Peas:) The hotel is very fancy, beautiful xmas trees decorated. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, I loved the push button for the blinds that was convienient:) Nice view of the pool and bay from our floor, we stayed on floor 27. Mini bar in your room, however if you move anything from it you automatically get charged for it, so do not touch lol bottles of water are provided for a charge of 8.50 so redicoulus!!! We had breakfast paid for each morning, we had the buffett, very greasy did not enjoy it at al. 59 bucks for 2 people again im glad it was paid for. what is with the 18% service charge in all restaurants in miami so retarded, they must think everyone is rich. The location of this hotel is great ! its right next to bayside market where you can go shopping for cheap and enjoy bars, however the bars are pricy. I didnt feel safe walking at night though cause a lot of crimes happen in that area, it would have been better if the company booked a hotel on south beach. I will not be returning to miami, I rather all inclusives where you can eat and drink whatever you want! improvements for this hotel: - should have free wi fi - bottles of water should be free - decrease the prices on drinks!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Janine D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business meeting last month and was able to rediscover a part of downtown Miami that I had not seen for years. Convenient to transportation, shopping, convenience stores,restaurants, etc. I had only one issue initially during my stay, and this was quickly and efficiently resolved by Kerry. The staff was friendly and helpful and made our stay most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room shame about food and beverage facilities”
Reviews.Author: njm11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as the chosen event hotel for Miami half ironman race at the end of October 2011. Write ups said the hotel was great. Not sure whether I stayed in the same hotel. First off the room was great. Bathroom was lovely. My only critisicm would have been that I would have preferred another coffee or tea Kurig pod or two but phoned and asked for them anyway. The food and beverage options for a 5 star hotel were absolutely awful. Where do I start. The bar menu and restuarant menu were in fact pretty much identical and were pizza, average pasta dish, paninis etc. We arrived late on Friday to be told by a member of staff (I shall come to her by name personally later) that the restaurant only had one server so we had to go to the bar. OK but this was supposed to be an event with over 2000 participants so you would think then would put on more staff. NExt morning - looking forward to breakfast - err no. Priscilla - the lady who really needs an atittude adjustment for working in a 5 star hotel - said that the restaurant was too busy and could we sit in the dark and unlit bar area. I said I wanted to walk around and see which I did. The restuarant was EMPTY!. I asked the very helpful server Juan whether it would inconvenience him if we sat in his area. He could not have been more helpful and welcoming. I went and told Priscilla that this was what we were going to do and she just looked at us blankly. Saturday night we ate out as we couldnt face Priscilla again and her attitude that we were an inconvenience in her pressing day! Sunday after the race I just wanted to eat and sleep. There was a buffet with pretty limited selection or the bar menu. Service was slow although the server was just maxed out and then the kitchen sent my burger and my boyfriend's pizza 15 minutes apart. This is a five star hotel with premium prices. Room nice, front desk staff friendly and excellent, room service staff good, greeter in restaurant terrible, food terrible. Very disappointed because I had always rated Intercontinental as an excellent chain. Amazing how one member of staff and an average food and beverage menu and experience can put you off a hotel completely.

Reviews.Title: “Faboosh Decorum!”
Reviews.Author: sld1205
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of at this hotel the weekend of 11/22/11. The hotel is located in Biscayne Bay close to the Port of Miami. I flew into FLL airport took the Go Shuttle which cost $21 to the hotel. The Hotel is beyond beautiful. Very comtemporary look, A lot of thought was put into outfitting this hotel with pieces (sofas, artwork, vases, etc) which displayed its welcoming vibe. The hoel was also beautifully decorated for for holidays with pops of purple and grey. The hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating. The room were very spacious with huge bay windows. The Hotel was located across from the Bayfront Park which had lots of shopping, restaurants, outside entertainment(jazz singers, congo players) and you could also take dinner/party cruises nightly. You also have additional shops and restaurants on the neighboring streets. The hotel restaurants may be a bit pricey but you have access to tons of choices steps from your front door. Another plus there was free light rail system within 1 block of the hotel. There were local buses and cabs galore if you wanted other modes of transporation. Also several parking garages. Note take a cab from here to south Beach will costs you $17.50 All in all if you decide to stay here you are making a terrific choice. I have included pics to show just how faboosh this hotel is.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: gumbyandpokey50
Reviews.Content: stayed at the intercontinental downtown miami pre and post cruise, this is really a 5 star hotel, from the great greeting when you get out of the cab, they take your luggage out of the cab and than to the front desk, the door men are very friendly and will answer any questions you have and will help you with any problems, the hotel lobby is stunning with fresh flowers every where, they have a great resturant in the lobby and a star bucks, the front staff were very nice and always went out of there way to assist you, the rooms were big and very clean with nice flat panel tvs, the beds were very comfortable, the hotel is right downtown near the bay and a very safe and short walk to the bayside market, if we every go out of miami for a cruise we will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: NtombiKingston
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other hotels in Miami but we keep going back to Hotel InterContinental Miami because of the great service and location. The staff are always so welcoming and from arrival you are made to feel right at home. There are restaurants and shops within walking distance and a short cab ride away you can be in South Beach or at one of the large malls - that is if you feel you need to leave the hotel which has a pool bar, spa and restaurant/bar! Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “MySpa @ the Intercontinental Hotel Miami”
Reviews.Author: Mayabue
Reviews.Content: MySpa at the Intercontinental Hotel in Miami provides one of the most zen and relaxing spa experiences around. The spa facility has been planned out in the most thoughtful manner to ensure tranquility, relaxation and peacefulness. The locker room and bathroom are extremely neat and modern. Light all around is dim but warm. There is a nice lounge room with cascading water that is absolutely soothing. The massage rooms are spacious, beautifully decorated, with warmed beds whose height can be adjusted for the therapist. I had a full body Swedish Massage and facial by Edwitch. She was amazing. I fell asleep! I also had a manicure and pedicure by a very professional specialist that paid attention to the most subtle detail. I highly recommend this place. Seldom do I feel so motivated to make recommendations. But in this case, it is well-deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Big, busy and needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: saopaulo36
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time at the Intercontinental in Miami. All of them attending a banker's convention. The hotel is big, very busy with conventions and events and definetly needs to be updated. Personally I don't like hotels as big as that as they tend to become very unpersonal. The rooms are old and even though they have changed the carpet, they look outdated and mine in particular was smelling cigarette and "cheap" perfume. Despite that, the room is big and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom was updated and has a very good shower. Unfortunately as most american hotels, the windows do not open and as the fresh air cannot come inside the bad smell gets worse and worse. Location is good if you are working, otherwise there are much better ones in Miami. Staff was nice but could be more helpful. Maybe because the hotel was so packed with people. Room service is outstanding, though.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the MySpa Fitness Center”
Reviews.Author: ponykrash
Reviews.Content: I work in Miami Center; the Hotel adjoins the office tower via connected lobbies. This review focuses mainly on the spa/fitness center facilities, from the perspective of a regular member. About a year ago, I joined the MySpa Fitness Center, and have been so pleased with my membership there. It's a great place to stop in for a workout or to relax in the steam room, sauna, or poolside. One of the unique and fantastic aspects of the gym is that they provide your work-out gear: shirt, shorts, socks, shoes, and sports bra for ladies.
