This is a HUGE convenience both for regulars, and for travelers who don't have to pack bulky sneakers and work out clothes. Recently, the Fitness Center sponsored a fun contest to award the person who visited the gym the most times before Thanksgiving. That extra motivation to get to the gym helped me break through a fitness plateau and lose 5lbs! Great motivation! Catherine and all of the staff are friendly, professional, and a pleasure to see every day. The gym's cardio machines have televisions, and they face the windows looking out on downtown Miami and Bayfront Park. The windows provide nice natural light for workouts. Location: the hotel is located on Biscayne Bay in downtown Miami, bordering Bayfront Park. For business clients or people who are in town for litigation matters, I always recommend this hotel. I would also recommend it for people who are planning to cruise out of the Port of Miami, or attend events at the American Airlines Arena. The causeway that takes you to South Beach is also nearby. Gym and spa, overall: For my colleagues and friends downtown, I would not hesitate to recommend the fitness center. The ambiance of the spa facility is very relaxing. The fitness center, while not huge, has a good variety of free weights, weight machines, and cardio machines. The gym provides plenty of fresh towels, plus the work-out clothes, and the use of a locker while you work out or get a massage. Price: The price of the membership is fair; the spa services also seem to be priced about the same as other hotel spas, but MySpa often runs promotions that make them an especially good deal. They also have packages which include monthly massages and other services. While I have not opted that that, the prices for those memberships are also fair. The showers are stocked with soap, shampoo, conditioner, and shaving cream. I don't like the smell of the shaving cream, but that's about my only complaint. The other aspects of the hotel that I can review are the restaurant in the lobby, and the cafe by the pool. At the restaurant in the lobby, I have had the buffet lunch, which is not cheap, has a good variety, whether you want to eat light or have a feast. The food at the cafe by the pool is just OK (I had pizza), but it is enhanced by the amazing view of the bay and port. I would recommend it, just for that reason. Get a window seat. Thanks so much to the Hotel Intercontinental, and MySpa, for being an essential addition to my health routine and my daily life!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin P
Reviews.Content: My hats off to the staff. From the doormen to the spa service; the InterContinenal in Miami has a team of professionals. Thanks for making me feel right at home!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but Busy”
Reviews.Author: kminohio
Reviews.Content: Lovely, large hotel with great bay views and obviously popular with the business crowd. A bankers' convention was in residence during my overnight stay which meant hundreds of suits in the lobby and waits for everything...a wait to check in, a wait until the room was ready, a wait for my bag to be brought up once it was. But the large marble bathroom, updated decor and marvelous views made for an enjoyable stay in spite of the crowd. Suggest asking about occupancy rate if you're planning a relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: RuralMA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight for a business trip. I showed up a little after 3 and was told check in time was at 4 and they asked for my cell to call me when a room was available. They called me about 3 minutes later, so not a big deal, but I've never had that happen at a major hotel before. Room was nice, though the chair that went with the desk wasn't exactly a desk chair (more of a dining table chair) and wasn't very comfortable given the height of the desk and the straightness of the back. They also charged a premium for higher speed wireless - $11 for "standard" 512k speed, and like 18 for 2mb speed, which I thought was lame. great view, good location next to the water (I was in room 1108). The bathroom hadn't been completely cleaned if you looked closely, but again, it was minor. Had breakfast in the hotel restaurant - food was acceptable, service was polite but horribly slow - I kept having to flag down the waiter for more coffee, to place the order, for the check, etc. overall, it was OK but I'd probably stay somewhere else next time. Based on the reviews I read of the hotel restaurant's dinner I ate at Area 31 a few blocks away, which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thephoenix77
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for a couples nights before the Rick Springfield Cruise. The staff were amazing, eager to help and definitely knowledgeable of the area and its amenities; right from the porter thru to the concierge who do all the extra curricular booking etc. The room was extremely clean, very spacious, and had a good view (back corner so some bldg and some waterview). I had meals in both the dining room (great food but pricey), the swordfish is awesome as well as at the lounge. The bar-tender is a very funny guy and sure knows his stuff. Thanks for the education on different rum drinks!...all in all ... great hotel and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Newly updated”
Reviews.Author: wawachu
Reviews.Content: The hotel was newly renovated and we really liked their new furniture, new lighting fixtures, new carpet.....the entire hotel feels modern and luxurious. Our room was spacious and has a view of the water. The automatic window treatments were very unexpected and such a wonderful surprise. Lots of attention to details: from the floral arrangement in the lobby to the grommets on the shower curtain, everyone was well thought out and stream-lined. Front desk and concierge were both super curtious. The security and bell staff were very helpful and not only pointed us to the closest attractions and stores, but also walked with us a little to make sure we were in the right direction. There is a Walgreens and CVS close by, with in 10 minutes walking. One negative thing that made this trip a 4-star was the room service: we ordered breakfast and it took them over an hour to deliver it. We called twice to check on it. By the time we got it, it was cold, and overcooked. We did not get all the items we ordered. And when we called a third time to request some ketchup, it took the staff over 20 minutes to get it to us. Otherwise, it was a good hotel and we would definitely stay there again. Especially when the NBA lock down is over (if ever), because the hotel is only 5 minutes from the basketball arena.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheDibbs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel in Miami with another couple, for three nights at the beginning of November. All four of us are very easy going people who are easy to please. We booked the hotel through Priceline, Name Your Own Price. When I looked into the hotel's website I was happy to see that the Hotel was located in the Bayside area (perfect for shopping and restaurants and next to a large park) and that they had a pool and gym. The website said that check-in was at 4:00. My first impression of the hotel was that it was quite beautiful, the lobby was expansive and contained very pretty art and furniture. After a very long flight and multiple bus rides to get to the hotel, I was definitely ready to unpack and unwind. Upon check-in (we arrived around 4:30, 30 minutes after the rooms were supposed to be available) we were told that there were no available clean rooms, and that we would need to check back in an hour and a half. Well I wasn't very happy about that, but knew there wasn't much we could do about it. They let us leave our luggage with the concierge, and we went to explore the area and wait for our room. We were told that we would receive a call when it was ready. We never did receive a call, but showed back up at the hotel around 5:45 and the rooms were ready. We never did receive any apologies for the inconvenience. When we entered our room, 2015 (on the 20th floor) I was pleasantly surprised by the beautiful partial view of the ocean and rooftop pool (5th floor) surrounded by lounge chairs and a walking path. There was a very nice flat screen television on the dresser, as well as a very comfortable couch and small table. There were a couple things that we were very impressed by. The dark blinds on the windows were electric and could be raised and lowered by a button on the nightstand. Quite convenient if you want to sleep in! The bed was also very comfortable, and the pillows fantastic! We were so impressed by the pillows that we looked at the brand, Pacific Coast. My husband and I have decided to buy a couple, the website was on the pillows as well, pacificcoast.com, and they were down pillows. I haven't slept that well in a very long time! We were also happy with the bathroom, it was large and very pretty and clean. Loved the double shower heads, but wasn't very happy with the water pressure, it was far too weak. The room was kept very clean as far as I could tell. Every day we would go out and shop and eat, and when we came back the bed was made, trash emptied and fresh towels put out. I only have a couple complaints about the hotel in general. My husband and I were disappointed to go down to the 5th floor to work out, and find that there was a $15 per day per person charge if you wanted to use the gym. That was very surprising! We later found that there is also a charge to use the wireless internet. After returning home I did find out that it is listed on the website that there is a charge, but it seems absolutely pointless to me. The fact that I'm paying for the room should pay for the gym and internet, it seemed that the hotel was nickle and diming for everything they were worth. The only other thing that we weren't happy with was that the lobby of the hotel was used for some type of red carper formal event every night we were there. Walking back from Bayside every evening we really felt like we were intruding by stepping into the hotel and walking by people stepping out of limos and wearing fancy ball gowns.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MyAngelRCC
Reviews.Content: I was a guest of the InterContinental Miami from 22 September â€“ 25 September 2011. This was the first time I had stayed with this hotel chain and it most certainly will be my last. The first night I stayed at the hotel was uneventful as I had to work and immediately came in that evening and went to sleep. The second night was a different story. While using the rest room I noticed a roach of some sort that was at least 1 inch long and about a half inch wide. I was disgusted to say the least as I do not have roaches in my own home nor do I care to bring any into my home after staying at a filthy hotel. My husband killed the bug and I sent on about my business. The next day, there was another roach on the bathroom towel in front of the shower. Again my husband killed the bug. We proceeded to go with our day as planned and upon our return, things went completely downhill. Whoever had been assigned to clean our room did a poor job. A used washcloth was left on the chair in front on the desk; the facial tissue box was left on the dresser, empty (the tissue box had originally been in the bathroom where it belonged). When I went into the bathroom, I was again greeted by what I thought was a third roach, only to find out that it was the roach that had been killed earlier that day. It appears the house keeper shook the bath mat out refolded it and placed it back on the tub, leaving the dead roach in the MIDDLE of the bathroom floor. Upon inspection, it was discovered that the house keeper had refolded the original bath mat that had been there earlier and replaced it on the tub despite that fact that it contained remnants of the dead roach that was left lying on the floor. Needless to say I was completely disgusted! I informed my husband who then told me there was another roach that he had killed on the day of our arrival that he not told me about for fear I would freak out. That is now a total of 2 huge roaches. I immediately went to the front desk to inform the clerk who snickered and asked me what I wanted her to do. I was taken aback, first off snickering if not an appropriate response and she should have been the one making suggestions, not I. I asked for the manager and was informed she was busy, I told her I would wait and she eventually went and got her. I spoke with the manager who was apologetic and offered to switch my room. I accepted and went to move my belongings. Once we arrived at our new room, on the same floor as the original room, I decided to inspect the room first. Boy was I blown away but this filthy hotel, I had no idea it could get worse. The new â€œcleanâ€� room I had just checked into had trash in the trash can (I thought emptying the trash was standard) and in the bathroom I was greeted with a tub that was so filthy there was a very visible dirt ring around the tub. How gross! I had my husband check to see if it were a stain or actual dirt and as it was rubbed the dirt came right off. I was done! How can the house keeper not notice a visible ring around the tub? When was the last time the tub was even cleaned? I was appalled! I went back to the front desk to speak the manager again, she cringed when she saw me coming and said she hoped everything was okay with the room. I informed her of the condition and she offered to have the room cleaned immediately and she offered me and my husband a drink coupon at the hotel bar. I can only guess that she was hoping when I returned to my room I would be too drunk to notice any of the dirt. Had this not been my last night at the hotel, I would have checked out immediately! I will never return to this filthy hotel. I felt like I had checked into the local motel with free parking and $30 rooms and not a 4/5 star hotel with $36 a day valet and $230 a night rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience with a 10yr. and12 yr.old.”
Reviews.Author: migster1968
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful by the water. We had a wonderful experience. The staff was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST spa experience !!”
Reviews.Author: Tattyana P
Reviews.Content: I love spas , and this year my friends presented me at my birthday with a My Spa gift certificate from Intercontinental Hotel. I had the best spa experience , wonderfull atmosphere and service. The staff were very friendly and professional and the massages , uhmmmm , i felt in HEAVEN !!! At the pool area they have this very nice and cozy restaurante with a beautifull view to the bay . I'm looking foward to a daughter and me day at the spa. Planning my next visit very soon !! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice but certainly not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: lebnv
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Intercontinetal for a business conference. The conference facilities were quite nice (although the A/C was up much too high the first morning, but was soon fixed) and we had our lunch breaks at the Indigo restaurant in the lobby area. I did have a lovely view from my room of the bay which was the highlight of the room. The room itself was comfortable but looked worn. There were a view stains on the one upholstered chair in the room and on the coverlet of the bed. The walls were a bit beaten up and the mold in the bathtub was not what I would expect at a hotel of this caliber. I also had a bit of a drainage issue with my shower the first morning which I reported to the front desk staff. It seemed to be fixed by that evening, but the problem returned the next day. The walls and ceilings seemed incredibly thin and I could hear the room above me even though the people seemed to be speaking at a normal volume. Housekeeping seemed lacisdasical at best. The little coffee pot in the room was never cleaned (hey I'm more than happy to clean up after myself, but come on), the tissue cover was placed on the bathroom counter, without any tissue to cover, the room overall just didn't feel very clean. In keeping with a "luxury" hotel the prices were outrageous for internet access and the room service prices (I had a very early flight and decided to stay in the last night) were utterly ridiculous. Overall the hotel is very nice in its common areas and its location is ideal. The staff I dealt with were very nice for the most part so thankfully I didn't have some of the issues that other reviewers noted in regard to the staff, although I did not get the impression that the staff was very interested in going the extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service for a deluxe level hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gustavo S
Reviews.Content: From the recepcionist at the check in through the waiter at the restaurant, me and my family (wife and 2 little children - 4 and 1 years old) were extremely terribly attended. Have to say that the cleaning service was also very disappointing. When you go to a hotel of such kind, you expect an outstanding service, which worths the price. It was definitely not the case of this hotel. Will never return to this hotel for sure. I have been already in other Intercontinental hotels around the world with good service, but this bad experience made me decide to not stay any longer with this brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Flantastic-Four
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend. Loved the location at Bayfront and the views. Starbucks inside, easy to get car in and out. Rooms were clean, lobby is nice to sit in. Very good hotel overall and good value. Will stay here again. Couple Miami food trucks at Bayfront during the week, we walked over for lunch, was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with TipTop service”
Reviews.Author: mortonedwin
Reviews.Content: It was a great pleasure to stay at this hotel whilst visiting Miami from the Uk for the Make A Wish Foundation Ball last week. The room was excellent/spacious and the food and whole stay way beyond expectations.We look forward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel - not sure about pleasure”
Reviews.Author: dd0443
Reviews.Content: Maybe a 3.5...At least during the week, this is a conference/meeting hotel. On the plus side, great views from the upper floors, location is right on the water and rooms are good size. Always a fan of the automatic, full light blocking curtains too. The average: Rooms were solid. The below average: elevators were frequently scarce, not sure why it can take a few minutes to get an elevator. But my biggest issue with places like this, one that for me takes away from any sense of loyalty to a hotel or chain: the $17 internet charge is annoying, but unfortunately not uncommon. The hotel charges $15 a day to use the fitness center--in Miami, where it can get too hot to exercise outdoors! And the fitness center is nothing special, what you'd expect for 'free' at an Intercontinental. Bottom line is that I was unimpressed enough to look elsewhere if I have to foot the bill in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Fimpsy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at this wonderful hotel in downtown Miami. The hotel is in a great location right on the bay and as itâ€™s a triangular shaped building, you have either city views or bay views. When booking my room I specified Iâ€™d like a bay view room which I received on the 7th floor. The views across the bay were spectacular and during my stay I managed to view a Manatee swimming past as well as dolphins jumping in the bay. Most impressive! As my stay was leading up to Christmas, the hotel was tastefully decorated and there were even displays of gingerbread houses. The lobby and reception area are very inviting and a great place to hang out while waiting for friends. Thereâ€™s even a Henry Moore sculpture in the lobby too. The hotel has a breakfast buffet which costs $22, which I found it was quite good value for money as there were plenty of options and enough to fill you until dinner time! The restaurant was also quite good. The rooms are well proportioned and nicely maintained. All the usual little luxury items in place as one would expect from this hotel. The bathroom was large and plenty of towels were at hand. Beds and sheets were all comfortable. As I already mentioned, the views are great, and you can even sit on the windowsill and read if you so wish. My only complaint is paying for wifi for the rooms (there is a Starbucks with free wifi in the lobby). I paid for the wifi package but it only covers one device, the one which you log onto first. If youâ€™re buying the wifi add on, make sure you log on with the device you wish to predominantly use. I enjoyed my stay at the hotel so much that Iâ€™m returning for a second time this coming December for three nights again before a cruise. Iâ€™ve chosen to upgrade my room to one above floor 24 to enjoy the views across the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Prime downtown location!”
Reviews.Author: oyebeli
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is conveniently located in downtown Miami adjacent to Bayfront Park. Bayside is a few steps away and the people over can take you to Brickell for more dining choices. The property has undergone extensive renovations and the floors and rooms are nicely renovated. I always refer business travelers to this property for its great location and value. The restaurants within also offer delicious fare and the property has its own Starbucks. I would highly recommend the Intercontinental for business and leisure. Families would like the park and all of the shopping amenities around Bayside and Flagler.

Reviews.Title: “not great for families or those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: krepki
Reviews.Content: I would probably not stay here again. There were several major problems. First one was $36 per night for valet parking. Perhaps some people are accustomed to it, but to me that is excessive so I will go elsewhere for value. The second was inadequate elevators. This is a major pet peeve of mine. I cannot say whether our long wait was due to temporary malfunction or an inadequate number of elevators for a tall building, or both. There are too many other alternatives for me to take the chance again. My son and I walked down 13 flights of stairs with luggage, due to the long wait and crowds waiting for a working elevator. Third reason is that the pool, although generously heated, sits in the shadow of other high-rises most of the day. Fourth issue, no free work-out area. Lastly, there were no board games available for families to check out like there are at other hotels such as the Marriott in Doral. The hotel could invest $50 or $100 in games, but perhaps they don't wish to cultivate a family clientele. There were many nice things about staying at this hotel such as location and ambience, but they were overrided by these factors.

Reviews.Title: “Race for the Cure Weekend”
Reviews.Author: tom_b_sanders
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay at this hotel, and we love the location since it is directly across from the main concourse of the Miami Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure and across the street from a MetroMover platform. The hotel has a comfortable, spacious lobby with a restaurant, bar and Stabucks. The MetroMover makes an easy trip from the hotel to eating places in and near Mary Brickell Village, and we also went to a new wine bar, Kork, for happy hour on Friday that is located close to the South Miami Ave MetroMover platform. Saturday we enjoyed the company of the hotel's bartender, Florangel, out at the pool bar where she served us Bloody Marys (she talked us into a second!).

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: mindy r
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago, my husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel MIami. This was the first time we had actually had the opportunity to enjoy the entire hotel and it was in honor of our birthday month. From the moment we arrived we were greeted by the staff and directed to the front desk area. We were so impressed with the grandeur of this lobby. The front desk staff immediately greeted me by wishing me a happy birthday which I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel room had a great view and I immediately noticed I had been treated to the most appealing and delicious birthday cake compliments of the Intercontinental. I treated my husband to a spa massage and have to say the ambiance was professional and great, I even got to enjoy the amenities of the spa. Thanks for the wonderful stay and we will certainly recommend your property to others!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but great location and nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Milo_and_Spooky
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a nice location. Very short walk to Bayside and Bayfront Park, and close to the Metromover. Rooms are clean and quiet. However, for the price I paid, it would have been nice if the WIFI or at least the breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Great newly renovated rooms!”
Reviews.Author: the_traveller_a_b_c
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times, primarily because of its very central location. This time however, I was not expecting to stay in a brand new room!... Service was very good no doubt, but now they have new rooms to go with it.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!”
Reviews.Author: Stacy B
Reviews.Content: A couple days ago, my husband and I stayed at the Epic Hotel. This was the first time that his company decided to book Epic Hotel for their annual conference in Miami. We were very excited to stay in a brand new property but it was a bad decision. As far the Hotel infrastructure, Epic Hotel is a beautiful building with a spectacular view. But the hotel staff is far to be friendly and helpful, in a few words: an "Iced Tower" During our stay, we visited the Intercontinental Hotel located 2 blocks away from Epic, we got so much impressed with the lobby and most important with the people, starting from the doorman to the restaurant server. I have never experienced before such a warm hospitality and friendliness. My husband is a crazy mojito lover and we can say that we had the best mojito of our lives. In our way back to the Hotel, a very nice gentleman, who was cleaning the carpet in the middle of the lobby, saluted saying to us "Thank you.. and please come back again" Definitely we will come back! Thumbs Ups Intercontinental!

Reviews.Title: “MUST STAY”
Reviews.Author: aussiesglobetrotters
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Australia for my friend's birthday and stayed at the InterCon Miami. All it took was a quick comment about the birthday girl and they took such good care of us!! We were upgraded at the desk and given a room with a beautiful view, received a birthday cake from the Chef, a card and a bottle of wine from the restaurant team straight away!! The room was fantastic and the staff very attentive and helpful...The concierge team assisted with great tips and club passes for the birthday celebration as well as great deals on car rental. We didn't get to use their SPA but it looks amazing!! Now that we think back, we should have taken advantage of it... The bus stop is right in front of the hotel and it takes 10 minutes to get to South Beach or Coconut Grove. We loved everything about the hotel. Not staying anywhere else in Miami!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel---but there on a bad day”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior-FL
Reviews.Content: Before I begin, based on the other reviews and one of my own previous stays, I don't think my experience was typical. Hopefully for the hotel, I just landed there on a bad day. First, the hotel is very nice. The entry way and lobby are immaculate, and the front desk staff was incredibly helpful. My room was spacious for an urban hotel and the black out shades made it a great place to sleep. The physical space of the hotel is very upscale. Room service food was adequate, though very expensive. The nearly $9 bottle of water in the room is just dumb and excessive. Now the downside. On the first night I was there, the shower had almost no water pressure, then on the second day, there was no hot water. When I called the front desk, they offered no help and no explanation, other than it was a bigger problem impacting most of the hotel. Strangely, my sink only had scalding hot water. Furthermore, I nearly missed my flight after a 20-30 minute disaster in the valet line, when for some unexplicable reason, the valet manager decided to block the entire road to let a few people unload entire carloads of bicycles, essentially holding up about 20 cars trying to leave. Again, I accept the likelihood that mine was a rare experience. That being said, I will likely try out another hotel next time I am in downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Staff went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: elaineboorstein
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in, as my husband was unloading our luggage my eight year old daughterâ€™s fingers got caught in the hatchback as he closed the door. As a mom, I was standing there comforting my daughter and hotel staff immediately came down to check on her and called EMS to make sure she was OK. After it was determined there were no broken fingers we headed up to our room. Shortly thereafter someone showed up with cupcakes and a carafe of milk. I received two phone calls that night asking how she was. The following morning, I received another call checking in on our daughter. As we headed out the door to explore Miami, the doormen flocked to us to see how she was doing. That afternoon, we received another gift of cookies, milk and a My Little Kitty toy. A manager came up to check on her as well. Now to the room. It was lovely and comfortable. Customer service was excellent. I could go on and on. Beautiful hotel, but more importantly, they know how to deliver customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding room - outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: G M
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping service was awesome and renovated room outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Nice big room”
Reviews.Author: retiredlady07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before we left on a cruise Decemberf 4, 2010. The room was very large, clean and modern. We had a bayside room and we loved it. There was 4 rooms of us checking in and there was no delay. When we woke up the next morning we could look out and see the cruise ships. We could walk to several restaurants. There was a playground park nearby that we walked too. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “True Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Peter P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend to celebrate a special occasion. The staff is incredibly attentive and goes above and beyond to help you out at every turn. As you walk in, the expansive lobby bascially takes your breath away. It is such a gorgeous lobby that the expansive space is hard to take in at first, so don't feel silly if you keep staring at the lobby and ceiling to really appreciate the ambiance. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very spacious. There was a recent renovation to the rooms and not once did we hear any construction noises. I can certainly say that one of the most memorable moments of my stay waking up to a panomaric view of the ocean, sitting on the window ledge and watching the cruise ships sail by. All in all, we had a truly amazing stay. From staff to locale to amenities, there is nothing, absolutely nothing I would have changed about the time I spent at the Intercontinental Miami. You truly feel rejuvenated when entering the hotel. I give a million thanks to the Intercontinental for making my trip to Miami one I won't ever forget.

Reviews.Title: “Services for a working mom”
Reviews.Author: J P
Reviews.Content: The manager and staff on the Club Floor went above and beyond to help me, as an attendee of a conference, and not even a guest with a room. I needed to use a breastmilk pump, and they gave me a room and were beyond courteous and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to any mother who needs to travel for business or pleasure, based on my own experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lourdes Villanueva - 28th wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: lourdes v
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel to celebrate our 28th wedding anniversary and they couldn't have made it more pleasant for us. The service was outstanding. The room was clean and the view was amazing. The concierge helped us with the restaurant reservation and the ameneties. Overall I strongly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay during a very special professional moment of my life”
Reviews.Author: Jose B
Reviews.Content: For almost after 8 months of preparation my Big day came. I was set and ready to perform at the Blue Martini Brickell in Miami, FL to unveil my newest Video to all South Florida Wedding and Special Events Industry. I immediately though of how important was to me to stay closer to the venue. A place that will give me the comfort, the peace of mind, the track and the gym to workout prior to the big moment, the comfortable Bed to nap, the spacious and clean bathroom to shower and prepare to conquer my dream presenting my new product. I found it all and more(a bottle of Champagne and delicious Strawberries covered in melted chocolate). That was a very surprising and delightful detail form their Management knowing ahead how important was to me that day. They showed that they care, and I appreciate that. I went all smiles to get my car and drive to the place of performance that evening. From the Valet Parking, to the Front Desk, to Pool/Gym/Spa, to the Restaurant/Bar: it was all very pleasant. I will definitely stay over again since they're proven to deliver excellence to their Guests. I highly suggest you to live the experience. I endorse The Intercontinental Hotel Miami. I can't think of any other better place since I lived the best and will want the same again. Jose Betancourt Jr.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soledad G
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a two day conference at the Intercontinental in Downtown Miami and I was extremely pleased with the service they provided. From day one they made me feel that I was at home. The room was beautiful on a high floor just like I had requested it. Mr. Rosello at the concierge desk was extremely polite and professional. He helped us with transportation, breakfast at the hotel on the 29th floor with an amazing view of downtown Miami. I will come back 100% to this hotel again. Thank you Intercontinental for making my stay such an awesome stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and excellence!”
Reviews.Author: Mkahramane
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Intercontinental hotel. As usual, we had an amazing time. Intercontinental has some of the best customer service I've ever experienced. Everyone is very kind and helpful. They are going through renovation, we had the pleasure of staying in one of their renovated suites and it was super. Everything was brand new: Flat screen TVâ€™S, new carpet, electrical blackout and sheers, the bathroom was well remodeled and well done with the new shower heads, they have two shower heads, the cabinets and the closet was big enough to host enough luggages even if you are there for a longer stay. The new dÃ©cor is great despite of the previous one was very nice as well. Everything is brand new and top quality. The location of the suite was great. The staff is well groomed and cares about their guests and would say hello every time you pass by one of them and eager to assist you and ask if there is anything you need. Their concierge team is one of the best, always helpful and knowledgeable and familiar with the area and what needs to be done and will advise you and your family what could be done and what you will enjoy the most. Just ask and they will let you know and will direct you on how to get there and possibly will advise you what needs to be done. If it is food, they will suggest the restaurant depending on the type of food you are looking for, night life, directions, where to go, what to doâ€¦. so they are your encyclopedia when it comes to visiting Miami and area. Ask for Rosello and he will make it happen for you. The restaurant Indigo is also quite noteworthy. The buffet has a variety of great foods. The breakfast has a variety of food and the people there serving are very knowledgeable and want to help you even if they are not responsible of that section. We had breakfast both days we were there and they remembered us and one some even called us by name, that is service. The omelet cook was super great and not only just ask for the type of omelet you do wish to have by will engage with you in conversation so by the time your omelet is done, you still wish to keep talking to her, and if you are one of those that want to rush, they will even bring it to your table. They had a wide variety of fruits, yogurts, smoked Salmon, cheeses, pastries, cold and hot cereals and abundant of items on their hot buffet area good for vegetarians and non vegetarians and of course feel free to ask for assistance and if it is not there, they would make it for you. The lunch buffet is available on weekdays and it is one of the best lunches in Downtown Miami, everyday is different and certainly will enjoy it either on a business lunch or with your family and friends. The location, they are close to the Arena if you are ever there for a game or event held in there, walking distance to the small market, dining, entertainment 7 days a week. They are able 10 minutes drive from South Beach and again do not forget to ask the Concierge if you are looking for something special as they will give you the right information. Also if you wish to pamper yourself, go to their Spa, you will forget about everything else and you will certainly make your stay complete. I will definitely return to this hotel and anyone who is traveling to Miami should seriously consider staying at the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but worth money???”
Reviews.Author: TriumphTR7
Reviews.Content: At $200 a night, this is double the Holiday Inn a few blocks away. It is a very nice hotel but the nickel and diming is cheezy. They tried to charge me to use the gym, they charge for wifi, and they have the nerve to spam my voicemail with ads for their spa? I let it slide for biz travel but i wouldnt stay here on my tab.

Reviews.Title: “Just Awful”
Reviews.Author: john r
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of being stuck at this terrible hotel for three nights at a recent conference. If a rude, snotty staff that alternates between ignoring you and sticking their hand out for a tip- if a place that charges you $40.00 a day to park your car-if a clip joint that adds a $4.00 a day charge to your room "for cleaning" is for you-in other words if you have more money than brains or taste, you will love this dump. Although you might just want to stand out on Flagler throwing your money in the air and hitting yourself over the head with a hammer-I guarantee you'll have more fun than staying at this pile of junk. J. R.

Reviews.Title: “One word - excellent”
Reviews.Author: Karen M
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days during a work-related conference. The service was impeccable. Every employee I encountered was friendly, helpful and genuine. The hotel was very clean. The meeting space was great - temp was good, food was great. I would come back and stay again for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but could be better”
Reviews.Author: callchris321
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the intercon Miami for two nights Nice hotel though the usual glass and marble design though the Henry Moore sculpture in the lobby was nice to look at Room was ok though nothing special though facilities where good especially the leisure centre Service in the indigo bar was average at best and the menu choice was again pretty average Room service menu was also quite limiting and again in my view expensive and I really object to the 20% surcharge as well as the service charge they add Also coulnt work out why the bar only opened at 11am but you couldn't sit at the tables to get coffee earlier I was meeting a collegue for a meeting prior to meeting someone outside the hotel and in the lobby the furniture is not really that comfortable for that type of setting Not a bad hotel but have stayed at better intercons at a cheaper rate for 2 nights it's cost including breakfast plus two room service dinners and a couple of drinks in the bar over 800 bucks so you be the judge !! Great location though and staff where pretty friendly Also coffee at breakfast and the restaurant was again bloody awful thank god they had a Starbucks onsite

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice when Shopping in Miami”
Reviews.Author: eng_pablog
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, excellent location close to the Airport but far enough of the airplanes flying-route. Close to the Malls and to Walmart at Doral. The service at the front desk is expedite with nice personnel. Rooms are nice and big, really clean and comfortable beds, also de the bathroom is clean with good amenity kit and hot and good pressure water. The Breakfast buffet is fantastic you can find everyone choice to eat and with high quality attention of their personnel. Consider it is at Doral so is far away from Miami Downtown and Miami Beach but it is really easy to get to the highway. Really it is a real value price-quality hotel and it is my first option when going to Miami for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: twright71
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation in 12 years and we stayed two nights pre-cruise. The hotel met every expectation we had. Jean helped us with out luggage to our room and gave us recommendations that were perfect. When we come back we will not stay any where else. We love it.

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: gwera
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my wife's professional meeting. The hotel is in downtown Miami also near Brickell Key. The reception was poor because we almost did not get the room class we reserved (and paid) in advance. The bellman watched us drag our bags up to the checkin counter and then only after checkin did they offer assistance. We had an upper floor room with a nice view. The room and bathroom were spacious and modern. The walls are paper thin so we could hear the neighbors. We had drinks in the lobby bar which was enjoyable. Soap and amenities were average but there was a Keurig coffee machine in the room which is a major plus. Overall we picked the hotel because we got the convention rate at a well known chain and got what we expected overall. The location is far from Miami Beach so plan on a $20 to and from for dining and attractions in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible downtown Miami hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbritten20
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Miami is a great hotel, in an ideal location in downtown Miami. Mary Brickell Village is mere blocks away with shops, restaurants, and great nightlife, as is Bayside and the American Airlines Arena. My wife and I love staying at the IC because of the friendly, attentive and helpful staff, as well as the spacious rooms, breath-taking view of the bay and South Beach, a delicious buffet in the Indigo restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner, a private pool with adjacent bar and outdoor TVs, one of the best spas I have ever seen, a convenient Starbucks and gift shop in the lobby, and a quaint, private bar for an evening cocktail. Even though the Miami nightlife is constantly active and just steps outside the hotel entrance, the rooms are comfortable and silent. I couldn't imagine anyone being anything other than genuinely impressed with their experience at the Intercontinental. I have stayed there frequently and never want to leave..a truly remarkable destination.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 10/01/2011 thru 10/05/2011 (3) sisters one on business trip other two just hanging out. The room is very nice must have been recently painted (paint smell not bad)very clean when we arrived. The staff very friendly and accomadating. We did not have a bay view but the view overlooking the park and downtown was nice also. walking distance to the bay street market with lots of shops and restaurants. Starbucks inside which was very convienant. There are quite a few homeless down close to the bay just walking around but they never asked for anything or bothered us and we never felt unsafe. It was quite an experience for our first time to miami I would defintely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Indigo Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Lilia V
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of having lunch with Mr. Ysaac Nanin during the Rioja Wine & Food Festival and all I can tell you is that it was superb!! The service was excellent and the Spanish dishes were done to perfection. I really enjoyed the company and everything else. The Intercontinental Hotel Miami is a great place to stay and dine. Lilia Valdes from BNP Paribas Miami

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Roland V
Reviews.Content: I stay with my wife just for one nigth and i have to say it was just wonderful. The rooms are tastefully decor, the view from our room to the view was amazing, breathe taking. The staff is very lovely and professional, and i have to mention a wonderful girl who make our stay even better, She gave us a call to welcome us to the Hotel and said if we need anything just ask for it, and that is exactly what she did , i star asking just for slippers and in less then 10 minutes a nice gentleman bring it to the room and a few minutes later she call me back to see I receive the slippers, and everything we ask for it was the same excellen service ,let me tell you she make us feel like she was just there for us, Paula thank you so much for make our stay wonderful and i hope to hear you again when we come back .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Mrozelaar
Reviews.Content: The room has gone a mayor change, new decoration. Also the bathrooms have gone a mayor change.

Reviews.Title: “28th floor was clean and very good view of harbor”
Reviews.Author: mgspivey
Reviews.Content: Great staff and service...There is a great little Italian restaurant across the street which I highly recommend for dinner. It is far better than outside appearances give.

Reviews.Title: “Rioja festival at a wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Me0217
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were honored by the invitation to the Rioja Festival at the hotel. We had an amazing evening with wonderful hotel staff attending everyone. The whole event was put together with passion, you saw it in everything, from the food thatvwas served including the famous Diego's paella, to the fine wines we had.

Reviews.Title: “renovated very spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: klaus h
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last weekend with my family, we loved the newly renovated very spacious rooms. Sure, it isn't on the beach, but it's clean, has a beautiful restaurant for breakfast and a great bar for hanging out with friends. Beds were fluffy and comfortable and we had a great view over the Miami Harbor with Cruise Ships coming in and out!

Reviews.Title: “"A Night with Good Friends and Good Wine from Spain's Rioja Region"”
Reviews.Author: Hilda T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a wonderful evening at the Hotel InterContinental Miami. We attended the reception for the Rioja Festival and it was wonderful. We enjoyed excellent wines, delicious tapas all in a relaxed and elegant atmosphere with a live spanish guitarist who played beautifully. We enjoyed the night with great friends. Once again the InterContinental out did itself.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond service”
Reviews.Author: Lorie87
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in to the hotel the staff never ceased to amaze us. We had come straight from our wedding to check in before heading to our reception. The lady at the front desk noticed that we were newlyweds and upgraded us to an oceanfront suite. When we came back from our reception a bottle of champagne and truffle chocolates awaited us. The attention to detail was amazing, and they made a genuine effort to make our weekend extra special. The rennovated room was gorgeous and super clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The amenities were beautiful, the breakfast was amazing and the valet service was very quick. They have made long time loyal customers out of us and we can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Que Rico Rioja!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnaAMiami
Reviews.Content: When in Miami the Intercontinental Miami is a must! From the wonderful food, breathtaking views, friendly staff, and great new hotel room setup you can't go wrong when selecting it as your home away from home. Most recently I attended their Rioja event and was left speechless with the wonderful wines, tapas....and what can I say about the PAELLA....the highlight of the night. I will continue to be a loyal patron. :) - Ana Avila

Reviews.Title: “VibrantRioja Wine Festival's Opening Party”
Reviews.Author: iris b
Reviews.Content: As promised, The Hotel InterContinental really did come alive with the aromas and sounds of Rioja, Spain! Taking advantage of The Hotel's grand lobby as a backdrop for this wine and gastronomic event was ingenious! It was the perfect atmosphere to mix and mingle, while enjoying the excellent pairings of tapas and selected wines. Thankfully, the Hotel's first rate MySpa gym was waiting for me the next day! Massage anyone?

Reviews.Title: “Spain Comes to Miami...and it's very good!”
Reviews.Author: RickD777
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently attended the Rioja Festival Opening Party at the Hotel InterContinental Miami. Wow! Wines from Rioja, Spain, delicious and generous tapas, and the always friendly, courteous and professional staff at the InterContinental Miami made for a fantastic evening. The festivities run through October 1st, you don't want to miss this one.

Reviews.Title: “This is a first class Miami hotel with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: My experience at the hotel was fantastic. The room was very nice. The spa is world class. I have eaten at the Indigo mutliple times, and each time the wait staff is very attentive and courteous (our waiter, Vicente, at the Indigo was great). The concierge staff was so helpful and knowledgeable (much more so than the concierge service I am used to at other hotels). Their recommendations were right on and they were always available to help. My overall experience at the hotel was really first class.

Reviews.Title: “MySpa Oxygen Facial”
Reviews.Author: aliwadsworth
Reviews.Content: MySpa Oxygen Facial.... This was the most frustrating experience in the world. I bought this deal with 2 other girlfriends and we were planning to use the voucher as a group one day in September. We called 2 weeks before our scheduled appointment (first weekend of Sept) to book for all 3 of us. I told the receptionist that we had a Travel Zoo coupon and we needed 3 appointments at the same time. She booked us all for 1pm on Sunday, Sept 18th. On the Thursday before, I received a call telling me that "One girl's spa appointment was moved to 1:45". I called back to ask why she was re-scheduled. They said the made a mistake. Fine, we'll deal with not going at the same time. Then on Friday, I received a call from the spa telling me that all of our appointments were wrong. We were all scheduled for 30 min vs. 45 minutes. For that mistake, we would all have to be re-scheduled and there was no more availability that weekend. I said that's ridiculous... just because our appointments were input incorrectly, we will not sacrifice losing our vouchers. So, she said we could come at 5, 5 and 6pm on Sunday. I told her I would have to call my friends and get back to her. I did just that. 15 minutes later, I called back and asked her to book the 3 of us at 5, 5, and 6pm. Sunday, I showed up at 445 for my 5pm and the front desk told me that she did not have me down for an appointment. But if I could wait 15 minutes, they could get me in at 5:15. I told her I was confused because we had originally been booked at 1, then rescheduled to 5 5 and 6... She said that was impossible because they close at 6pm on Sundays... Now I was just livid. I had to wait 45 minutes for my appointment that afternoon... The treatment was just average. The woman talked the entire time about how fantastic she is at facials and that I desperately need it and I should come back to get all my facials done by her. Once my treatment was over, the girl at the front desk advises me that I was still booked at 1pm and she had to "refund" the cancellation fee she had already charged me.. Then I was forced to pay a gratuity on the service ($30 on a $59 voucher is ridiculous!!)... Next thing I know, today I check my credit card statement and I was charged the cancellation fee + the gratuity charge of $30... This is absolutely ridiculous. Intercontinental has completely TURNED ME away from them... I will not recommend them to anyone.. I am beyond irritated with how they handled everything...

Reviews.Title: “Excellency of service as expected!”
Reviews.Author: L1fe1sg00d
Reviews.Content: I am a part of hotel industry, working in Sheraton Suites, Key West. Thus I know what a high standard service is supposed to be and what I should expect of the hotels of Sheraton or InterContinental class. So at check in I was pleasantly surprised to receive such great attitude (I was checked in by Alyssa with her charming smile). Being a Platinum Ambassador and having experienced numerous hotels still I was pleased to be welcomed by this hotel in particular. Basically for us it was just a regular trip to Miami to get away from routine and get a good buzz. The way my and my friends' requests were handled was exceptional. Especially my crazy requests at 1 am for 7 lemons and limes - Han, thank you for your being patient! The valet service is very convenient for your car is ready and prepared for your trips. The rooms were wonderful - with a harbour view from the 23rd floor! - and spacious. Anyways we were not going to spend much time there, just to change in between our trips around the city. In Miami one can always find what to do, not just sitting in the room. Unfortunately we were too busy in the city to check out the lounge and the restaurant, but next time I stay there I will definitely do it. So my conclusion is, I will spend more nights in this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Our summer getaway /bus and personal”
Reviews.Author: marimatilla
Reviews.Content: i am impressed with the facilities and the staff.....The concierges were very helpful and friendly...I would recommend this hotel to everyone...Also, the location is great being in downtown close to Miami Beach!!!

Reviews.Title: “Appreciation of service”
Reviews.Author: Ralph R
Reviews.Content: I recieve your magazine regularly and have used it to inquire about different destinations. I had planned a weekend stay at the Intercontinental of Miami, for my wife's birthday. I had difficulty in securing a reservation on the same day to the Gabiano Restaurant that I had been to previously with my wife and truly enjoyed. I went to the concierges' desk and told Mr. Rosello that I had tried to obtain a reservation for that same evening and I was told they were sold out. He told me he would try. He some how obtained a 9PM reservation and when we arrived to my surprise they had our table with a beautifull arrangement of flowers for my wife compliments of Mr. Rosello. I can't remeber a nicer gesture and it truly made the evening one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ralph C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed various times in the last couple of years. We experienced amazing customer service starting from the parking staff, to the front desk staff and especially the Head Conciege by the name of Eduardo Rosello. He is a great asset to the hotel, went out of the way to treat us like friends and took care of us in every need that we had. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to enjoy the City of Miami to it's fullest!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Intercontinental--GREAT SERVICE & HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Rich L
Reviews.Content: i am impressed with the facilities and the staff.....The concierges were very helpful and friendly...I would recommend this hotel to everyone...Also, the location is great being in downtown close to Miami Beach!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff,average rooms and food”
Reviews.Author: ajnoone
Reviews.Content: I am an interconintal fan , and have been to many in the U.S. and Europe. This was by far my lowest experience. I checked in and failed to get my usual upgrade assured on my program. My room was ok, missing it's minibar, with poor housekeeping. The club lounge was not available, as booked. However as a gesture the hotel gave me vouchers for breakfast , which was average in it's hot food selection. The waiter (st John) I believe was exceptional, very friendly and chatty. However the star of the show was the head bartender(joey) was possibly the best associate I have ever encountered within Intercontinental hotels. She made incredible cocktails and recommended great apps for us to share after our late arrival. The lobby bar was badly in need of redecoration , but Joeys amazing attitude more than made up for this. Thanks Joey, we are trying your recipes later!

Reviews.Title: “Central location for business and leisure, panoramic views from Roomover Miami Cruise ship terminal”
Reviews.Author: CJMarbella
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference so good location for a business trip as only 20 mins from Miami International. On making my reservation I opted for upgrade on check- in which I was grateful for as I was allocated a superb room on the 25th floor and which had been recently refurbished. Some of my colleagues had older rooms and were not too impressed. Staff at reception a bit hit and miss but concierge very informative and helpful. Great marina and gift shops just a short walk away and you can take boat trips from there. The main shopping street is close by too where you'll find a Macy's, ss well as some good jewelry and electrical shops. It's not South Beach but it is good central location for a quick business trip or pre/post cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Day with the Hubby”
Reviews.Author: A_hui_hou_lifeisgood
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of spending the day at "MY SPA" located in the Hotel InterContinental. My husband & I are locals & thought it would be fun to spend the day at the spa & it really was. What a beautiful Spa! My 50 minute massage with Dimas was amazing, topped off with an express facial and lounging around the sauna & steam room was icing on the cake!!!! I highly recommend MY SPA to all locals & visitors alike :)

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: JMI75
Reviews.Content: Well located, nice rooms, service is good. They charge too much for internet access, garage, and gym.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but service inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: liz018
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in the hotel for a conference. Staff were generally helpful, especially the concierge and in the lobby restaurant. However, complimentary items such as teabags were not replaced after the first day and when requested; even though I was assured they would be. Hotel is in a good location, near Bayside and a range of restaurants and shops, although away from South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MustaphaEido
Reviews.Content: There were a convention for me at the Intercontinental Miami hotel so I stayed there for three unforgettable nights . I felt in love with that hotel since I entered the lobby and saw the lights and and the big stone . The receptionist was very nice and the room was very large with a nice view of the harbor the beds were big and comfy , complimentary coffee bags and bottle of water everyday . The bathroom was large enough for me .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely wedding”
Reviews.Author: tussle
Reviews.Content: We attended our cousin's wedding at this Hotel. Have to valet park which is $10.00.This is a huge lovely hotel with awesome water views. You can actually see the sweat on peoples faces as they sail by on their boats. While the wedding was very good the locations for the wedding vows and dinner/dance were just the usual hotel fare. Nothing out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LP1155019
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental in Miami with my family this summer and had a wonderful time. The location is prime and the hotel itself is beautiful and clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Will stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Ourselves”
Reviews.Author: J F
Reviews.Content: When the Priority Points add up, and we're near one of these top of the line hotels, we like to stay at Hotel Intercontinental. Beautiful property in the Port of Miami, with all the amenities you would want. Concierge was very helpful in getting us on a small group tour of the highlights of Miami & Little Havana. We had leftovers from dinner we wanted to put in the little refrigerator in our spacious room, but had to take out a couple bottles they had packed in there, which we put back.(we never consume anything in those pre-stocked fridges) The front desk called to confirm we were being billed for those, but they adjusted their records when we told them what we'd done- just needed some food to be kept cold. They did not charge us.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware - 4 stars is a very large stretch”
Reviews.Author: josatins
Reviews.Content: I frequent many Intercontinental hotels throughout the US and this location without a doubt is the worst I have seen, and quite frankly they do not deserve to fly the Intercontinental Flag over their hotel. This was not my first time at this hotel and had some problems with them in the past before they embarked on this renovation, but at that time I was told all issues (mold, musty, and very dated) would be resolved with the pending renovation, so I gave them the benefit of the doubt and stayed there again. Our stay started in one of their newly "renovated" rooms. While they claim they are completely renovating the rooms the bulk of the renovation is just lipstick. New carpet and furniture for the most part. Since we knew about the renovation we knew to ask for a room on a floor with no construction. The Front desk informed us that there was no construction on our floor and in fact all the rooms above us had already completed their renovation. Much to our chagrin this was a bold face lie, and we in fact had construction two floors above us, and it sounded like the construction was going on in the room next to us that is how loud it was. After talking to several people at the hotel, and once being told by a manager that I did not know what I was talking about in regards to their un-renovated rooms, we were presented with two options 1: move to an un-rennovated room or a larger room on a higher floor with the same amount of construction. Knowing how putrid the un-renovated rooms were, we decided for the later and took a larger room. We were placed in room 3221 that had one living area and one bedroom, while the size was overly adequate the finish and "renovation" leaves a lot to be desired. There were large gaps in the stonework in the bathroom that had a lovely growth of some sort and on several occasions bugs would come out or go into these gaps. With this being Labor Day weekend we figured that there would be no construction on Sunday and Monday morning, so we decided against switching hotels and just riding out a shoddy room. Well this was not the case, 9am on Sunday morning the drilling, cutting and pounding started, and the same went for Monday morning. The noise is truly unbearable, and one should be very cognizant of what is happening. Now onto the service...While the valet staff is one of the best I have ever experienced in Miami, the same does not ring true for the rest of the facility. The front desk lied to our faces saying all the construction was below our room, and then when called out about it denied everything. The manager who I briefly spoke with and wished I had written down his name was condescending and inept. When I was questioned as to why I do not want an un-rennovated room he found it hard to believe that I had been there before and he told me I did not know what I was talking about. It seems that the renovated rooms are actually not complete, since when looking for the mini bar we just found a note saying they have not received them yet, so you need to order up what you want. So besides being up charged for the mini bar items you need to order them, so if the midnight snack, night cap or spur of the moment drink is something you desire, forget about it you need to wait up to 45 minutes to get anything. This is not a big deal, but this is also not what can be accepted in a 4 star hotel. After the headache of dealing with this, we needed a drink and went out to get some ingredients on our own. When we got back to the room we went to get some ice, and noticed that the ice maker on our floor was broken. When I called room service to get a bucket of ice sent to the room, we were told it would be 45 minute wait and there would be a service charge as well. When I questioned this due to the fact that the ice machine was broken, I was served a nice plate of attitude and told the room service department has nothing to do with the ice makers on the floors so it was not their problem and I should call engineering. So we decided to try every floor until we found an ice maker that worked and it took 4 tries on 4 different floors. This level or service does not represent what Intercontinental Hotels are all about and IHG should take a serious look at keeping their flag on this hotel. So before you think you are getting a deal booking here, just remember no matter what you always get what you pay for. This is a 3 star hotel at best based on the facilities but 2 star hotel in regards to service. I have received better service at roadside motels. Everyone on the staff except for the Valet staff and their managers should be ashamed of the product they put on the market. There are a lot of options in downtown Miami and the Brickell area, and I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Locatioin”
Reviews.Author: Lump Inc
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before our trip back home and enjoyed our stay. Room and bathroom was very large. We had a very comfortable bed. The hotel is very beautiful and very well situated right next to Bayside Market. We had supper at Miami Hard Rock Cafe and did some shopping at the shops. The next morning we walked to Bayside Market again and had a wonderful breakfast at a local restaurant. Would recommend this hotel especially due to it`s convenient location. We were able to get this hotel through PriceLine for $90 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location...”
Reviews.Author: Travel_away_10
Reviews.Content: Close to the bay area. Enjoyed the stay. Very busy lobby, you could still in the lobby for hours and watch the activities of people going and coming and enjoying the lounge area. Room are as per standards. Large conference area for business workshop - very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to the IC Miami since the late 80's”
Reviews.Author: ozmerish
Reviews.Content: and the hotel is still impressive in its location and views over the bay. We were in room 2905 and had magnificent views of sunrise and the coming and going of the cruise ships from the terminal across the bay. Room was tastefully furnished and equipped with printer/fax machine, flat screen and all standard amenities one would expect from a business class hotel. Unlike some other reviews, our room was in good shape and not effected by leaks or mould. Should note, we did not have a glass door shower cubicle, rather a traditional tub with curtain. Staff friendly and helpful. This was especially so in the Club Lounge. Good to speak with knowledgeable staff. Everything from authentic Cuban dining to where the best parking on South Beach was located. Get out of the hotel and walk across to the market - especially at night. Music, dancing - a good vibe to the place. Others have mentioned the pool deck on the 5th floor. Get up there early and watch the sunrise. It's worth it. There's a direct line to Starbucks if you need a caffeine fix to help you through it! Only negative is the walk through the MySPA facilites to access the pool. Not a big deal, just prefer direct access. Minibar - Pain. It's a direct select/bill type system. Charges your room when the item is removed. Cant stand these systems. Prone to error and leaves no room for items I want to place in the fridge. All in all, we had a very nice 2 day getaway. Looking forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Liz-S21
Reviews.Content: It didn't appeal to my age group. It is mostly for families and people cruising. The room was spacious but I didn't like the color scheme. Made me feel drowsy. Efficient and consistent staff. The breakfast is AMAzzzzZIIIING. The pool area is nice but the spa is divine. Areas of interest is bay side. Again it didn't appeal to me Preferred South beach. I felt secluded downtown. Don't stay here if you want to be close to south beach it is 30mins if you take a taxi which is price approx 30dollars. The bathroom needs a little update and the decor is not even impressive. The only nicely decorated part of this hotel is the lobby. Oh and we had to pay for wi-fi internet acess which was a joke. 11 dollars per day.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: jhud3232
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at other InterContinental Hotels and this one was not up to par. The lobby area was very nice and the staff was extremely friendly which was a plus. However, the guest room was not that nice and the valets were hard to understand. The bathroom in the guest rooms was also rather dated. Overall, just an okay stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a real Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: Sdbsjb
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Intercontinental London and numerous IHG hotels, this one let's the side down. When booking our room, as a priority club platinum member i noted our request for a complimentary upgraded room, i requested this again in person at checkin to be told they hadn't had this request and then made no attempt to rectify when i profferred my membership card. Our room on the 17th floor was a little tired/dated with safe and hairdryer not working, also what were meant to be double beds certainly felt like 1.5s. We reported this to reception via their feedback card shortly after checking in but there was no attempt to communicate with us or rectify. When asked how our stay had been on checkout the lady at reception was clueless as to how to answer...not so good thanks. Good walking distance to the Bayside shops, bars and restaurants but watch the walk back if out late as the park between the hotel and stores fills up with the homeless/rough sleepers soon after dark. We would not recommend this hotel even for a 1 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was falling apart ... literally!”
Reviews.Author: Elietabet
Reviews.Content: We stayed in king deluxe harbor view, room 1104 and there was nothing good about it! Water spots all over the carpet everywhere! Mold in the bath tub! Water leaking from upstairs! A hole in the ceiling above the shower head! Mini bar fridge wasn't working! The staff responded in a timely manner but these things should have been taken care of before and never happened. The hotel staff is ok, I mean ok and not so excited when they see you. They looked and sounded indifferent and didn't care much if you stay at the hotel or not. Cab drivers in this city are so rude; we used about 9 cabs and all were rude! Get a rental car! Overall, we are not that excited about the hotel and might think about another hotel to stay at than this one when we come to Miami. Wasn't worth it at all to us!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Sergio_Veludo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, nice view, good restaurant and very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of overcharging”
Reviews.Author: NM2181
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is really nice, I cannot fully recommend it due to some glitches we had during out week stay. Hotel's location is great with nice scenery onto the bay. Not many shopping options, but the Biscayne Market is big and within a walking distance. Hotel is easily accessible even by public transportation. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted and our bag was carried inside (tip!), but then completely ignored until we left, when once again our little bag was carried a couple of stairs (tip again!). Hotel room was clean. However the cleaning lady threw us out of our room when we asked her to come later and she wouldn't accommodate. I specifically asked the front desk about the pool and fitness center, was told both were in the 5th floor with the MySpa-services and both were complimentary for us as priority members. This made us so happy, we decided to book some extra services (massages, manicure, pedicure) with MySpa. Totally overpriced and not worth it. I tried to visit the fitness center the next day after our treatments and was told that I need to pay 15 dollars in order to get in. I told the lady it was supposed to be complementary, she replied in a mean voice that although we were priority members I still have to pay. I told her to forget about it and left just to find she had charged our room anyway for the non-existing usage of fitness services. We were also charged for filling the minibar because their system said a bottle was removed from it. We never touched the fridge and already talked about this with the lady who came to our room and tried to fill the fridge. Otherwise we had a good time, the pool was nice and service at the pool really good. If all pool chairs are occupied, ask the pool guy about their secret stash of chairs:) Service at the bar and restaurant was really nice too and the concierge was ready to answer any of our questions. But the bad experiences left us still feeling we're not going to return to this hotel anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: wtraveler87
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great - especially for under $100! Stayed 1 night in July in transit. Cool lobby, pricey but good food in the hotel bar area. Check in was a bit slow. The pool on the roof is awesome!!! Great location within walking distance of the Bayside Marketplace (an outdoor shopping plaza) with lots going on, including restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great remodel and will be back”
Reviews.Author: AA4ME
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend for a short get away. Check in was smooth and easy as the line moved fairly quickly. Was able to get the room before the car was completely unloaded. Room was on the 31st floor and one of the remolded suites. Furniture is new and very clean. One thing to note.. sofa is not a pull out in the living room area, but they hotel quickly provided a roll away to our room. No mini bar in the room and no fridge either, with a small child that was the only issue we had trying to keep milk in the room. Didn't ask the front desk if one could be provided, so that option might be available. Employees seem to learn names quickly and acknowledged us throughout the visit. Not a "new" and shiny hotel with lots of bells and whistles, but a good location with a great staff that made it worth the stay. Definitely a service related hotel and even friends that walked over from the Marquis that was a couple of blocks away were impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to snuff”
Reviews.Author: blackjack1234567
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears exquisit as you approach it from the parking circle outside, and when you enter the lobby you are overcome by lavish stone everywhere. This feeling extends all the way to your room. The hotel has done a remarkable job keeping up appearances in the common areas. This is where it ends.. Upon entering your room you are created to a dark dark room, upon turing on the lights the first impression I got was that its more or less a standard hotel room with a few refinements such as rock top counters and rock based tile in the baths. I assume 10 years ago this hotel was the model of high end in Miami, but now its in need of help. Upon closer inspection of the bathroom, I found LOTS of mold living in the causing in the shower stall, I found mold and rust on the shower door. Now I am not exaggerating when I say my girlfriend decided to where her flip flops in the shower because of the mold. I on the other hand braved it out. The room itself was clean, the bed comfortable, however its my feeling that you can have a cheaper hotel room down the road at the Miami Hilton Downtown and at the older hotel you will not find any mold in the shower. This was actually my first stay at an ICH hotel in years, and probably will be my last for a while, you see I never forgave Holiday Inn for their poor maintenance either and it appears the apple does not fall far from the tree at Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jo W
Reviews.Content: Got a great price on this hotel through www.lastminutetravel.com - clean room & water view. Had time to take taxi to South Beach for the afternoon. Hotel has Starbucks and ATM inside. Room service provided quick service and good food. Enjoyed the walkway down to Bayside Marketplace, lots of shops, restaurants, ships. Would definitely stay here again before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “AAA Staff attitude but outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ancon
Reviews.Content: Once again, we visted the Intercontinental Miami for a short 2 day visit in Miami. Check inn was fast and efficient, greeted always with a smile from all staff members. Got to our room in the 29th Club Floor. Room was good size, but with a few housekeeping and maintenance ( AC, dust, etc.). Received a call on the second day from customer service to check if in good order. Had a long talk about the various issues that should be corrected, minutes later recieved a call from "on duty" manager to apologize for any inconvinience. This is a great attitude and shows that the staff cares about their customers. However, this hotel needs "urgently" and upgrade and Intercontinental should close it for a year and make major renovations because it needs them. Hotel Club room is nice for breakfast or Happy Hour, the 3 people working there are very attentive and caring and should be recognized. On second day, an elevator or two were not working and a crowd was always waiting to the elevator, that was not nice. Hotel is good location for those going to cruise ships in Miami port, or those needing to do something downtown. If you like great italian food, go to IL Gabbiano right next corner, its among the best Italian restaurants in Miami ( pricey but worth it ). For our part, I shall wait for t

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mira_quad
Reviews.Content: This hotel overlooks Biscayne bay and is clean, has fantastic service and just a cab ride away from South Beach. Great food, and shopping are right across the street! All staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, awesome location!”
