Reviews.Author: twisted_diva
Reviews.Content: Flew to Miami ahead of my husband, expecting to have him join me in a day or so in time for his speaking engagement, but as luck would have it, his flight was canceled on the day of his talk and there was no way for him to arrive in time to give it (thanks a lot, Delta Airlines!) so what should have been a mini-couples vacation turned into a mini-solo vacation in one of my favorite cities in the world. Having said all that, my husband and I are both Priority Club members so naturally our preferred hotel is the Intercontinental and this particular hotel did not disappoint. From the bellhop to the front desk clerks (esp. Alejandro and Robert) to housekeeping, all went out of their way to make my stay enjoyable and relaxing. My room was up on the 31st floor and had gorgeous views of Biscayne Bay and the Port of Miami. It was roomy and extremely comfortable and the water pressure of the shower head in the bathroom was excellent. The hotel's location can't be beat. The Bayfront Park Metromover's right down the street and is a great way to move around downtown Miami without the hassle of driving and parking. Take it to either Government Center Station or Brickell Station to transfer to Metrorail. Best of all, it's free! The Metromover, that is. Bayside Marketplace is within walking distance and is a great place to people watch, take a tour, have a mojito, shop or just take in the view of the Port of Miami. Unlike other Intercontinental hotels, however, this one does charge a fee for parking and for the use of the fitness center as well as the business center. Rather steep charges, I might add, for amenities that are gratis in other IC hotels elsewhere (the IC in Tampa, another favorite of ours, at W. Kennedy Blvd. for example does NOT charge for their fitness and/or business center). Other than that, it was a very pleasant stay and I can't wait to go back to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice precruise stay”
Reviews.Author: evcm1
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on Club Floor pre-cruise. Front Desk staff was so nice and accomodating allowing me to check in 3 hours early. Club floor selection for happy hour and continetal breakfast was great. Bedding very comfortable, we all slept well. Noon check out is a big plus. Hotel is primarily for business, but also for short pre-post cruise stay due to excellent location to Port of Miami. It's also ideally located across the street from the Monorail and only a short walk to Bayside market place. Pool area on small side, but nice w/cute restaurant overlooking pool and harbor. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the arena- but pricey and dirty”
Reviews.Author: aarmstr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for the Britney Spears concert. You can actually walk to the American Airlines Arena and it is a safe little area- so that was a huge bonus. Miami is pricey - so I expected to pay a ton. $36 for parking. Crazy. And if you have never been to Miami- almost every place includes tip- so do not pay extra! Our room had a great view but the carpet was worn and crappy. There was a dead roach in our bathroom on the counter (we were on the 16th floor). and the tub was old and gross. The restaurant in the lobby was overpriced- but the food was delicious. Staff was very nice. For Miami it is probably the best you'll get for the price. We paid $130 ish.

Reviews.Title: “Great memories! Let's go Heat!”
Reviews.Author: Islandbliss357
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in May to see the Miami Heat play. From the minute we pulled into the valet, I knew this hotel was going to be spectacular. Right when you walk in you are greeted by this open space full of foliage. The concierge desk was right in the Lobby, and the front desk reservations personal were very helpful. Walking to the elevators, you had to go under this light that reflected water on the floors. It was interactive, and the water would ripple as you walked. I thought that effect was so cool. Once we got up to the 8 floor, we walked into our room. Amazing! It was fully loaded with all the amenities of a 5 star hotel. My favorite part was the window bench. You could sit on this plush window bench and look at downtown Miami. The view from my room was insane. The pool was also equally amazing. With it being on the rooftop, and fully eqipped with 100% terrycloth towels for your comfort. The best part about this hotel is the fact that you are walking distance to all the shops, restaurants, and of course the American Airline Arena. It was so nice to be able to walk everywhere. Driving in downtown Miami is very stressful, and parking is next to none. So this was the very best hotel we could have asked for. The other best part of this hotel was the bellman. They were so friendly and helpful, and had smiles on their faces all day long. I will be a returning guest of this hotel for sure, hopefully for the play-offs next year!

Reviews.Title: “Good venue for conference”
Reviews.Author: Roly2
Reviews.Content: Spent 9 days here in June for a conference. Staff very friendly and couteous. Very comfortable rooms and well worth upgrading to the Club Floor as the catering the in conference was very limited. Lovely pool area and spa facilities to relax in at the end of the day. Only criticism would be the temperature of the rooms used for the conference - mostly set to freezer mode - very uncomfortable at times but the staff did their best to monitor it. Otherwise facilities good and AV support helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect from an Intercontinental Chain”
Reviews.Author: JennB30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location just a week ago for work. I am a loyal Intercontinental customer, I've stayed at Intercontinental all over- Korea, Bora Bora, Shanghai and of course several US locations and have always left very happy with the experiences. I definitely did not have a good experience at this location and do not recommend staying at this hotel. The hotel is certainly in need of a remodel (which wasn't a huge deal to me), the rooms are pretty clean, the bathrooms on the other hand are not as clean as I you'd expect (e.g. the glass doors to the shower were dirty with soap scum) I've always found Intercontinental staff to be very helpful and very customer oriented. Not one employee I came across was particularly helpful. I had a late departure flight on my last day and confirmed a late check out ahead of time. I am an ambassador member and one of the perks for being a member is guaranteed early check in and late check out. I had forgotten whether my confirmed late check out was 4 or 5 so I called guest services to check. I was told that they were not allowing any late check out because they were completely booked- I explained to the woman on the phone that I was an ambassador member and it should always guarantee a late check out, plus I had already confirmed when I arrived at check in. She basically denied the late check out and referred me to the manager on duty. I was only able to leave a voice message- manager never called me back. I just got really frustrated and checked out anyway. If I ever go back to Miami, I will definitely not be booking a room at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ibrag
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly staff, and nice rooms, I only stayed there one night but I would stay there again. The hotel has a great location two minute walk to bay side. The Staff I encountered where pleasant and helpful reception was also very nice. I really cannot fault the place, the only comment would be that b/Fast was somewhat pricey but good. I would choose this hotel again in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: ChrisPaulAnnaMarie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views of Biscayne Bay from oversized and well decorated room. Great bathroom. Club lounge staff are outstanding especially for their friendliness. Joey in the bar seems to know everyone and those she doesn't know she soon makes friends with!

Reviews.Title: “The service and food is exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: YMarie
Reviews.Content: I've been going to the Hotel InterContinental for years. Love the service. Love the food and the location. A definite must if in Miami for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it & would go back”
Reviews.Author: FloW1983
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic with great views in to the harbour and you could see the cruise port right across from the hotel. Fantastic amenities within the hotel including thier own Starbucks. The staff were really helpfull and attended to all our needs,especially the door men. I would defiantly recommend this hotel to all. It is only across the road from the local metro which will take you around the main downtown area. There is a shopping mall a short walk from the hotel as well. They even allowed us to keep our bags in a room for a small fee after we had checked out of the hotel a few days before due to not flying home until the evening

Reviews.Title: “First class service and the friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: wheatgrass_11
Reviews.Content: my husband and I live ten minutes from this hotel but received this weekend from an auction - we were hesitant for 15 months to go but we finally did it and glad we did!! The whole staff was superb, friendly, true customer service - it all started at the front desk they picked the perfect room - what a view - we never heard a peep the whole weekend on the floor - We had asked to upgrade to the club level on the 29th floor but it was booked so they offered us $50.00/day and gave us a key to the club room - the agents there were over the top - Aristides Alfonso, Jennifer Amador, Elvin Arias, Leonardo Perez were courteous, friendly, and only wanted the best for all the hotel guests, especially Aristides - all from the heart -- we'd love to go back but definitely recommend staying here, i truly hope all guests in the future experience the same if not let the staff know, they go out of their way -- Also, the pool area and man attending that day was very helpful and expected no tips, I'd also like to mention the king size bed which the mattress was indeed comfortable - sincerely, Mr. and Mrs. Duncanson P.S. The food/drinks were delicious too! P.S.S. The valet charge was a little steep but your at their mercy no secured parking in sight.

Reviews.Title: “A few glitches, but still nice!”
Reviews.Author: cautiousmom7
Reviews.Content: The last time I visited this hotel was about 8 years ago, so I wondered whether it had declined as many hotels do over tme. I'm glad that it hadn't! Yes, it's showing its age a bit. There were stains on the chairs in the room. And the room service menu was dirty. But the hotel felt sort of elegant nonetheless, like a NY hotel. It's located downtown on the waterfront, right next to the Bayside Marketplace. So you aren't limited to room service or fast food restaurants. The room was nice and spacious, the beds felt great, and the staff was friendly. Here are the glitches that occurred: 1. The room a/c didn't work and they had to send a bldg engineer to fix it. Had to call twice (as perhaps they forgot to send someone after the first call) and someone came right away after the second call. Fixed it in a matter of seconds. 2. The key cards stopped working even though we hadn't done anything to demagnetize them. We went down to get replacement keys, only to go back up and find that they didn't work either. The bldg engineer had to come let us into our room and do something to the key card reader on the door to get the key cards to work. 3. At checkout, there was no bill left under our door so we needed to visit the front desk. Unfortunately several guests who had arrived on an international flight were checking in and we had to wait for nearly 30 minutes to get checked out. There was no separate checkout line and no triage to get us out of there. Next time, we'll just have them fax it to us or something. Also, there was another guest waiting because HIS key card had stopped working. So, even after all of that, we still liked the hotel. Probably would have liked it even better if they offered a complimentary cup of coffee or something for the minor troubles. Got the room at a discounted rate, though. Not sure what we would think if we'd paid a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Reservation System and Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: JudyB602
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention at the InterContinental Miami. Initially I made the reservation just for the dates of the convention. When the time got closer, I decided to stay a couple extra days. The online system wouldn't allow me to change my reservation. I called, but no one could seem to help me. I kept getting transferred to different departments or dumped into voice mail. I finally got a person who explained that my reservation could not be altered because it was associated with the convention. I wouldn't think it would be that difficult to alter an existing reservation, but she offered to make a 2nd reservation for me for the extra couple days. She promised that there wouldn't be any noticeable difference on my end. I got to the hotel and showed both reservation confirmations. I was again assured that there would be no problem associated with my having two different reservations. On the last day of the convention, after a long day of classes, I returned to my room to find that I had been locked out! I went down to the lobby and was informed that I had been locked out because I hadn't yet checked in for my 2nd reservation. When I asked why they hadn't checked me in for my 2nd reservation when I checked in for my 1st reservation, I was informed that I had to pay for my 1st reservation before checking in for my 2nd reservation. Not only was I inconveniently locked out of my room, but they never even bothered to tell me that I would be required to pay for my 1st reservation part way through my stay. Instead they just locked me out of my room. They had my credit card on file and quickly charged the 1st reservation and reactivated my room key. When I got back to my room, I realized that they had overcharged me! I had to go back to the lobby with a copy of my reservation to show the price difference. They lady at the desk had the nerve to treat me like I was inconveniencing her. She was not the least bit apologetic and went behind a closed door for about 10 minutes consulting with a manager while I had to just wait. When I finally asked another employee if she was coming back, he snapped at me that she was working on the problem. She finally came back and told me she had requested a refund, but it might take a couple weeks. I wound up speaking to the manager who was just as rude as everyone else, but he did issue the refund right away. Of course it takes a while for a refund to show up on a credit card though. So.... their reservation system would not allow me to simply add a couple days to my reservation because I was there with a convention. After promising me that having to make a separate reservation for the couple extra days would not be an inconvenience, they locked me out of my room partway through my stay, told me I had to pay for the 1st reservation before reactivating my room key, overcharged me, then acted like I was inconveniencing THEM when I asked for a refund on the difference. I will NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: derealman
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, pool, courtyard, lobby etc.. Nice clean rooms, friendly staff- especially bars :-). The location is great on the water, 2 minute walk to Bayshore Marketplace, and close enough to everything. Drawbacks- $30 valet, $15 gym, $? wifi additional fees per day. I had 2 issues with the bathroom, which on a whole was amazing and huge. However the decorative shower fixtures which looked like a similar material to that which the walls were tiled in, it looks great but not practical- I was impossible to regulate water temperature once hands were wet and soapy also same problem with shampoo/conditioner difficult to open the metal caps once in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay - Needs improving”
Reviews.Author: Kimfrost1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights from June 10th - June 12th. I travelled alone. Upon checking in, they gave me a handicap room, last time I looked, I didn't need one. Big mishap as I felt really uncomfortable taking up a handicap room, when someone else who might actually need it could have it. I rang the reception numerous times to get it changed and they did eventually. I don't know if it was the cheap rate I got on Expedia, that made me less worthy of their service, but it felt like you were treated differently just because you paid a $100 and not $200 and the reception clerk kept reminding me, that I booked it via hotwire, really annoying, specially when I asked for a late check out, had I known this would be such a pain in the butt, I would have chosen a different hotel, I even offered to pay the extra. Also the reception clerk upon check out refused to give me Priorityclub Rewards, stating I had prepaid and didn't book through them; again that feel of "your not worthy" of our service, cause you didn't pay full price. I was like, but I spent over $200 in room service in 2 days, give me some credit here and used the horrible slow valet at a wooping $32 a day! I was also told by other another IHG property, which I stayed at earlier on during my visit, that any Priorityclub Reward member would get the insanely high internet fee waived, again the reception clerk treated you like dirt and said they would never do that unless I was a customer paying the full price. I mean what kind of a state is that? In this day and age, with hotels screaming for business, you'd think any buck counts. All in all it is actually quite average hotel. The hotel is in need of a serious facelift, it looks dark and drab in many places. Rooms were beigy and yellow'ish colours, really just standard hotel interior, nothing special, no fancy touches, just what you needed and expected, nothing to "wow" you. I guess that is okay with some folks, but staying at an Intercontinental hotel, I expected more, maybe too much in the end. Pros: The quality of the in-room menu and the bed (amazing bed) Cons: Overall experience and quality. I really expected a lot more from an Intercontinental property. And please give the hotel a facelift soon, it looks tired like an old dirty poncho. Sum up: I won't recommend this hotel to anyone before the hotel gets a facelift and staff a course in customer service and that a buck, is a buck.

Reviews.Title: “i enjoyed stay at hotel memorable experieance.”
Reviews.Author: mirevanna
Reviews.Content: i stayed in 2 night at hotel, all service staff put on a extra efferds food is very testy, my rooms always tidey. transportion at airport very close. this is good hotel my be i am sure i will come back same hotel i having my dinner in night my waiter alwys waiting for me hotel stracher good.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT pre cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: ken518
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location for a cruise out of Miami. I managed to get a room here for $99 on one of the discount websites. Front desk area is a bit confusing. It can be sort of a free for all because of how it is designed I think. It is off to the side and there is a supporting pole in the "line" area. They should try to fix how guests line up in this area. Starbucks onsite was a great plus. Next door to a small park and shopping area which was nice for dinner the night before the cruise. It is about one block from Hertz car rental drop off location as well. Nothing bad to say about the hotel at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jw1014
Reviews.Content: I was able to book this hotel through one of the booking sites where you do not know the hotel name until it is booked. This was the hotel I was wanting! We parked at the hotel on a 1 day visit last Thanksgiving and loved the proximity. We knew we were going to be using the Gray Line buses at the Bayfront Park and this was the perfect place to stay. We were in town for the first night of the NBA finals and it was neat to be right there at the arena where we could walk around and watch. The hotel room was large, the view was out of this world and the bathroon was magnificient! We did not eat at any of the hotel restuarants so I can't comment on that. The pool and grounds were beautiful even though we had no time for relaxation. The parking was expensive but we expected it and the valets were quick & friendly the few times we needed the car while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: SunshineStateGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 11 days on a part business, part leisure trip with my wife. The hotel lobby is large, attractive and inviting. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. President Obama stayed here for one day while we were here, so it is upscale but not quite a Ritz or W hotel. The room size was about average and no frills, but it was nice enough. The view of Biscayne Bay was outstanding. Room service food was okay but I wouldn't recommend it. The pool was a little plain, and we were shocked to learn there was no jacuzzi. Bummer. Also, the pool design was very poor. There is a bar and villa area that blocks the entire view of the ocean from the pool. I mean seriously what were they thinking there? Could have been spectacular but instead it is quite boring. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is right in the middle of the Bayside area downtown Miami. It is a quick walk next door to the Bayside Marketplace where there are TONS of shops, bars, restaurants and live music. Walk a little further and you are at the American Airlines Arena where the Miami Heat play. If South Beach is your destination it is just across the bridge, about a 5 minute drive. Beware if you have a car, like most places in Miami parking is expensive. This hotel is Valet only at 34 bucks per night. There is metered parking which is great for temporary parking but not feasible for an entire trip. All in all, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average is the word”
Reviews.Author: Doberri
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a business trip and I am globally not satisfied with the service for the following reasons: - It's more or less a rip-off: everything (and I MEAN it) is chargeable - Fitness? Pay! Wi-fi? Pay! Using the mini bar fridge to put your OWN stuff? Pay! Every single charge is of course "four" star... so beware! - The personnel is not friendly: this hotel is just a machine that lives for seminars and big events... when you check out they are actually very happy so that they can quickly put another fool in your room. - Inconsistency: As money is key here they heavily delegated part of the premises to third parties without controling anything ... so what do you get? Inconsistent message from the hotel employees and the employees of the third party contractor. Try for "fun" to understand the Fitness Club rate rules ;) - Disgusting Food: Worst ever for me at least - at a very high price of course... cocktails: they are OK - average and pricey (but that's the bassis here so I am not complaining) - Outdated: everything is old so when they provide you with a printer.... welll... it HAS NO USB Connection... of course right! - the location sucks if you have no car - if you do please pay 34 USD per day thx. Ok so what are the good stuffs? - the VIEW - I got a huge "intercontinental club" room in from of the Bay. Fantasti view to say the least. - the Wifi is fast - that's a real business hotel. - Rooms are big. If you get a good discount then go here - this hotel has no soul and is undergoing major refurbishment to remain on track with the competition so they might have some good offers. Funny enough they provide Wedding package... and here I am very serious: if you want to get married here plz reconsider... ;)

Reviews.Title: “Financial Security Compromised”
Reviews.Author: rwm698
Reviews.Content: Future guests: Don't use wireless Internet services at the Hotel InterContinental unless you want to give hackers access to your banking accounts. Within hours of using the hotel's secured, wi-fi network for online banking services via my laptop, bank representatives from two different banks with whom I have accounts called me to question unusual charges on my debit cards. One bank denied the charges while the other approved the transaction. Representatives from the latter bank tell me they will correct the error, however. I reported the incident to hotel representatives, who will investigate the matter. I reported the incident to the Miami police department as well. Needless to say, the experience was unsettling. It's likely I will not stay at an Intercontinental hotel or property in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: JNCOMIA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was in a perfect location and friendly from the moment I arrived. It was a great place to stay while visiting Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: WarrantRocko
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while hosting some veterans. The hotel proudly flew the Marine Corps Flag upon arrival and kindly met us all outside. From the time we stepped foot on the grounds we felt like family. the rooms were perfect, the views of the bay were as well. The service was excellent. Would highly recommend to anyone, especially my brothers and sisters in uniform

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vespinoza99
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled by our stay at this hotel from 5/19-5/23/11 with my daughter. Everything about this hotel is first class; the rooms, the staff and the restaurants. We had an incredible suite with beautiful view of Downtown Miami. We dined at every restaurant on the property and were never disappointed. Our room was always beautifully cleaned and restocked. The staff at club lounge, Recepcion, Restaurants, Bellman, Doorman were fabulous. The waiters at the restaurants, bar, the staff at the gym and the spa were all attentive and polite, trying very hard to get you exactly what you want. InterContinental Miami is a beautiful hotel with excellent staff and is an experience I would repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KD1956
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the InterContinental Miami, the staff of the hotel was very helpful and friendly. The hotel is located in a great location with many restaurants and shopping located within walking distance from the hotel, this was important as we didn't rent a car and this kept cab rides to a minimum. Although we ate out most of the time we did eat at the hotel twice and the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Too big to care”
Reviews.Author: JenniferLee75
Reviews.Content: Here for conference, so I probably would have secured a different property, the room was not as nice as expected but ok. An extra 20 got us a harbor view. My main reason for posting a review has to do with cleanliness- or rather lack of it. Coffee cups were still showing signs of previous use, black long hairs adorn the bathroom vanity, and moldy shower tiles and a broken shower curtain. Sink looked used-not clean. This hotel has very nice employees especially the valet guys-front desk when complained about the uncleanliness, appeased me and yet the standard of clean was not met. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service for a group of 300+”
Reviews.Author: rmm151s
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for our annual sales meeting with over 300 attendees. Each year, the meeting is held in a different location. This year we were at the Intercontinental in Miami. Our room was a basic hotel room - two beds, desk, tv, etc, - but the bathroom was great. The toilet and shower were in one room with the closet, sink, and mirror in another area - perfect for two colleagues sharing a hotel room to get ready in. The service throughout our four day meeting was excellent, and the food was great too. (Being a vegan often means crappy hotel food... but they had great options!) I only had two complaints during my stay. First, we were given free WiFi, and I think I only managed to connect and get internet access one day of the four we were there. All other times, the server was too busy and SLOW. My second issue was solved by Janessa at the front desk. As part of our meeting, we were given free passes to the fitness center. (NOTE: normally, usage of the fitness center - which is part of the spa - costs $15 or $16 a day. They DO have great facilities with lots of options for your workout.) On the day of my arrival, I used the fitness center and forgot my pass. I was told I could bring my pass up later in the week and have the charge removed. When I went back to the fitness center a few days later, I gave them two passes and asked them to remove the charge. The spa/fitness employees at the desk told me they couldn't remove the charge and did not offer any other option. I was, to say the least, unhappy. Fortunately, Janessa took care of the situation. When I checked out, I explained the situation to her, and Janessa immediately took care of it.

Reviews.Title: “The InterContinental Miami is a fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jupiterthinks
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the InterContinental was great. From the greeting at the valet parking to the guest areas, the hotel just spells class! The hotel is centrally located, with access to public transportation and Miami attractions, and is just minutes from the beach. The lunch buffet is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience ever....”
Reviews.Author: carloso76
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to Miami and I have stayed at different hotels every time. I must say my most recent experience at this Hotel has really blown me away. From my arrival to the Hotel, bellmen were eager to assist, Front desk staff very courteous and professional. I purchased access to the Club Level which turned out to be a great deal. I also had great meals in the restuarant with good quality and service delivered by the staff. I plan to stay hotel in my future visits to Miami. The staff is extremely nice and always finding ways to go the extra mile... I have been to the Hyatt and the Epic.....they are good, but this place is the best...

Reviews.Title: “Best setting to conduct business or enjoy a leisure day”
Reviews.Author: JeannettePineiro
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Hotel in Downtown Miami is a landmark to Miami's Skyline that has always maintained its upscale appearance and consistent service since opening. They key to a great experience is just that, consistent delivery of service. The restaurant offerings have always been consistently great, with a wide selection of feesh items. The upkeep of this hotel, lobby, rooms and outdoor appearance make this hotel very special and in my mind what qualifies it to be listed as a signature of Miami. I have been to the hotel restaurant many times since the 90's and have stayed there twice. Being a Miami local, I am very proud this hotel adorns our skyline.

Reviews.Title: “The Closest to Perfection”
Reviews.Author: fermin001
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel experience in a lifetime. I'am on of the Finance Manager for the Esserman Automotive Groop, leisure time is very scarce and the Intercontinental Hotel crew made it unforgivable. From the valet at my arrival, the warm welcoming and rapid check by front desk person, to the sad good bye from the bell man, it was clearly the closest to perfection experience. Thank you for your great service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: akrobat
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel annually on business. I find that the hotel has everything I need for business travel - comfortable rooms, great restaurant and a wonderful spa. What I like most about the hotel is the friendliness of the staff. From managers to bell hops, everyone always says hi and is always willing to help. I've had a few occasions where I needed specific assistance and I was never let down.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, good room”
Reviews.Author: KrazyKrem
Reviews.Content: I had a good, short stay at the Intercontinental Miami. I was in town for a triathlon on Key Biscayne and found this hotel to be in a great location for the event. It was near some restaurants and attractions, but a particular advantage is it is right next to a park and has good views. I particularly liked my room. It was spacious and comfortable. Nice to have a large space in a city environment. The window was particularly noteworthy as it simply felt luxurious. The hotel is pricy and parking reflects this fact. Hotel staff were fine but seemed uninterested in my business. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to people who want to visit Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service + Unuseable Bath/Shower = 1 star”
Reviews.Author: TripfanaticNYC
Reviews.Content: First, let me note that the night before I stayed at the InterContinental I stayed at the Epic Hotel down the street and provided a five star review for my stay there. The reason for the different star ratings between the InterContinental and the Epic is poor customer service at the InterContinental. I stayed at the InterContinental on May 3, 2011. I was assigned one of the bi-level suites on the 33rd floor. The room itself was well appointed and all was fine with my stay with the exception of the last 40 minutes I was there. Approximately 20 minutes before I was scheduled to be picked up for my ride to the airport, I attempted to take a shower. The water that came out was only one temperature â€“ extremely hot. Nothing I did to try to cool down the flow would work and I could not therefore take either a bath or a shower. Because I was in a hurry, I opted to wash up using the sink. I then went down to the front desk to check out and to alert the hotel staff to the situation in my suite. Thatâ€™s when the poor customer service began. After I received my folio I asked the front desk clerk to please note that the bath/shower in the unit was unusable due to extremely hot water. Rather than simply noting that, the front desk clerk informed me that I â€œshould have called down to let us know so we could have fixed the situation.â€� I replied, â€œWell, if I had done that, would I have been able to check out now as I am doing,â€� to which the front desk clerk sarcastically replied, â€œmaybe.â€� I then asked her to please clarify her initial statement: â€œDo you mean that you want guests who are disrobed and trying to use a non-functioning shower to re-robe, call downstairs, wait for an engineer who likely would not be able to fix the situation on the spot, and then (and only then) wash up in a sink?â€� The front desk clerk responded, â€œwell if it could not have been fixed we could have tried to arrange for you to take a shower in the spa.â€� I said, â€œbut then I most certainly would not have been able to check out right now.â€� At that point I got the sense that the front desk clerk really did not believe that what I was reporting was accurate. Not appreciating the apparent reality that my character and credibility were being challenged, I asked to speak with the front desk manager. I asked that manager to accompany back up to the 33rd floor so I could demonstrate that what I was stating was true. The front desk manager indeed tested the water himself and observed first hand what I had reported to the front desk clerk 10 minutes earlier. I explained to the manager that I was disappointed with how the front desk clerk handled my initial request and that I felt like she was challenging my credibility, thus causing me to now be 10 minutes late for my scheduled airport ride. The front desk manager did nothing more that apologize on behalf of the hotel and to give me his card. At no point thereafter did anyone at the hotel follow up with me about the situation. No phone call, no email, no nothing. That is in contrast to how the Epic handled the minor hiccups I experienced there. Not only did management at the Epic deal with the situation on the spot and offer me some sort of compensation for my troubles, but two different members of management emailed me within 48 hours after my stay to invite me to speak with them. In short, a non-functional bath/shower plus poor customer service resulted in a one star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: JKSiragusa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and great location. The pool is ultra small, always in the shade. Not a kid friendly pool by any means. The treadmill costs an extra 15 dollars per person on top of the high price just to stay there. The Starbucks in the hotel is never allowed to be open because of the restaurant in the hotel at ultra high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Sonyericson Open”
Reviews.Author: valeriachouzal
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull hotel, clean,great beds, huge bathrrom, big closet, wonderfull view of the Miami Bay and Port.Parking very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Everything is an extra, beds are only doubles”
Reviews.Author: WindsorHillsPad
Reviews.Content: DH and I have always avoided anywhere with double beds (4ft 6" wide) but here there was no alternative. We had two beds between the 3 of us so i asked for a rollaway for DD and was quoted 35 dollars A NIGHT extra but was then told that it was illegal to have one in the room. Anyway we ended up shoving the two beds together and unearthing a lot of dust. The view was incredible, we were on the 24th floor and were able to use the Club lounge which was very generous. We saved a lot having breakfast, snacks and drinks there. The hotel is only a short walk from the Bayside shops and restaurants which we really enjoyed. Plenty of boat trips leaving from there. The hotel is only a short cab ride from the port where the cruise ships dock. The cost for internet is RIDICULOUS - 11.95 PER NIGHT. Parking is also extortionate and thankfully we didnt need it. In fact there is a Hertz just a short walk away. Other places within a short walk include Subway, Marshalls and Ross. Didnt use the spa but it was expensive so that was the reason why. The elevators were really fast, we timed them at one second per floor. Other comments were that when we walked through the front doors it wasnt obvious where reception was and it took a while to locate it tucked around the corner on the left. We also contacted the concierge about shuttle buses and was told there werent any so we spent 85 dollars on a return cab ride to Dolphin Mall only to later find a letter on the desk of the concierge offering the same trip by shuttle for 10 dollars each return. Grrrrrrrrr.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel looking just a little jaded. Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: mervous
Reviews.Content: Actually writing this in the room, I cannot believe some of the coments about the place. None of the staff have been snobby to us yet we wander around the hotel in shorts and t shirts, the pool does hit shade at noon, and hits full sun again at 3 for a while but the pool terrace and garden get sun most of the afternoon. The room is plenty large enough for us and we got an upgrade for being a PC card holder - the first night was a free night! Drinks are what you would expect, everything else is just good value. A hotel seamstress adjusted some clothes for me and asked me if five dollars would be ok? Hell no, if it isn't worth ten it isn't worth doing! I had 3 packages delivered to the hotel, one of them 3 weeks before we arrived (my mistake) and when we got here, the receptionist told us as soon as we booked in, seriously, the staff are just so helpful, the conscierge has a flyer and a map for everything in the area. Hard rock cafe and bayside market are 5 minutes walk away, walk into downtown and theres the free monorail as well as walgreens, ross and other conveniences as well as some electronics stores and a few cafe's. Really enjoying the stay

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay for Business”
Reviews.Author: GirlUnderPar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night in April while I was in Miami for work. Very pretty hotel. Very nice room. Both the room and bathroom were spacious and clean. The work station in the room was sufficient. I had a room with a partial view of the bay. I ate in the hotel restaurant because I didn't have time to venture elsewhere - - typical hotel fare but was just fine. The staff were helpful and accomodating. My only "complaint" is that it costs $15 to use the gym facility.

Reviews.Title: “They will give your room away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gelo7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through lastminutetravel.com as a 1 night pre cruise stay. As I always do when a book a hotel on a blind discount travel site, I came to tripadvisor to check the reviews. I noticed right away that there were 2 reviews stating that when they arrived for check-in, they were told that they would not be able to honor their reservation due to current guest staying over because their flights had been canceled. Alarms went off in my head. We had planned to drive down from the Atlanta area after lunch for my wife and kids, it's a 10 hour drive, which would put us in Miami around 10pm. After reading a review here about someone losing their reservation when they had a late check, my wife decided to take the whole day off and let the kids skip the last day of school before the start of Spring Break. I called the Hotel Intercontinental Miami on 3 separate occasions to verify our reservations for a 2 bed double. We received confirmation each time. So, we hit the road at 4 am and arrived at the Hotel InterContinental Miami at 2 pm. The hotel sits on the water front across from Bayside and we were excited, the excitement grew when I entered the beautiful lobby to check in. I stood in line and watched 2 people trying to get checked in get turned away. I over heard the guy in front of me inquiring about the nightly rate, and the clerk informed him that it was $399 per night. I paid $175 plus fees, and I thought here we go. My turn, the clerk takes my name looks at the monitor and confirms that I have a standard double, I agree. Than it happened, she excuses herself and goes into an office, she comes out 3-4 minutes later and drops the bomb. I am sorry , but due to a guest having their flight canceled we are going to move you to a different hotel, you can leave your car parked here and we will pay for a taxi to take you to the Conrad Hotel and pay for another taxi to bring you back to pick up your car in the morning. I told her that was not acceptable, so she asked me if I would like to speak with a manager. So, she is off again to the little room for another 4-5 minutes, now while I am waiting, a young woman gets checked right in, and Ms Natalie Recinos comes out to speak with me. She gives me the same spill about someone having their flight canceled and having to stay over. I explain to her that I don't just a reservation, but a pre paid reservation. If someone has their flight canceled, they should be responsible for finding other accommodations, send them to the Conrad Hotel by taxi. She stated that that's not how they do things, that they have an agreement with the airlines. I asked her, if you are booked solid and don't have any rooms, how was that young women able to check in? Ms.Natalie Recinos states the she was probably a repeat guest or something. I then state that I read on tripadvisor that at least 2 other reviewers reservations were not honored due to flight cancellations, so whats going on here? She apologized again and repeated the offer to pay for a taxi to the Conrad. I told her why would I need a taxi when I drove my own car, she explained that I could leave my car in their valet parking area over night. What sense does that make? I told her that if I was moving, then how was I going to to be compensated for my trouble. She again stated that they would pay for a taxi. What? I told her that I wanted my money refunded and the Hotel InterContinental Hotel should pay for my stay at the Conrad. Well, she agreed. She goes back into the office and brings me out an agreement between the Hotel Intercontinental Miami and the Conrad to take me in. I told her that I want the agreement to refund my nights stay in writing before I leave. She states that she couldn't do that, but she would email it to me, so I write down my email address. I let it go because by this time, my wife and kids have been sitting out in the car for 30 mins waiting for me to get us checked in. I can't prove this, but I believe that the Hotel Intercontinental Miami dishonors discount hotel reservations when there is something large going on in the city, like the tennis tournament going on that week, in order to take in guest paying the full rate. When the hotels are full they bring out the "guest flight was canceled" excuse. Our family of five head on over to the Conrad where the lobby is on the 25th floor by the way. It is a nice art deco kind of hotel. I hand over my letter to clerk from the Hotel InterContinental Hotel, get checked in and head down to the 19th floor. The five of us walk into this tiny room with 1 king sized bed, so we thought that this was obviously an error. We head back up to the lobby to tell the clerk that she had given us a single instead of a double, easy fix we thought. Wrong, the Conrad was booked solid and all they had was a handicapped accessible single room. I asked her if she expected the five of us to sleep in one bed, she stated that she could send a roll away bed to the room and wave the $39 fee.By this time we are both livid and tired, so we acquiesce, and head back down to the room. Then I decided that surely they knew in advance that we were a party of five, so I head back up to the lobby to get a copy of that agreement letter between the Hotel Intercontinental Hotel and the Conrad Hotel for my records. I asked for a copy of that agreement from the front desk clerk, she goes into the little office, stays for about 3 mins and comes back out with a manager stating that they could not provide us with a copy. I asked why not and there was this strained look between the clerk and the manager, and they stated that they just couldn't. We decided to just let it go and go grab an early dinner. Then we found out that every time you leave the hotel parking, you have to pay!!!! It was a very bad start to our Spring Break Cruise, but we had an absolutely wonderful cruise. We contacted lastminutetravel.com and were told that our refund was being processed.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expect of Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: christyb5
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I had visited Miami in several years so I was pleasantly surprised about the downtown development that has gone on over the years and is still in the process of completion. With that being said, however, the Intercontinental is right downtown in the inner city in one direction and not a good area to be walking in after certain hours but in the other direction it is on the bay. I was fortunate enough to be upgraded to the bay side and the view of the harbor with the cruise ships docked was a welcoming sight. Regardless to the view, the room was very dated and the carpeting was badly soiled in our room. The dining room was only open for breakfast and lunch--and dinner had to be taken either in the lounge area (which was very noisy earlier in the evenings) or had to be ordered through room service--forcing you if you wanted a decent dinner to go out of the hotel, whether you wanted to or not. What's more, there was never a reason given why the diningroom was not available in the evenings in spite of the fact that we were there with a big athletic conference! There was evidently a special where you could use your Priority card for a discount on the next meal you had in the lounge area. In spite of asking at the desk when I checked in, no one ever told me that I could not take advantage of that special when checking out (a no brainer since the number of times I had used the lounge area for meals was there). I was very disappointed at that but did not have time to debate while I was checking out. I would not go back again--not even for the view from my room--there are other hotels if you want to stay in the area--with views, updated, and have full diningrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Posh hotel with snobby service”
Reviews.Author: Trudy1971
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed at the Intercontinental for one night before our cruise. I chose this location because of the view, the proximity to the port and because I am a priority club member. Normally when I check into a hotel using my points, I am greeted and treated like someone important even though I am an average person! The building itself itself is lovely with a very impressive lobby. The first thing I noticed was how agressive the bellhops are. I realize they make a living on tips, but if a lady says "no thank you" and will not let go of her bag, please step away. Do not force the bag from her hand. We received a very cold and formal greeting at check in and proceeded to our room which was lovely. The beds are cozy and the bathroom is quite large. Having worked in the hotel business, I know how hard it is to clean a room so I ignored the black finger prints which were all over the white doors. Other than that, beautiful! Having arrived at the hotel early in the day, we decided to take a walk and grab lunch. I stopped at the front desk to ask for directions/opinions as to where we should go and received a very cold answer "just take a walk". Really. That's it? In all of Miami, I should just wander down any street? Thanks to some wonderful tourists standing by, we were guided to a restaurant/shopping mall close by. We did get a wonderful nights rest in a very quiet room and were grateful for that. No children wandering the halls, no drunks banging on my door thinking it was their room. Peaceful. The next morning we called the front desk to ask about a shuttle and were rudely told to take a cab. You would think a hotel THAT close to the port would offer shuttle service but apparently not. Overall our stay was nice but I expected more service. Pay attention to my child. Pay attention to ME. Next time, we will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: DRSR21
Reviews.Content: First of all, we picked Miami because we live in the Midwest and wanted to relax and enjoy the warm weather as much as possible. Second, the Wine and Food Festival was going on in South Beach while we were there so we did not want to stay there and endure the crowds. We were celebrating our 25th anniversary and the Hotel Intercontinental is celebrating theirs. I emailed the hotel about our special occasion and they upgraded us to a harborview room, delivered chocolate covered strawberries to our room and we had access to the Club Intercontinental. Very nice! Everyone at the hotel was so friendly! We were able to checkin a couple of hours early and had a later checkout on our day of departure. The room was large and comfortable with a beautiful view. We would get up in the morning and have a great breakfast at the Club which included pastries, fruit, breads, meats and cheeses, four different juices, milk, coffee, etc. Then we'd spend a couple of hours at the pool area. Quite relaxing with the plush lounges. The pool was in the shade around 12 o'clock but there was enough time to get some color on our winter white skin! Afternoons were spent at the Bayside Marketplace (sitting outside enjoying drinks) and we took a cab to South Beach. We were very pleased that we did not stay in South Beach. All the restaurants along Ocean Ave. were packed! Lincoln Rd. was more enjoyable but it was still too crowded for relaxation. We were completely satisfied with our stay at the Hotel Intercontinental!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Mommala
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Intercontinental was fabulous! The room was suficent and the facilities for the seminar were very nice. The lobby was beautiful and the staff were great! Food was kind of high at the hotel but it was located downtown and near a great outdoor mall with foods offered in any price range. The hotel is situated right on Biscayne Bay and we saw lots of marine life in our downtime. Amazing place to visit! Lots of construction and just across form where the major cruise lines depart from .... I enjoyed all of it! South Beach Miami was only a few minutes away by rental car ..... parking is a challenge, no free parking anywhere I don't think! Bring ya credit card!!! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly bad Management - the pool also gets no sun after 12pm!”
Reviews.Author: weebeggsie
Reviews.Content: After noticing on google earth that the pool was in the shade our booking agent phoned the hotel to double check this, as clearly if you're heading to miami you want to lie by the pool. We were assured the pool had sunshine the majority of the day. Upon arrival at 5pm, and being asked to pay $750 upfront 'just incase' we used the mini bar, we headed to the pool to lie out for a couple of hours. There was zero sun on the pool. The bar staff informed us we wouldn't get any sun after 12pm........they were 100% correct. Our booking agent then changed our hotels as the staff at the hotel had previously lied to ensure the booking. The new hotel was costing us more money. After incurring the cost of a taxi to the new hotel and having to cancel our pre-paid run back to the airport we returned home to claim these costs back from the hotel. The hotel customer services manager was 100% unhelpful and denied any of the allegations we were making. He also proceeded to recount his version of events, which were 100% a lie, considering we had not dealt with the manager regarding the issue until after we had checked out, he certainly recounted a rather humerous account of a conversation he had with myself regarding the whole issue, a conversation I might say never happened. After seeking legal advice that the hotel was 100% liable for the additional costs we incurred they hotel is denying all liability in the issue. I am now handing the entire issue over to my legal representative to claim the costs back. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, as they have shown they are willing to not only lie to secure a booking, but also lie right up to management level in order to get out of paying additional costs.

Reviews.Title: “Fun times in Miami”
Reviews.Author: hebnerdo
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to Miami in recent years and the Intercontentinal was the best by far. The service was outstanding, the food delicious, The rooms confortable. The only slight negative is the pool is in the shade for the afternoon. The location is also very good... OH...and the bathrooms have been remodeled and they are so quiet. You cannot hear in the room when someone is taking a shower...The hotel rooms were quiet in general. Never heard noises. Very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “A business hotel overpriced and underserviced..”
Reviews.Author: mariodibi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing special and overpriced. Wifi is poor and costs 11.95 per day. And beware thats only for 1 computer or device. So forget your iphone or ipad. Fitness centre is also 15 bucks extra! Concierge barely stAndard... Honestly with so many nice places in Miami, I would definitely stay somewhere else..

Reviews.Title: “They gave away our rooms after i paid and confirmed one day earlier!”
Reviews.Author: marisap72
Reviews.Content: I was flying in from NYC to go on a cruise out of the Port of Miami and thought this hotel was perfect since it was so close. Our flight was delayed, however, and when we got to the hotel at about 1am there was a young couple ahead of us with two children (one an infant.) They told they had been there for an hour and that the hotel had given away their room and had probably done the same with us. And it was true! The front desk didn't even act apologetic or as if they were expecting us to be upset. They kept insisting it was due to an "emergency" which when i asked what that was ... apparently other people staying there had had their flights cancelled. since when does that constitute an emergency? And as sorry as i am for those people, why did they get my room? The real quesiton is, whey wasnt' the front desk staff more concerned and prepared for the fact that i was coming in? The whole scene was ridiculous. This is a $300+ a night hotel and they treated us like crap. I will never stay there.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel but no compelling reason to Return”
Reviews.Author: GypsyGirl21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights last week in Room 1108. Had great view of Miami Harbour, could watch the cruise ships coming and going. Nice hotel, nothing fancy but OK. I would try somewhere else next time (except the Hyatt around the corner, colleagues stayed there and the stories were horrifying!) Pros - Room was spacious and bright, bathroom had separate vanity/shower/tub and toilet combination so extra privacy and comfort if sharing the room. Starbucks in the lobby is great! Free shuttle to Dolphin Mall picks you up at the front door! Same for the shuttle to Sawgrass Mills Mall. ALso, across the street from the Metro Mover, free access to all points downtown, easy to use and felt safe doing so. Cons - Slowest WiFi ever! Brutal, thank god it was inlcuded in my room rate, wouldn't have paid $15/day for that. Spa was typically the overpriced kind you find in these types of hotels. I will never understand why they charge 30-50% more. Pool Area - only has sun in the morning, completely in the shade at noon. (might be different in the summer months but for Feb it was just 3 hours of sun at the pool) We didn't like that. Parking is $39/ day, a real rip off. Location - located in dowtown Miami, about 5 minute walk from Bayside Shops which is nice. But everything else was at least a $50 cab ride round trip (South Beach/Shopping malls). $30 cab ride from the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate dated accommodation”
Reviews.Author: janetsco
Reviews.Content: Stay here pre and post cruise as part of a package. Location of hotel is in the business district of Downtown and previously I have stayed in South Beach which is much more suited to the wants of a tourist on holiday. The hotel itself is adequate and the rooms mediocre and functional. The buffet breakfast is varied and of a very good quality but the cost is ridiculous compared to what you can find a couple of blocks away. The views from the hotel were a big bonus but I wouldn;t choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service, service, serviceâ€¦where is the attentive service?”
Reviews.Author: betsey_MIA
Reviews.Content: The valet, door and bell staff are the face of hotels thus should provide a warm welcome to guests upon arrival.â€¦not at this place!! As soon as I pulled up the Porte cache was empty with two valet attendants lounging lackadaisically. Typically a valet immediately positions himself to graciously open a ladies door upon arrival but here I sat in my car for about 2 minutes before anyone actually moved. Very dissappointing. Upon entering the lobby there were no employees or bell staff around to great you it was like a ghost town and I had to figure out on my own where my meeting was after patrolling the entire ground floor. No warm welcome and no fond farewellâ€¦ very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: floridayogi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last weekend for the ING Miami Marathon. After running the race and returning to our room, we couldn't open our door with our key card and returned to front desk asking for new keys. Robert at the front desk issued us new keys and then those didn't work so we kept having to go back - we were completely drenched and frustrated. Finally, he had someone from security use a special machine to open our room. What did we get for 45 minutes of trouble? NOTHING! I'm surprised since I have stayed at other Intercontinental hotels in Montreal and LA, I'm also a Priority Club member. I'm hoping to hear back from the manager who may be able to salvage my future relationship with this hotel brand. Until then, I will be giving my business to other more receptive and quality hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lot of better options in that rate range in the area.”
Reviews.Author: wor7
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks dated and the rooms are average and plain. On the bright side the beds are comfortable, and there are some nice views of downtown, Bayfront Park and the bay. Parking is too expensive ($39 x day), WiFi ($14 x day) is very SLOW ( almost useless at times ) and I did not use the service but there is a $15 charge to use the fitness center. I do not understand how they can charge you to use the gym when you are paying a $300 + tax x nite rate. Not impressed at all in general. This hotel is overpriced for what they offer. Many better options in the area. Wouldn't come back or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience but upgrade internet”
Reviews.Author: dcite2010
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean quiet functional spacious rooms, w/ coffee maker, huge TV, comfortable beds and great view. No refrigerator in rooms, no indoor pool or jacuzzi. Helpful, courteous staff. The major downside was that the wireless internet was flaky and expensive ($14/day), download speeds would slow to the point of being useless many times during the day and evening. If you need a good reliable internet connection better to look elsewhere otherwise fine.

Reviews.Title: “Definitively not one of the best IC hotels..”
Reviews.Author: globalswede
Reviews.Content: ..rather one of the worst, pairing with IC Miramar in Panama city. There are good things in the hotel, the bellboys , the breakfast, and a very nice housekeeper that did her best. But the rest; - laundry, quick but way to much starching of shirt, delivered on a hanger even if asked for doubled. - room, first one given did had a nonfunctional safe ( which maintenance knew of when calling- evenso the room was offered to a customer the hotel knew is an Ambassadeur gold member, staying a lot in IChotels). second room had a functional safe, but furniture in so dirty shape, a not fully filled minibar, and no extra fringes for ambassadeur gold members - no upgrade of room was provided- even if that is standard for gold members - the bill on check out was generous, no laundry added, one breakfast missing - of course this is positive on one side, but on another it shows a hotel that has a malfunctioning billing system. But I did sleep very well in a very comfortable bed..... But will not return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The lobby may be 4 star, the rest of the hotel is not.”
Reviews.Author: PinaColada02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental as part of a group for the Orange Bowl and we got a really good rate so I have to weigh my review against what I paid. For what I paid, the hotel was adequate and I was in my room for very little time so that helped. This is a really big hotel which in general I try to avoid but if that's what you're in to then this hotel fits the bill. The lobby is beautiful and there are plenty of amenities -- gift shop, business center, an in-hotel Starbucks (that part was awesome!), restaurant with a bar, etc. The rooms however need work. On the surface they look nice but on closer inspection, you see they are way overdue for an upgrade. The room I had was very big so that's a plus but the bathroom layout was weird and the fixtures, furnishings and hardware just looked old. On the plus side, there was a separate tub and shower but I didn't like how the shower was behind the bathroom door and it was really small. There was a little cubby where they stored the iron and ironing board and it was just dingy in there - dust on the air vent, peeling paint, etc. I did eat the buffet lunch in the restaurant and it was adequate. Not sure what it cost as it was part of an event for our group so hard to say if it was worth what we paid. I will enthusiastically recommend the hotel bar's signature cocktail - that was yummy! I can't recall the name but it was some sort of fruity martini. I noticed that this was considered 4 star on TripAdvisor. I have to argue with that classification as I have stayed in nicer Hampton Inn hotels. If I were to come back to Miami, this would not be my first choice for a hotel as I prefer newer, smaller hotels but if you need a large hotel with good rates and lots of amenities that come with a big hotel, this will probably suit your needs, especially if you can get it for less than $200/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AJDONE
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel last week for a meeting and the hotel was great! The rooms are large and have views of Miami. The food in the meeting rooms was unique and very tasty. I liked how they told you a little about all the dishes. I would definitly go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my needs”
Reviews.Author: bruins3317
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel the day before we set sail on our 7 Night Cruise out of the Port of Miami. My father got some inside scoop on how to get this hotel for only $89 a night. What a steal. Normally if you were to book this hotel on expedia, travelocity, etc. it's $219 per night. The location is perfect for anyone who is planning a cruise and wants to arrive the night before. Its at $8 cab ride to the Port of Miami and the cabs are always flowing. When we checked in, we asked the receptionist for a water view room. It was only $20 more for this room, but we thought it was worth it because of the how cheap we got the room. The room was spacious and very clean. The beds were very comfortable.The view that we had of the port of Miami and the water was excellent. We saw dolphins from our room and it was great. We had great access to Bayside. I've been there a few times before and it was only a 5 minute walk from the hotel to Bayside. We went to dinner and did a little shopping. We woke up early the next morning and watched our ship, The Norweigan Epic, come into port. The hotel has a Starbucks located in the lobby. We got up and had coffees in the morning. We got ready to leave and all you had to do to check out is to drop your keys off in a quick drop off box. It was so easy. The only downfall of the hotel is that the additional hotel staff in the spa are not friendly at all. My mother and I went for a walk around the hotel to explore it and we ended up in the spa and pool area. We wanted to see what the pool looked like and where it was located. The ladies that worked at the spa and entrance to the pool totally ignored us when we asked them questions. Working in retail and with the public, its very important for one to be acknowledged. Other than that, we had a an excellent time.

Reviews.Title: “:-( Ughhh!!! Do I begin with the foul smelling carpet in the hallway or the room?”
Reviews.Author: BellMD
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Intercontinental Miami is way past due for some renovations. In a word, this hotel is subpar to the Intercontinental brand. The lobby is nice, but that is where it ends. When we got off the elevator, the smell of musty carpet met us in the hallway. As we walked toward our room, I couldn't help but notice the dust that had collected where the edge of the carpet met the wall down the entire hallway. I held my breath as we opened the room door. I was secretly hoping and praying the room would be better. Unfortunately, the room wasn't better. The same musty carpet smell filled the room. I walked into the bathroom and saw the re-caulked shower and dingy floors. The dust-bunnies were hanging out in the crevices here as well. What a disappointment. All I kept thinking was: I left my slippers at home and I really don't want to walk on this disgusting floor. I had a slice of cheesecake from earlier that I wanted to refrigerate, so I went to put it in he refrigerator. Well, first of all you can't use the refrigerator for personal items because it's a high tech (packed to the rim) mini bar that's rigged to charge you if any item is moved for 1 minute or more (read the fine print) - even if you put the item back in it's place unused. Okay, after reading the fine print and after looking at the mold in the crevices of the refrigerator, I decided I didn't want to leave my food in there anyway. For $300+ per night, it is definitely not worth it. This old, dingy, overpriced hotel is charging astronomical rates based on a brand name it does not live up to.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nicely located”
Reviews.Author: Edtampa
Reviews.Content: I stay here when traveling on business to Miami. Hotel is located at a good spot, close to downtown and Bayside. Rooms are ample, beds comfortable. Room service is average. Overall my stays have been satisfactory and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT Pre-Cruise Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: dsg560
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here at the InterContinental of Miami. When we checked in we were offered an upgrade for a small fee of $20. We took them up on it and got a beautiful view of the water and cruise ships! We had received our room on one of the discount sights for under $100 so we felt we had hit gold! One thing I noticed that made this place stand out was the wonderful smell in the halls and rooms. It was like walking into a spa. The bed was ohhh soo comfy..we slept GREAT. Bayside was the perfect tourist spot. Meals at the hotel are very pricey so we grabbed a quick breakfast from the Starbucks located inside. The room is a little dated but for our discount price, we were very happy and would go back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: DebbieSanAntonio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel pre-cruise. The location was wonderful and the hotel overall was fantastic. The hotel room itself was an average 4 Star room, a bit older but very nice. The lobby was georgous. The Bayside shopping center was just a walk away with lots of options. Our friends had an overpriced, not so great meal at the hotel but we didn't try the restaurant. We did go to Starbucks for breakfast muffins and coffee and it was good. The Make a Wish Foundation fundraiser was being held there that evening so there was a lot of commotion in setting up, but service was good. I would highly recommend this hotel to travelers. The pool area is very, very nice-but it was too cold to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious but good value if you get the right rate”
Reviews.Author: Diego_W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is past its 25th anniversary and while the lobby, views and the building itself are still amazing, as soon as you step into your room you could tell that the luxury years of this hotel are behind. I would qualify it as a nice 4 star. Service standards are of the same quality. This is not as bad if you consider that you usually can get rates between USD 100 and 150 using several internet sites. Those rates will entitle you to the most basic room but when arriving you are offered to upgrade to a bayside looking room for around 20 a night, which is a pretty good deal. It is not reasonable to pay their rack rates (above USD 250 in most cases). Another annoying problem with this hotel is that it charges extra for everything, and I mean everything. I was never before charged for â€œhandlingâ€� an Amazon Package (6.25 each!) or storing my luggage after check-out, among other odd charges. If you are not using any extra then you are fine, but otherwise be careful or your bill will be very inflated at check-out. Regarding location, I would recommend the hotel for business or cruise travelers, but not for Beach or nightlife lovers since the trip to South Beach is 40 min. by bus or otherwise you have to pay USD 35 + tips to valet park at the hotel. However it is safe and near the Bayside Marketplace with the convenience of being connected by the free Metromover to other downtown locations.

Reviews.Title: “Best business trip ever...”
Reviews.Author: CassandraA
Reviews.Content: Great service. Outstanding food! Efficient set up of meeting rooms and banquet.

Reviews.Title: “Service is not great.”
Reviews.Author: Jesse24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in mid September 2010. The hotel is neat, rooms are good and the restaurant staff are offer good service. However there are some areas I found disappointing with my stay: 1. At the time of check-in they give you a brochure indicating that if we use the Spa you would get a 15% discount. The hotel also has discount cards placed at different locations inside with a 15 % discount. However when I went to the spa after making an appointment I was told that the spa prices were already discounted and I would not be able to use any of the discount coupon given to me during check-in or the one I picked up in the hotel. 2. Guests have to pay 50%of the fees to use the gym. Most hotels offer this facility for free. 3. I had forgotten my toothpaste and requested the front desk to give me a small tube of tooth paste. She was unwilling to help and suggested that I go and buy it from the souvenir shop. This was the same lady who assisted me in my check-in in the morning and reluctantly informed that she would have one sent to my room. 4. The breakfast price at the restaurant is very high at $ 30.00

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: LHRNewYork
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Miami where we went for a most needed vacation. We stayed at the InterContinental Miami and had a fantastic time. It has been a while since our last stay in that hotel and we were really impressed on how great it looks. The service we received from the valet, doormen, bellmen and reception staff was warm, friendly and efficient. The rooms are comfortable and spacious with a wonderful view of the bay. At the Club Lounge, we were greeted by Carlos who was extremely welcoming and who seemed to be always there regardless of the time we visited. I would definitively recommend the hotel to anyone wanting to enjoy a relaxing stay in the heart of a very exciting city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view of the port and bayside from...”
Reviews.Author: clairenjen
Reviews.Content: Amazing view of the port and bayside from our room. Very spacious and comfortable, and a surprisingly friendly atmosphere for such a large hotel. An easy bus ride over to South Beach, and walking distance to reasonable restaurants in Bayside.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: Meri2679
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times for a quick weekend getaway. I also had my wedding reception at the hotel last year. The food is amazing and the staff is extraordinary. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect pre-cruise hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: beynac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night, pre-cruise. We got a great rate on a discount website and payed roughly $110 total. It was a good value, and with our budget I probably wouldn't have paid more than that. We asked for a room with a view of the port at check-in, and this was granted. Perfect vantage point for watching the ships leave that night and seeing our ship waiting for us in the morning. It was a lovely walk to the Biscayne Mall, where we had dinner. We went for a morning power-walk along the shore and back down to the mall, which was wonderful. We then walked to breakfast downtown. The hotel was nicely accessible to all these places on foot, and we felt safe at all times. The room itself was nice. A few signs of wear and tear here and there, but the bed and linens were incredible. We are not picky people and thought the room was lovely. The best part was the view! We didn't use any of the hotel amenities, so I can't comment on those. If we take another cruise out of Miami, we would gladly book this hotel again. It's the perfect pre-cruise place. I can't imagine a better way to jump-start a vacation... being right on the water, near the port.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: WDWDad
Reviews.Content: We booked through lastminutetravel.com and got a fairly decent rate -$105 with port view. We found our corner room facing the port to be very large and clean with friendly service. The location is very close to the port (a short cab ride) and there are many nice restaurants, shops, live bands in the evening, at the Biscayne Bay Mall only a short walk away. We didn't have time to use the pool and gym so I can't comment. My only complaints were the overpriced $30 USD each breakfast buffet (there are many cheaper places to eat close by) and the front desk which we went checked in and out at, but each time it felt like an eternity due to the slow service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: rainstr
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the positive reviews on this hotel. The rooms are clean, nicely furnished, and very spacious. I am not very demanding regarding the service, so I cannot really comment. I especially liked the bed and the large pillows. I stayed on the 27th floor (the hotel has 34 floors) and the view to the west was awesome. The air conditioner works very well. My colleague used the swimming pool and he liked it. Starbucks in the hotel is really handy. However, the restaurant, breakfast and the internet are too expensive for my private pocket. The overall hotel price (arranged by the conference I attended) was decent for a business trip. As a promotion campaign, I received an access to the Priority Club with a free breakfast, snacks&drinks and computer access, for me and my colleague, so I cannot complain. The transportation to Miami beach is easy by bus C and S ($2 one way). The "metromover" train (free! yes, something in the US can be for FREE!) is almost in front of the hotel. I also rented a car in the hotel ("Enterprise"). In addition to the valet parking (~$40), there is a parking with the meter and lots of parking buildings in a 3-5 min walking distance offering 24h parking for some $5. The shopping center where I bought some souvenirs and drinks and eat a pizza is 5 min walk across the park.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel, nice staff, ok location! Would go back.”
Reviews.Author: avapopelectric
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in Sept. 2009 for the Miami Bellydance Convention, which was being held at the Intercontinental. Hotel is clean and the rooms were spacious and very nice. Comfortable beds, pillows, which were very much welcome after days of dancing almost non-stop! Everyone at the hotel was very nice and helpful. They helped us getting everywhere we wanted to. There's a Starbucks in the hotel, which is also a plus (well, to me anyways!). Now, about the location, it's OK. It's actually a very nice downtown location, waterfront and a few minutes from shops/restaurants (Biscayne Bay, I believe?). There is also a shuttle that will bring you to the Dolphin Mall for about $10. We went to South Beach on our days off, and it took about 40 minutes by bus (for $2 I believe). Not too bad, but not close enough to South Beach, in my opinion. Now, I would go back (and probably will be back if the Miami Bellydance Convention is being held there in 2011) but if I was visiting mostly to hang around South Beach, I'd pick another hotel.
