Reviews.Title: “Decent but expensive hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: Anders80
Reviews.Content: I was here for a week during a conference at the same hotel. The hotel was located right downtown and with a perfect waterfront view. It was a luxury high standard hotel, however it was clear that the rooms were built more then 10 years ago when it comes to design. Big rooms, plenty of space. Plus: Good downtown location, good view of the water, good pool (only one), starbucks in the hotel. Negative: Costly internet, costly fitness room, 10 year old rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Typical big hotel”
Reviews.Author: hankn
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is a 34 floor hotel in downtown Miami on the waters edge. One would expect that a hotel of this size would at least have the appropriate number of front desk staff to handle the hundreds of rooms. When a conference is taking place one should not have 3 front desk staff, and dozens of people waiting for checkin/checkout. In addition, there is no roped area - just an amorphous zone a few feet from the front desk with a huge pillar in the middle - so no one knows whose turn it is. The rooms are large and soundproofed. The bathrooms have large towels and all the necessary amenities. Their Internet site says "fridge" but do not be deceived. It is a minibar - with pressure sensitive drinks so that one cannot place food in the minibar (there is a small area for customer food and drinks - no more than for 2-3 drinks). I ordered a fridge and even though was told $30/stay, housekeeping told me $35/day. So I argued and they capitulated to $30/stay - which is still a hefty extra. Looking thru the room booklet I found that one can request to have the minibar emptied for private use. No one offered me that option. There is a free safe - at least that. The conference was able to arrange a $189/night rate - which is just passable for value - anything more would be too much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay while traveling on business”
Reviews.Author: TaraBluffton_SC
Reviews.Content: I was in Miami for the World Spinning & Sports Convention which was being held at the Hotel InterContinental Miami. The hotel was very nice situated downtown overlooking Biscane Bay. The rooms were appointed nicely and enjoyed a large dressing area separate from shower/water closet area. Convention meeting rooms were easily managed. We ate in the hotel dining room and it was above average. This hotel is within walking distance to many shopping establishments. I would recomend this hotel for business again and would definently stay there for business again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical US Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: BabaBologna
Reviews.Content: The hotel is typical for the majority of US Intercontinental hotels. They are below the standards you have in other parts of the world. The rooms are aged, old TVs. There is not a single suite that allows for smoking. Staff is however as friendly as you will find it throughout the US. The location is more for business travellers than for leisure. The downtown public transport is just a few meters away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Pre Cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: bluwes
Reviews.Content: We have sailed from Miami several times before and always stayed somewhere on South Beach, in the usual Art Deco hotels which abound there This time we decided we wanted somewhere different, and plumped for the Intercontinetal. I am glad we did. We found this hotel to be very clean and well maintained. The bed was very comfortable. It has a huge lobby area but only a small bar. It has several ballrooms and there were a number of weddings on while we were there. I noted from some other reviews on here, about the TV's need upgrading . I would agree with that, but that is only a minor detail. I also noted somebody mentioning the concierge staff not being particularly helpful or friendly. I would have to disagree on that one, they were always pleasant whenever we passed and had a smile. They were partiularly helpful at checkout, ( mind you they did get a tip). The hotel is also a short walk from Bayside wherre there are plenty of places to eat and drink, and if you do want to use public transport there is a bus stop almost outside, only $2 to Lincoln Rd on South Beach I would certainly recommend this hotel and would definately stay there again before a cruise

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackyVicky
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Downtown Miami. This hotel is a $20 ride to Miami Beach and consideirng we kept going to Miami Beach we should of stayed somwhere closer. By the hotel you have Bayside, a small shopping centre. The room was clean and spacious. There was no business lounge for free connection. We got a good price via the tour operator and paid $170 a night for a room with double beds. Overall would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “amazing views of port and biscayne bay”
Reviews.Author: thelongleggedvixen
Reviews.Content: stay here for a friend who was having a wedding reception at a near by hotel...i must say that the hotel is nice, very upscale and the views of the bay are amazing!!! would stay here again with any hesitation. check in was smooth and quick and if you need anything they are quick to respond.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Beautiful View of Miami”
Reviews.Author: LABAYMEDIC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inter Continental Miami in May of 2010. Wanted to spend a few days in Miami after getting back from a cruise. Arrived at the hotel at 9:30am and the receptionist was more than happy to find me the exact room I requested (King Bed, Non-smoking, Bayview on an upper floor). I stayed on the 17th floor which is all non-smoking. Never once did I smell smoke anywhere I went in this hotel. The floor and the room seemed clean, modern, and appealing. The room has a large window overlooking the bay and port. Extra comfy bed and beautiful large bathroom (shower head could have been a little nicer but it served its purpose) made it even more appealing. We went walk to Bayside Marketplace and did a little shopping and eating and when we returned to our room there was a bottle on Evian water and a handmade chocolate basket with chocolates in it on our window seal. I called downstairs to make sure it was complimentary and they assured me it was. I never heard any noise from other guests at night and slept well. The lobby is a nice place to sit and people watch. When we were leaving they were busy putting out the red carpet for a celebrity event they having that night. There was never a problem finding a cab from this hotel and the bell staff was more than helpful with getting your luggage down the stairs in the lobby. The concierge was very helpful and was able to give me information on anything I asked of him. Overall this hotel played a huge part in making my trip to Miami an enjoyable one and I would definately stay here again on my next visit. I was a bit concerned when I booked due to the number of bad reviews I read, but I never came close to experiencing any of the negative things other have mentioned. This is a five star hotel who looks like and treats you like its a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price......rip off for a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotlantaken
Reviews.Content: You would think that a high-end hotel like the Intercontinental which touts its amenities would be better than this.... What they don't tell you is that all the amenities come at an EXTRA charge! You want to use the internet? --sure, for an extra $12 a day. Just hop on an exercise bike? --sure, you can use the fitness room for an extra $15 a day. A continental breakfast? --sure, coffee, juice, and some pastries for $18! Oh, and you can't use your own room's refrigerator.....well, you can, but its an extra $30. In other words, you're going to pay a lot for a hotel room that's all attitude with no value. (more examples......cheap mattress, they just throw one of those faux pillow top liners on it.....and the shower looks nice, but the cheap shower-head leaks more water than it sprays........and don't expect any pay channels like HBO or Showtime in the room, they're not available)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gonecuttinghair
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Intercontinental around 9:30am as we were just getting back from a cruise (minutes away from the port of Miami) and were so happy they let us check into our room early. We were pleasantly surprised with the beauty of the hotel lobby and spacious room on the 25th floor overlooking the pool area. The room was a little dated, but was clean and spacious. Bed was comfortable. I liked that the bathroom and sink area of the hotel were separate from the sleeping area. I know all luxury hotels charge for every little thing so I was not shocked at the fees for using the gym, internet and use of the phone. The pool was beautiful but was in need of skimming. There were pieces of plants, sticks and even a sun visor at the bottom of the pool. The wicker padded lounge chairs at the pool were out of this world. They had enough chairs and cushioned oversized seating as well around the pool giving it a spa feel. Being right on the water was a great touch while laying by the pool as well. I wish their spa treatments were a little less pricey as I would have loved to have been able to indulge in a massage. We really loved our walk from the hotel to Bayside Marketplace as it was a short distance from the hotel with great shopping and dinner options. We enjoyed listening to "Rock and Roll Circus" the band playing outside at Bayside Marketplace as well. We also liked walking through Bayside Park which was on our way to Bayside Marketplace. Beautiful views right on the water and you could see the ships across the water at the Pier of Miami. Another positive note: Ice water with lemon, coffee, tea and danishes are available in the morning on a small table in the lobby. Although it's not advertised, it was a great little treat on our way to the airport the next morning at 6am. I would come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “They charge you to receive mail at the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PlanetBarbados
Reviews.Content: I live outside the US. So when I travel in the US I have a package of mail sent to the hotel in which I'm staying. I've never been charged before to receive a package at a hotel. I received two small packages and the hotel charged me $6.25 for each one. Actually, I felt pretty nickel-and-dimed at this hotel. To park our rental car was $38 a day, almost as much as it cost to rent the car. Internet was $13 a day per computer (I traveled with my spouse). Otherwise, the hotel is a decent business hotel. I don't love big, impersonal hotels but I was on business at this one so this is where we stayed. The room was clean and comfortable and we had a terrific bay view.

Reviews.Title: “Intercon's downtown location is terrific”
Reviews.Author: Dog_Cove_on_the_Road
Reviews.Content: If you seek a very convenient downtown Miami location for business this is a terrific work hotel with solid staff and business center and perhaps the best range of fitness equipment around. Beds are heavenly and it seems that only the corner rooms have both walk-in showers and separate tubs. Yes, it it not on South Beach but you don't have to drive 15-25 minutes in traffic to get back and forth and if you want to sleep undisturbed the place is silent. Got to be one of the best breakfast and lunch buffets around, though not cheap, and try a burger via room service after midnight. Only wish the pool had more sun... I heard flat screens are not in every room yet but mine was there, large and sweet in my suite.

Reviews.Title: “I would come back a million times!”
Reviews.Author: marinapd
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, downtown, view of the ocean, park for children close by, mall close by. We felt as king and queen even with the children around :) Our wish was their command. A lot of taxis outside the hotel, starbucks, restaurant, pharmacy near by and of course 10 minutes from the Port. We stayed there before and after our cruise and we never wanted to leave. Even though the room windows wont open, you never smelled anything bad :)

Reviews.Title: “Not up to my standards for this level of hotel”
Reviews.Author: loriglover
Reviews.Content: OK- left over food and alchol in the mini bar from previous guests, 3 calls to the front desk for a wine opener, dirty chairs - not what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but I showered in the dark.”
Reviews.Author: stpauligirlmn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. As reported in other reviews, the lobby is much better than the rooms. The room was ok. The bathroom was beautiful, with marble counters and floors. The room was clean, which is always a relief. Notably, the bath products such as soap, shampoo and conditioner were trerrible. I always look forward to that little luxury when staying at a "nice" hotel and was disappointed on this trip. I woke on Friday morning and my bathroom light was blinking on and off. I called the front desk and maintenance was going to be right up! 20 minutes later I could wait no longer and got in the shower. By the time my shower was complete, the lights had gone completely off and I finished up in the dark. It was a unique experience! I think this is likely an anomoly and would not expect this to happen again. I would definately stay here again and I would recommend it to a friend. It's a little pricey, but really not too bad for Miami on the water.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is OK. The staff is not.”
Reviews.Author: szynka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK. Located in close proximity of a nice park, directly at a bay, surrounded from two sides by skyscrapers. The bay view is just beautiful, if you have a high floor room. Restaurants are in about 15 min walking distance. CVS one block away. Car rental companies are 2-3 blocks away. Taxi to the Miami Beach is about 20 dollars. Starbucks (open 6.20 AM â€“ 6.00 PM) and a little souvenir shop are in the building. Free tee and coffee are in the lobby before 6.30 AM. Rooms are nice, sufficiently spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable. Windows don't open. Internet is about $52 per week or $12 per day. Breakfast is until 11.00 AM, it is not included (about 30 dollars for buffet breakfast) and food is very tasty. Coffee is decent. The worst part of the hotel is the service. Except the doormen, the guy at the bar and Anna at the front desk, we had very bad experience with the staff. The person at restaurant entrance told us around 10:00 AM, that we can not sit at a table for breakfast, because they already clean the tables for lunch. We could sit at the nearby bar and enter the restaurant just to get food from the buffet. The waitress in the bar was difficult to spot. The worst experience was the concierge. The man was rude and bad-mannered. Our hotel bill had several extras, which we never used. This included alcohol from the minibar, parking charges (even though we had no car), and other small things, together for over $100. Fortunately, we were able to clarify everything and we paid only for what we really had.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Mohsman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while in Miami for business. Cost for club floor was $430 plus taxes. The hotel is beautiful and well appointed. The club rooms were of decent size. I felt that bathroom and closet were too small. The club lounge was excellent with decent food and free alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks at tea time and evening time. Room had panoramic view of the harbor and Miami Beach - which was very nice. If you have an expense account - I'd recommend staying here. Otherwise, there are very good, but less expensive hotels available

Reviews.Title: “Last night of Holiday.”
Reviews.Author: FEATHERSTONE74
Reviews.Content: Last night of of Florida holiday we booked a night here as we was flying home from Miami the next night, Im a Intercontinental Royal Ambassador so i was using some of my priority club points for this stay. We was upgraded to King bed Parlor Club Suite on the 31st floor with Club Lounge access. This is our second time staying here and every time has been great, great service and friendly staff that can not enough for you. I always read the review before we stay any where and HOW people can call this hotel and give bad review is beyond me!!!!!! Yes it could do with a bit of updating ( NOT our room) and yes the valet parking is $35 per night which is expensive but that Miami downtown hotels for you. We had a fantasic stay and will be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Looks more impressive than it actually is”
Reviews.Author: ishouldcocouk
Reviews.Content: Your first impression of the foyer is 'wow' as it really does look good; but that's about it, to be honest. The rooms were fine; clean, tidy and we had a great view over the bay but I deeply resented paying the extortionate valet parking fee. Being expected to pay for using the, admittedly very well equipped, fitness suite was another sting in the tail. As Platinum Priority Club members, we hadn't had to part with cash for the rooms which was just as well, as I would have felt really ripped off! There is so little to do in downtown Miami, unless you're overnighting before a cruise, I simply wouldn't bother to stay here and would head for Miami Beach instead!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Barneslover
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed at this hotel three times in the past year. He has stayed here many times in the past on business, so when we arrive at the hotel the valet and doormen always greet him by name and give him a hearty welcome back. The service is top-notch. Check-in has always been under five minutes. Our request for a bayview room on a high floor has always been honored. On this most recent trip we were very warmly greeted by Joey, the head bartender at the Indigo bar, as well as by Joshua, another wonderful bartender at the Indigo bar. Although we first met Joey and Joshua a year ago, they remembered us on our return visit last fall and made us feel completely welcomed back on this visit. Joey is a master mixologist and took much pride in crafting us delicious tropical drinks. The rooms are spacious and clean. The beds are very comfortable and you can not beat the view. It is a short taxi ride away from the hot spots of Miami Beach. Bayside Mall is just a quick five minute stroll through the newly refreshed park. The breakfast buffet is quite a treat. It is worth it for the fresh fruit selection alone! We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating ASAP”
Reviews.Author: Lucy77
Reviews.Content: The lobby is lovely and it always helps there is a Starbucks, but that is where it ends with this hotel. The room was dated, the carpets and furniture were dirty, and the bathroom was a mess. The shower had been re-caulked a million times and there was luke-warm water to shower in (no matter the time of day!). The knob was some sort of fake marble. I also tried to call for slippers (due to the gross floors) and it took me three separate attempts to actually reach someone. Each time I tried- service, the operator, and the front desk. For $400+ a night, not worth it at all. I'll stay somewhere else next time I am in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for downtown”
Reviews.Author: BrazilMarcio
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights with my family. Rooms need an update concerning digital TV, getting even more space. Bathrooms shows a bit of aging. View is a must.The charge of $ 34 dollars a day for parking car is hard to pay., they also charge $12 a day for internet access. Stairs at front and lobby are based on the 80Â´s, not ok for strollers and weelchairs.But the room itself, the view and the near bayside and park values.I do reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: KWtransplantlovinit
Reviews.Content: We only stayed two days during the ING Miami marathon, but wow! very friendly staff, and beautiful rooms, lobby, and banquet rooms. just a short walk from bayfront park, and the nightlife, restaurants, etc... definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel - poor location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller73London
Reviews.Content: I read a couple of reviews that didn't say favourable things about the location of the IC Miami and to be fair, they were right. The IC is a huge hotel and looking from the widow (we had a duplex on the top floor) the postion seems great, views over the park, Bayside and the water but at street level there really isn't anything there (but this seems true of most of Miami unless you are in Miami Beach). We chose this hotel because of the brand and also because it wasn't in Miami/South Beach away from the crowds and party noise. The problem is that Miami downtown is dead. In places it feels quite rough, in places it is! There is a Macy's store within walking distance of the hotel and a Walgreens and that's about it. There is however a great menswear shop that does free Cuban music and mojitos on a Tuesday. The Art Museum is close by too but we gave it a miss. Whilst there aren't many bars/restaurants near by the bar within the vast hotel foyer is a pretty poor offering, unfortunately. Likewise the restaurant feels likes eating in an airport. Interestingly we looked into the Hyatt around the corner and it was pretty much the same, I had thought it might have had a restaurant but it had just a bar serving standard bar food. There are some good restaurants fairly nearby but everything is a cab ride away if you don't have a car. I was shocked at how car dependent the city was. There are public buses to South Beach from just outside the hotel which is very handy. Using the buses can be a fairly humbling experience - although the bike rack at the front of the bus is pretty cool! So back to the hotel, poor location but very good spa (although they charge you to use the gym unless you are have Ambassador membership!!). We were on the club level and used the Club Room regularly. It was quite small but the staff there were superb. The food offerings were ok but the drinks were good. Our room was fine but the decor was a bit too 80s for my liking. Comfy bed though. The hotel itself is fine - it is just its location that lets it down. I doubt we will return to Miami so whilst I probably think 'next time I will book a hotel in Miami Beach' - truthfully I doubt I ever will.

Reviews.Title: “If your are in asthma or allergy sufferer avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Delmar09
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Intercontinental are dirty and dusty. The air filter in the ventilation system hadn't been cleaned or changed in two years. The exterior of the vent had 2 inches of dust caked. I had an asthma attack and requested another room. I was them moved to another room with even more dust and dirt. I was then moved to a third room. I asked to speak with the general manager who has yet to contact me. This person must be to busy to deal with unsatisfied guests. If you are allergic to dust or dust mites my recommendation is to avoid this hotel. Other not friendly policies include charging for printing airline boarding passes. The overall service is poor

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby and setting”
Reviews.Author: tunisfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night in a smoking room (n smell of smoke as there is in some hotels). The rooms were beautifully appointed and the beds were great. The bathroom was very nice with stone tiles and stone fixtures. This is a business travelers hotel and it shows in all of the appointments throughout the hotel. The small bar in the lobby was very comfortable for a cocktail and an appetizer. The restaurant itself was smallish and the menu for some reason diidn't appeal to us. The staff was not warm but were efficient and helpful. The is a big pathway from the hotel in both directions on the water and that was really lovely. One thing, they will charge to use their pool even if one is a guest and their spa services on on the expensive side (not surprising)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: MoritzCH
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental Miami is an excellent hotel that is a solid choice for any stay in Miami. The hotel has a genuinely upscale ambience and features a good location coupled with helpful and courteous staff. Rooms are clean and elegantly outfitted, and rooms with bay views offer breathtaking scenes over Biscayne Bay. I arrived at the hotel later in the evening, and check-in was quick and efficient. Check-out was also quick and painless. The lobby features a generous seating area outfitted with stylish furniture. Much of the lobby is finished in marble, as is an imposing sculpture that greets you when you enter the building. Six elevators are available to take guests up to their rooms. The room was located on the twenty-sixth floor and had a gorgeous bay view. The room was quite large for a hotel room, and featured stylish furniture befitting a hotel in this class. The two double beds were comfortable, clean, and were outfitted with sufficient linens. A large, marble-topped desk provides wired internet connection and the room itself is outfitted with wireless internet accessibility, albeit at $11.95 for twenty-four hours. Internet access is granted by dialing 0, speaking with an operator who will release a code, and then the charges are billed to the room. The high speed internet was sufficiently fast and should not disappoint. The TV lurks in a stylish hutch, though finicky guests may recoil at the older style CRT TV. Snacks are available just above the mini-bar, though unsurprisingly, they are not cheap. There is ice available on each floor, and the layout of the hotel means the hallway is a loop, making it difficult to get lost. The bathroom was, predictably, also fitted in attractive marble. The shower had plenty of hot water and was powerful, though the shower head was on the low side. There are generous closets both in the room and in the bathroom. The faucet worked well and a hair dryer is provided. The toilet and shower are separated from the sink area by a door. Overall, while definitely not a brand new hotel, all of the hardware works well and there were no age-related problems such as distressed furniture or mold. The hotel features a variety of amenities. There is a Starbucks in the main lobby, and a convenience store sells a variety of goods in just across from the reception area. A mail box is provided just outside the convenience store. However, I mailed a postcard to myself and it took quite a long time to receive it, which makes me skeptical of how often mail is collected from the box. A business centre has a few computers and a printer for use, albeit these services are not complimentary. There is also a large, staffed concierge desk that proved useful in providing tourist information. There is a pool and extensive spa, though I did not make use of these areas. Valet parking is available, and the valets will also hail a taxi for guests, as a couple of taxis are already lined up near the hotel, ready to be summoned by a whistle. The location of the hotel is a plus. Most attractions are within a reasonable distance. The hotel is located at the end of a quiet street that ends at Biscayne Bay. Effectively, the hotel has the small street to itself, save for an office building at the corner. Across from the hotel is picturesque and quiet Bayfront Park, and a quick walk through Bayfront Park leads to Bayside Marketplace, where a variety of shops and restaurants can be found. There are also a number of bay cruises that originate here. The hotel is also very close to the Miami Metromover, the free elevated rail system that is useful for getting around downtown Miami or heading to major transportation hubs to connect to other forms of transit. Also nearby are a number of bus stops that will whisk one to many places in Miami. South Beach can be reached with route C in thirty minutes. Also nearby is American Airlines arena and the many electronics stores of Flagler Street. The Port of Miami is also close, making the hotel useful for cruise ship guests, a taxi to the port will cost about ten dollars. However, aside from the venues mentioned, the area does not have much in terms of entertainment, largely a financial centre. Overall, the Intercontinental Miami was an excellent hotel. Staff and service was solid, the rooms were comfortable, clean and contemporary, and the location was reasonable and tranquil. There is little fault in this hotel, other than perhaps the age of the hotel, but this should largely go unnoticed. A fantastic deal around the $100 per night range and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location- even with a car”
Reviews.Author: geosu
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying 3 nights at the Intercontinental post cruise and booked independently with travelrepublic for a steal. The hotel is in the perfect location. The hotel is right on the waterfront with Bayside park right in front. The Bayside market area is 5 minutes walk through the park. This has lots of nice bars and restaurants as well as shops and stalls, which I dont think were highly priced at all- same prices as in Dolphin Mall. The room was of a higher than expected standard with a lovely view overlooking the park and towards downtown. The minibar is clearly marked with a warning that you will be charged if anything is moved so no excuses for misunderstanding. The staff were all friendly and helpful, apart from the stuffy woman in the spa. We didnt eat in the main restaurant but did have room service which was fine and reasonably priced. We had one drink in the bar though and were stunned by the cost so we went to Bayside market in the evenings instead. Wifi isnt unreasonable at 11 dollars a day, better than in U.K. Bit much to pay 34 dollars for overnight parking but this was only for one night and we knew the car would be safer than parking outside on the meter- here there were several instances of glass over the floor! Having said that , I found the area very safe. Lots of people walking about at night and we never felt threatened once. We did see a couple of down and outs asleep in the park late at night but they didnt bother anyone and we were never approached. I would think about staying here again, but the cost of the parking for more than a day puts me off. You need a car to see more of Miami so this is a big deal. But if you're just a couple of days pre or post cruise I would not hesitate to recommend it. And I would certainly suggest staying in Downtown, near to Bayside market, a great location

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoF_9
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in Miami in the beggining of November and our stay at Intercontinental was perfect. We booked through Hotwire and got a great deal. All hotel staff were very polite and anxious to help. The room was big and clean, with a huge bathroom. Starbucks located in the lobby was also great. The negative aspects I can point out are the price of the parking ($34.00 a day) and the absence of free internet (you have to pay about $11.00 a day for wired or wireless access).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, very classy”
Reviews.Author: alandubo
Reviews.Content: I'm somewhat confused by the mixed reviews of this hotel, but after our stay here I can assure you this place is great. We found a last minute deal and got a great rate, so we booked and stayed this past weekend for 3 nights. People complain about the location - well, unless you stay on South Beach (either way too expensive or really bad hotels), this is the next best thing in my opinion. It is downtown, and just a 5 minute walk to the Bayside shopping area. The other downtown hotels (Conrad, Marriott, etc) are much further out. And this is only a 10 minute drive to South Beach so you're as close as possible. The lobby is very nice, the check in was easy, and we found the staff friendly. The rooms are slightly dated but still very adequate. We upgraded (for just $20 a night, not bad in my opinion) to a bay view room which was absolutely worth it. You have a great view of the water, the cruise ships coming and going, and it is very tranquil. As for the furnishings - we found the bed one of the most comfortable we've slept in. The bathroom was high end enough for us, and it had a separate bath and shower which is always preferred. We did notice a few dents and dings here and there, but nothing too bad. We ate a quick dinner one night in the lobby restaurant and enjoyed that too. Starbucks is downstairs as well which is very convenient. The only negative I can give is the parking price ($34 a day), and I believe they only have valet. We found that too expensive but Miami is an expensive city, so we got used to that. Overall I would definitely recommend the Intercontinental. For a classy, high end hotel in a good location with good views, this should be your choice. If you're prepared to spend $300+ a night in South Beach go for it, but this to me is much better value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Trimada
Reviews.Content: Okay first I travel enough to have all of the frequent flyer programs, I am not saying that to brag but simply so you understand this is coming from someone who stays at about 125-150 different hotels a year! First the location of this hotel is AWFUL, it is not really near anything you want to go to unless you are there for business. Yes true there is a â€œshopping mallâ€� about a 15 minute walk away but that was certainly nothing to be proud of and not really worth the walk. This place has valet parking only so you HAVE to pay the $35 parking chargeâ€¦ too much in my opinion. The hotel lobby is beautiful and when we got to our room it was VERY nice. I wonâ€™t deny the rooms were good and as a â€œdiamond memberâ€� they say they gave me a so called â€œupgradeâ€�. I am not sure what that upgrade was but they say it was as I had a â€œharbor viewâ€�. Honestly if that was my â€œupgradeâ€� then they should speak to any other hotel and get a clue, just read my other reviews for the Crown Plaza in Key West or Hilton in Ft Lauderdale. Here is the biggest problemâ€¦ I just had 2 small bottles of water I wanted to keep cold. I look for the â€œrefrigerator,â€� only to find out it was a â€œmini barâ€�. Now I can easily fit in my two small bottles of water and went ahead and did soâ€¦ My girlfriend pointed out a sign saying â€œMini bar not to be used for your own use, call #51 for thatâ€� or something like that. I have heard all the horror stories of being charged an insane amount for just â€œtouchingâ€� an item (as they are all monitored electronically now). Just an FYI for a pack of Skittles that we bought that day from CVS for $0.50 they were charging $5.50 Come on! Talk about mark up! I donâ€™t care if you are on business if it were one of my employees buying that stuff I would fire them simply for wasting company money! So back to the issue, I called the number on the sign, after 2 minutes they pick up to say â€œyou need to call the front desk for thatâ€� They transfer me to someone else and I said â€œHey I have 2 small bottles of water I squeezed into the fridge is that okay as I donâ€™t want to be charged if it bumps somethingâ€� He tells me â€œno, you should not use that, let me call someone and see if we can get you a fridgeâ€� Okay so 15-20 minutes go by with nothingâ€¦ We want to go out for the night so I call back and said â€œHey someone was supposed to call me back but never did, we were told to get a fridge but we wonâ€™t be hereâ€� So we leave for the night come back and a fridge was thereâ€¦ all aggravating but now â€œokayâ€�. I called the front desk and asked to have a boarding pass printed for my flight. They told me I need to use the business center so off I goâ€¦ Get to the business center and they want to charge me $10 just to logonâ€¦ never mind all the other charges once we get on. So I am already having a bad experience with this hotel in general, we go to leave in the AM. When I check out, on my bill was a charge for $35 to â€œrent the fridgeâ€�! WHAT? That is right, I explained to the person last night I donâ€™t want to take the risk of being charged $7-$8 for 2 overpriced water bottles so he recommended I get a $35 a day fridge to keep 2 small â€œcheapâ€� bottles cold without telling me! Come on, at least tell your customer before you try and rip them off. Had I even THOUGHT they would charge me I would have been content with some ice to keep them coldâ€¦ (Although knowing this hotel they would have charged me for the ice too). Now granted after many complaints at the front desk and demanding to speak to a Manager (who was not available to deal with an upset customer) a â€œsupervisorâ€� came out, still absolutely hopeless but after they saw that I was adamant about not paying this they did agree to remove the charge. In this so called nice hotel I cannot think of one positive thing to say except maybe â€œnice lobby.â€� As far as the negatives, - this review is too long already if I listed all the negatives it would put you to sleep. Letâ€™s just say I will NEVER stay at this hotel ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for pre-Cruise!”
Reviews.Author: Mark228
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night pre-cruise. Registration was a breeze. Every employee I met had a smile and was very helpful. Didn't use any of the services, such as the pool, fitness center, etc., so I can't comment on them. Room was beautiful, clean, well appointed. Great location, within easy walking distance to get last minute items. Also, short walk to Bayside Marketplace. Would stay here again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sexyangel
Reviews.Content: This is a 5 star hotel with great location to bayside just a few minutes of walking. The hotel offers a great view if you stay on high floors.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous View, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MLTLabadie_MO
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure this hotel was wonderful. My daughter and I arrived to friendly staff at the door and front desk. The front desk staff highlighted suggestions for our day activities on a map and upgraded our room to a view of Biscayne Bay where we viewed our cruise ship dock. The room was large with a separate shower in the marble bathroom, the hotel had a elegant feel, Starbucks had great service and everyone we met was friendly and helpful. The hotel was conveniently located within walking distance of the Bayside Marketplace which had live entertainment, shops, and excellent, affordable restaurants. The neighborhood was very safe for walking at night. I would recommend to anyone taking a cruise out of the Port of Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay - Service and Attention as it should be - Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Ancon
Reviews.Content: Made a short 2 day visit for this Intercontinental in downtown Miami, our 3rd stay in 3 years. Staff is very friendly, well trained and in true Intercontinental culture of service. Im very pleased with all the attentions, from the front desk, bellboys, room service, etc. Great attitude and always ready to serve. Rooms are nice, but need a new tvÂ´s and maybe new furniture, however, rooms are big, very clean and quit. They just renew their spa and it really look attractive. Club lounge staff is excellent. Hotel is close to the port for cruise travellers, close to banking area of brickell and nearby Bayside market. Overall, Im very satisfied and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but in the middle of nowhere!!”
Reviews.Author: NIKKI2996
Reviews.Content: Myself and new husband on Honeymoon stayed at the InterContinental Hotel in Miami for 2 nights on return from our Royal Caribbean - Caribbean Cruise (this was fabulous). The hotel itself was ideal being so close the port and it had nice surroundings i.e. biscayne bay etc. However i felt as if we had nothing to do for the 2 nights we stayed. We were in the heart of the financial district which meant loads of business people in suits and ties and no shops. There was a little shopping area a short walk from the Hotel but nothing to shout about!! We plucked up the courage to go on the monorail and check out a local shopping centre. We got there in one piece eventually but felt of place because we were the obvious tourists and not locals!!! The hotel itself was very expensive to eat and drink in. We even nearly got charged for using the minibar (which we never used!!!) I'm guessing it would be rather expensive to take a taxi to south beach, as it seems a bit of a distance from the hotel. Other than that our room was ok. clean enough and spacious. The poolside bar is a must for a refreshing cocktail. The staff there were very nice and chatty!! But be prepared to send a good few dollars there as its not cheap!! This isnt the hotel for you if you like to shop, like myself!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with very good staff !”
Reviews.Author: Maxiiie
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week in a Executive junior suite in the Intercontinental Miami, the lounge is very nice with also free refreshments, free computer, and free printing. Their is a wide range of drinks and snacks. The breakfast in the main restaurant is unbelievable : A very big range of all kinds of food !! The best breakfast ever seen in a hotel ! The junior suite is very big with a roomy bathroom, Tv with Playstation, A big living area with a sofa and table.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: I had an outstanding stay at this property, and would definitely choose it again. The hotel is upscale, but comfortable, with a spacious lobby including plenty of seating area for small group conversations. Restaurant was very good, though a bit pricey. Starbucks for the addicted. Staff was curteous and helpful including bell, valet, front desk, concierge, and room service. The room was very spacious and well appointed (no HDTV). Excellent work desk, comfortable bed, great view of the bay, very large bathroom, 2 closets, separate shower, bath, and sink areas, and in-room coffee. Best of all - clean and quiet. My rate was $149 a night - a bargain. There is an outdoor shopping area within easy walking distance including restaurants. South Beach is an easy 5 mile cab ride. Downtown is right outside the property. I would not hesitate to recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in 'world-class' hotel”
Reviews.Author: Volunton
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is impeccable. I guess I had the wrong room with the wrong staff on the wrong day. It happens. Anyway, the following is the e-mail I wrote to the hotel GM, Jack Miller, following our return from Miami. I never received a response from him or the hotel. Feel free to read my letter and tell me if I was out of line in any fashion whatsoever. ------------------- First, let me say I am not looking for anything from you or Intercontinental Miami. Instead, I wanted to let you know how disappointed I am in the poor standards and even poorer level of service I received. I pride myself on doing a lot of research prior to making travel arrangements and booking the actual vacation. Being a Canadian travelling in the U.S., my goal is to get â€˜valueâ€™ for my money. Having personally stayed at hotels within your chain, I am more than familiar with the quality of the various brands and quite honestly, expected a lot from your hotel, if nothing else, based on the solid reputation of the Intercontinental Miami. Since March 2007, I have taken three cruises out of Miami. I have always attempted to stay at the Intercontinental Miami. Instead, I have ended up at hotels that I considered to be of good but lesser quality than the Intercontinental Miami. A few weeks ago, I made a booking for the Marriott Biscayne Bay, thinking I had received a very good rate for a good hotel. However, I later discovered that you were offering a special promotional rate of $99 U.S. per night. I immediately contacted the Intercontinental and made a booking, then spent 20 minutes canceling the Marriott reservation. Needless to say, I was thrilled to know we would be staying at what I and many others consider to be one of the top hotels in Miami, Florida. Upon checking in, I was greeted by a very pleasant and efficient front desk person named Christina. I advised her that, when I made the reservation, I requested two cribs for the room as we have twins. She advised only one crib was on the order but made a call and quickly arranged for a second crib. I also requested that a pot of boiling water be brought to the room sometime in the next few minutes if possible, as well as later in the afternoon and early in the morning of Monday, April 6. The first pot of water came up within 15 minutes, as did the two cribs. However, the second pot of water never showed up later the same day (Sunday, April 5). In addition, upon getting set up in the room, I noted that the one box of tissues soon emptied upon using only six to eight tissues. In addition, the bathroom sink seemed to be a bit slow to drain. However, as we were getting the babies fed and arranging to meet friends from Miami, we did not worry too much about either of the above. We left the hotel to meet the friends and came back to change the babiesâ€™ diapers. We discovered that both sets of key cards that had worked upon checking in were now unusable. I went down to the front desk and advised Christina, who re-keyed our cards and told me security would be up shortly. The security person came up and attempted to get our key cards to work. Instead, he had to leave and get a device to re-master our door. This process took about 15 minutes while babies waited to get changed. At about 10:30 p.m., we were getting ready for bed and it was at this point that we noticed just how badly the bathroom sink was clogged. It took about 10-15 minutes for the sink to drain. I called downstairs and was put through to Carlos. I advised him there was no point sending anyone up as we were leaving early Monday morning. However, I just wanted him to know that this was an issue that should have been addressed prior to our arrival. I also advised him that our requested pot of hot water had not been delivered to our room Sunday afternoon as requested. I then requested that a pot of water be brought to our room around 5:30 a.m. Monday morning and left for us to make baby formula prior to our departure. Upon waking up at 6:30 a.m., I opened the door to our room and much to my chagrin discovered there was no pot of water. I called down and advised the person who answered. She advised me that she would contact guest services as soon as she hung up. No one brought any hot water to our room. I also asked if someone could get our bags as we were leaving at 7:30 a.m. I was informed someone would be right up. No one showed up. Instead, we took two babies, two umbrella strollers, three suitcases and three pieces of carry-on luggage downstairs ourselves. I was not impressed. Prior to leaving the room, I attempted to check out using express check-out. The bill was higher than expected as we had been charged for taking things out of the refrigerator. While I understand you have an automated system for this, on Sunday afternoon, we had called down to advise someone that we needed to take some items out in order to store baby bottles. We were assured there would be no issue with this and that we would not be billed. To the hotel's credit, this was rectified immediately. However, to say I am underwhelmed by the Intercontinental Miami would be the â€˜understatementâ€™ of the year. I am more than unimpressed by the service received. Other than Christina and the gentleman who set up the two cribs, the service was severely lacking. I do not anticipate a trip to Miami anytime soon and am NOT seeking any compensation of any sort. I just needed to express my disappointment with your hotel and to let you know that, if it was a bad day for the hotel, as a result, it was an even worse day for us. Respectfully

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the expected standard...”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdvisorySC
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at several Inter-Continental's before, my expectations were great. First of all, the hotel's location is not worth the money. Though the Bayside shopping district is less than a block, its much better to stay in South Beach for the "true" Miami experience. The Inter-Continental has valet parking only - so if you want to leave the hotel for whatever reason, you're going to tip constantly. Plus a fee of $35 a day to park your car. This adds up quickly. Secondly, the front desk clerks look exceptionally polished, but you quickly find out that they, like every other employee at this hotel, are lacking in guest service, hospitality and good old fashioned manners. I had to call for maid service every day as I returned by 5 daily to find an unmade room. I also called to let them know that there were several lightbulbs burned out in my room, of which none were ever repaired. The hotel itself was clearly built in the 1970's-early 80's, with a consistant brown granite that runs throughout the interior and exterior. Though it claims to be remodeled, and does have a comfortable bed, its only in soft-renovations (carpet, linens, wall coverings, furniture). The room's furniture itself reminded me of a Holiday Inn Suite rather than the $700 a night room that it proclaimed to be on the back of the door. The bathroom had a nice walk in shower. Its only disappointment was that its bathtub was clearly 25+ years old - low to the ground, shallow and very narrow. The pool area, though very nice with a great bar staff, only had around 25 deck chairs - far too few for one its size. You practically had to question everyone there just to find out which chair was taken. With the pool area being surrounded by sky scrappers all around you - literally on 3 sides straight up - the sun is very limited. The spa looked to be the nicest part of this hotel, though I didnt experience it. Bottom line: The property is dated, the staff is lacklustre and the value is just not equal to that of other Inter-Contiental's, Westin's or Ritz Carlton's. I would only stay here if South Beach had no vacancies or if I got a really incredible $89 a night rate. Otherwise, its not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, convenient for business”
Reviews.Author: Happy_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: I spent the night of July 15 here during a quick business trip. Downtown Miami (this neighborhood) is not convenient for those considering a vacation in this wonderful city. The Intercontinental is perfectly fine for busness in the downtown area and is better priced than the Marriott nearby. I stayed at this hotel years ago for a convention and it was busy. On July 15, I felt I was in a ghost town and it depressed me a bit after coming off full flights as I was hoping the economy was turning up. The hotel lobby is nice and staff are A+. The desk staff at check in and the overnight staff at the desk (I checked out at 5 am) were genuinely pleasant people doing a job they like. My father met me and we had dinner at Indigo. The food was not bad and not overpriced and we were pleased. There was a very good captain/dining room manager named Diego, who certainly was the type who would go through great lengths to please. No complaints at all with Indigo which was what we were looking for. The doorman who got me a cab the next morning was also pleasant but I am probably the first person he saw in hours at that early time. It is a good sign when the staff seem happy and eager to please - good management. My room was very well equipped with comfortable king sized bed, writing desk and a decent size overall, plus a good closet. No complaints here. I paid US$110 plus taxes which I considered to be good value for what I received.

Reviews.Title: “Nice space, dead area at night”
Reviews.Author: amybatt
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here in May with a fitness conference. I got the conference rate and had a very large room with king bed and bay view. I was pleased with my stay but would not have paid the regular rate for the experience or stayed there for a non-conference event. The hotel is immaculately clean and the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. Bed was large and comfortable, bathroom was two rooms (Shower/toilet separate from vanity/sink) and always cleaned. Breakfast (not included) was delivered promptly and was excellent. It was pricy ($30) but had much more than I could ever eat and it was healthy! If you don't want to order in breakfast, there is a Starbucks on the ground floor of the hotel that always had a line but never seemed to run out of food or coffee. Everything is charged out though, from wireless access to the mini bar to the health club. Nothing was gratis. That is easily avoidable though if you buy your drinks elsewhere and have a Blackberry for internet/email connections. The conference space is large and nice and well kept. The staff were great about meeting all our needs and keeping the place clean. Since the conference was at the hotel, I spent the bulk of my time actually inside there. Nearby though, there is not much to offer. The area is dead on weekend days, in fact it was tough to find a meal outside the hotel on Sat/Sun. Hard Rock Cafe and Bongo's (Gloria Estefan's restaurant) are nearby. I ate at both and that was just average, as you might expect. There is a great little Cuban sandwich shop near the hotel but other than that not much. It was a $20 cab ride to South Beach. If I were just visiting Miami and didn't have business in the nearby financial district or was attending a conference, I would not choose to stay here just because there isn't much nearby worth staying for.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: JKDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1 night. the hotel was elegantly designed, the rooms were large and nicely decorated, and the bed was really comfortable. (Intercontinental hotels nationwide seem to have upgraded their beds recently.) Free WiFi access. The rate was excellent. On the negative side: the hotel is far from restaurants or any nightlife, and there is nowhere pleasant to walk from the hotel. Breakfast is expensive (but there is a Dunkin' Donuts across the street).

Reviews.Title: “Just an ok experience”
Reviews.Author: tracers73
Reviews.Content: Room was fine for our needs. Room service way overpriced. $50 for a hamburger and 2 bottles of waters. Seriously??? No way should that have cost $50.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay there unless you have to”
Reviews.Author: stephamm
Reviews.Content: a very indifferent hotel experience. the waitresses at the bar lounge were fabulous, so go there for drinks, but not for anything else. room carpet was stained and worn, closet safe didn't work, and the concierge never made the reservation i asked him to make for a business dinner! spa ok but hard to negotiate, and the help seemed a bit baffled at times. hotel is not close to the beach, but is at the other end of a seemingly endless downtown, which is apparently dangerous at night. there is NO boat to South Beach -- something that the website specifically advertizes.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling, elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ingle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in April, 2009. We came for a conference and had booked a "club room". On arrival we were delighted to be informed that we were being upgraded to an Executive Suite. It was huge, with marble foyer, 2 bathrooms, living and dining suite larger than ours at home, separate office, on the top floor, with a view over the bay. It was, in a word, stunning. There was no explanation of why we were chosen to be upgraded, and I would imagine that that is in itself a highly unique experience. Everything about this hotel was gracious, immaculate, lovely. The surrounding area was great for walking, restaurants, and shopping. I would have preferred a hotel close to the south beach area, however, as that is where the vibe and most fascinating people watching exists, Not to mention the beach itself. But our stay was for a conference, and the Miami Intercontinental was quite ideal in all other respects. The staff was unfailingly professional, pleasant, and positive. The lobby showpiece is a giant Henry Moore sculpture, the colour and texture of which are integrated in the lobby's decor. Striking and beautiful. The food in the bar and restaurant (which are side by side on the ground floor) are interchangable. So if you prefer the restaurant menu but the more casual atmosphere of the bar, as we did, you can dine in the latter with the former's menu choices. The club lounge (floor 29?) was inviting and attractively decorated, the snacks and breakfasts were lovely, and the happy hour drinks (a selection of wines, champagne, beer and spirits) were complimentary. In other hotel club floors, this is not always the case. The wait staff (especially Aristides) were all superb. I highly recommend this upscale and elegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: nurse61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 7 nights; my husband's conference held there. The room we booked was supposed to be with harbor view, but the view we got was of another building. The room, however, was large and clean.Check-in was very smooth, but at check-out we found, that we were billed for 2 breakfasts, that we never even ordered. When my husband noticed it, the manager apologized, but when my husband received a statement from the credit card, the charge was still there. Each room is supposed to have a safe-we could not find one in our room. There is a mini-bar in the room, but here is the trick:everything inside is computerized, so if you take something out, you'll be billed for it regardless of consumption (small print on the inside of the door of the mini-bar). My advise is to stay away from this hotel, but if you must, beware of hidden/extra charges, always check the paper at the sign-out and credit card statement when it comes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: AussieGoGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the here this January gone and also in January 2008 for work sales meetings. I found the standard of the hotel to be very good both times. In '08 my only criticism would have been the food, which was all catered for by the hotel for the meeting - they rectified this this year, and it was over 100% better - so well done. Maybe the company splashed out on a better food and beverage package - who knows? Whatever they did the catering was excellent this time. The location is great if you want to spend time in Miami city, and the hotel is right on the harbour and just a short stroll to the Bayside tourist complex - which is okay for a bit of light shopping. If you want to go to South Beach it's a 10 minute taxi ride - if there's no traffic - so if you want to be near the nightlife I suggest looking at a hotel in South Beach instead. This is an excellent choice of hotel for running corporate events and conferences. There is ample conference facilities and break-out rooms, and the evening events (those held in-house) were all well catered for. The hotel bar is not the best, but it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, hot-or-miss service, nickled and dimed”
Reviews.Author: cmc002
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights for a conference. Hotel is in a good location next to Bayfront park and the Bayside marketplace. Lobby and conference facilities are attractive. Had a king room booked, check-in was relatively efficient. Upon entering my room, found that it was a double-bedded room. No mention of this was made at check-in. No one picked up the phone at the front desk when I called to try to change to a king. Had to go all the way back downstairs and wait in line at the front desk to change rooms. The rooms are ok. They're fairly large, and furnishings are relatively new and in good condition. Bathroom tiles and carpet are dark and give the room a somewhat old and dingy appearance although it actually was pretty clean. Sheets were a little musty. The pool is wedged in between two highrises and doesn't get much sun. There are charges for everything. Internet is $12/day. They tack on a $3/night "housekeeping fee" which no one ever mentioned until checkout. This despite the fact that I kept the do-not-disturb sign on and no one ever cleaned my room. What, is housekeeping now considered an "extra" and not included in the hotel rate? Was given a late checkout which was appreciated. Overall, OK business hotel but I definitely wouldn't pay rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice deal.”
Reviews.Author: sebawhite
Reviews.Content: We payed nothig for the kind of service we received. Room upgraded just becouse it was my birthday. Incredible view. Nice swimmingpool. Lovely unknown staff. The breakfast is incredible but too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, close to downtown.”
Reviews.Author: HEA_Russ
Reviews.Content: The Spa was closed for being built out, that was a bummer, but I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: snc75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on feb 8th & 14th, 2009 (Before and after my cruise) and i must say the hotel was very convenient. Its approx $22.00 cab ride from the Miami airport, only $8.50 cab ride to the Miami Port, 4-5min walk to Bayside mall, the rooms are clean and modern, and the staff was very helpful in all areas. For those on a budget the hotel restaurant may be a little less pricey, however, your walking distance from some less expensive ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ll72
Reviews.Content: Though we got a great rate on our room at this hotel (we stayed for 3 nights at the end of December 08) there were hidden extras that could really bump up the price of your stay here. You have to pay to use the gym and just about everything else on the premises. The valet parking (the only option) is pricey too. The location is great though and the views from the harbour view room really were something special. As you'd expect from the price you pay the bathroom is huge which is a bonus when travelling with family. Unfortunately we found the beds very uncomfortable which was a disappointment as was the time it took just to check-out of the premises. It all seemed a little disorganised and the level of customer service was way below standard given this is a 5 star hotel. Nothing significant to spoil our holiday but next time I would forego the views and room size to save a few dollars and stay just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Got a great rate, and can't complain!”
Reviews.Author: GTB
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights pre-cruise first few days of 2009. We got an excellent rate thanks to internet and booked a deluxe harbor view king room directly with Intecontinental. A few days before arrival we received a welcome email from the hotel concierge containing helpful Miami information, which was a nice touch. We arrived in the evening, checked in and were quickly sent to our room. Upon arrival, we noticed the room had a view of downtown. After calling guest services we were set up with the deluxe room on the 25th floor. The room was clean and fairly large, nice bathroom with a separate shower. I didn't think the room was in 5 star condition though. Since it was fairly late, we ordered food from room service, which was pricey but not bad considering the 5star status of the hotel, and the food was ok. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant in the morning which was also pretty good but $$$. We really enjoyed the view of the harbor, facing directly the Port of Miami, we enjoyed watching the ships come and go, and even seeing our ship arrive early in the morning on Saturday. We also got to see all the small boats and even some sea creatures were visible all the way from 25th floor. We watched a couple of dolphins and a some sea cows swim around the bay. The location was great. It was easy to go to South Beach by bus, and the bayside marketplace was very close. We used the TV express checkout, which was a breeze. Overall we enjoyed our stay. I can't say that I would give this hotel 5 stars based on the room condition, and we definitely would not pay the full price to stay there, but if you can get a good deal, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “A La Cart Charges for everything”
Reviews.Author: JenAtlanta10
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by saying that parking costs $34 dollars a day. I may have been ok with this had I known, but I did not see this anywhere when I booked using the hotel website. The manager was quick to show me where the charge was buried in the website rather than to come to some agreement since this was a suprise. Be careful when staying here.....there is a charge for just about everything including to use the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Relaxing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BlushPell
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed one night prior to cruising at the Port of Miami. We had a room on the seventeenth floor overlooking the bay. When we woke up in the morning it was nice to see our ship before we set sail, it just added to the excitement. We arrived around 6pm and we quickly checked in. The front desk was helpful and told us that there were dining facilities within the hotel but we decided to head over to Bayside Marketplace instead. It is pretty touristy but we found a Cuban restaurant(more like diner) that we very authentic. We were the only people in the restaurant that spoke English and our waitress was friendly even though we had a little trouble communicating. The restaurant was The Latin American Cafeteria. Very good! Highly recommended. We walked around and then headed back to the hotel. There is no where in the marketplace to buy supplies for a cruise but we asked a friendly bellhop and he directed us to a CVS two blocks up the street. Just hang a left out the front door and head up two blocks. We stopped by Starbucks in the lobby but ended up going to the breakfast buffet that was provided in the hotel restaurant. It was pricey $57 with a tip but we really enjoyed it. Very relaxing and much better than an old baked good at Starbucks. The gym is really nice. They do charge and extra $15 per person for a 24 hour period. Since we checked in at 6pm we used the gym both the day we checked in and the next morning. I tell you it is the best $15 I ever spent. Not so much for the gym (which is very adequate, free water too grab and extra for later). but the spa! With the fee you get to use the steam room, they have chilled towels for when you get out, a drench shower with soothing music and lights, a green tea energy drink. Then the ladies room has towels, soap, shaving cream in the shower, hair gel, dryers, and almost anything you need. They do provide a robe and slippers to use in the sauna. It was the BEST! I would have stayed for a week just to use it. The cab rides in Miami are a little expensive just like any other city. From the airport it was about $25 and to the cruise port about $10. I did notice though that there was a monorail to the left of the hotel and the map was posted if you wanted to get around. It came by quite often. I have read reviews of this hotel and cannot imagine how anyone encountered rude staff. The staff here was nothing but helpful and friendly. The rooms are clean and comfortable and very spacious. The televisions need a little updating(still big and bulky) and the ironing boards are a little flimsy. The views are wonderful from the higher floors. The elevators were not slow when I was there and most times I was the only one in it. Check out was under 5 minutes for me. I would recommend staying here post or pre cruise for the right price. I cannot comment on what it would be like to stay for business since I did not need any of the business facilities. At their normal rate of $350 it is a bit steep but if you can get a deal or want to splurge and are looking for a nice hotel then you will enjoy the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Check Out Takes 40 Minutes, So Plan Ahead”
Reviews.Author: legibet
Reviews.Content: Stayed this hotel for 3 nights for a conference. Hotel interior and exterior is nice and restaurant food and services are good. But front desk has problems. We had to spend 40 minutes because a woman in the front desk could not get a correct charge amount. She did not understand how to split two-night charge among three persons and one-night charge between two persons. Due to this long waiting in check-out, I barely caught my plane, yet the woman refused to apologize. She said "I misundertood and am here to learn. Why do I need to apologize?"

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: tinamagill
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view, very clean and accomodating. Lots of restaurants in the area. We had a meeting there and the food was fantastic, buffet filled with great food and fresh sushi. The bar is a fun night spot. The staff was friendly and provided excellent customer service. Hotel rooms are big! Price is pretty good for the type of service you receive. The only bad thing is the distance from South Beach, it is a bout a $15 - 25 cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: coolio
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2nd weekend of November with Priceline rate of $72. I ummmed and ahhhhed about whethet to give this a 4 or 5 star and I went with 4. It was a great rate considering south beach this weekend was about $190 for a similar rated hotel. Something just was a bit amiss with this hotel. The room looked a bit sparce. It had everything, in fact had shedloads of storage space, but it just didn't gel well in the way most hotels I've stayed in did. It wasn't diappointing, it just didn't have the wow factor. Some very nice touched though, such as the storage space, drawers and closet space aplenty. The best was gorgeous, wasn't so much a pillow top, more a duvet top :D A nice few of the 22nd floor. There is a free downtown monorail (monomover or something like that) and we ate at PF Changs at lunchtime before heading off to South Beach (bus about 100yards from the hotel was $2). It overlooks the park, and just the other end of the park (5min walk) if a Hard Rock cafe and Bubba Gumps. Just a bit along from that is the American Airlines Arena so perfect to the see the Heat play. We were very happy we stayed here and would stay here again if we ever took a trip to Miami again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: SandieMarie
Reviews.Content: Booked as a post cruise stay can see the hotel from the cruise ship port. When we arrived there was a red carpet out I didnt know they knew of our arrival! alas some one important was staying there and the carpet disappeared before our eyes. Plenty of staff around bell boys etc to help with taxis and luggage. No problem with check in very quick. Room a good size decor more on the trad. side. Taxi from port only $20and to South Beach about $30 for a great day out. Not much to do downtown other than Bayside. There is a bus that stops outside the Hotel several times a day to take you to Dolphin Mall $10 rtn for all the shoppies - that took most of the day and we got everything we needed plus stuff we didnt need!!!!!. The pool was closed as there was a big conference on so we asked to use the spa foc as they usual charge $15 a day which is a bit cheeky as we are staying at the hotel. After visiting the spa I would have paid the $15 it was very posh. Didnt eat or drink there as was very busy with the conference they took up most of the hotel, but didnt cause us any problems everyone was very polite just had to queue a couple of times for the lift. A great stay post and pre cruise for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: greenwavemom
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8:00 pm after a long day of travel and were greeted with we don't have any record of you requesting double rooms. I had booked through Priceline and knew that I needed to call and request double rooms at their discretion. I was assured two weeks prior that it was taken care of and was no problem. After 45 minutes of standing in the lobby, we were given two double rooms. Great, all set. Went to the Bayside Market for dinner and got soaked on the way back, but still had fun. We went to bed and at 12:30 pm we were awakened to someone opening our door. luckily we had on the security lock, but it was scary. Then the phone rings and a lady demands to know who is in the room. I explain who I was and thought that was the end of it. Then the door opens again and they are pushing against the lock. By this time I was getting ready to call security and lo and behold security calls me and says they are on their way up and demanded ID. I showed them my ID and my room keys and they said I could stay (thanks!). It seems they had overbooked the hotel and were having computer problems. I then asked to speak to the manager and was informed he was busy. They were having some sort of pagent and several weddings in the hotel, so I figured I would take care of it in the morning. After a night of little sleep, I went down to check out and asked to speak to the manager again. He was still busy (VERY BUSY GUY). At this point I just wanted to leave and start my cruise. The gentleman behind the desk just kind of shrugged and said he would tell the manager what happened and we left. I was very disappointed and if this is 4* treatment give me the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: simba432
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms and friendly staff - we had fun!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvstotravel1
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel--great precruise hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Veronika78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in August and had a fantastic time. Except for the last couple of days being a little rainy and wet, we were very happy with the hotel. Being priority club members, we had to check in on the 29th floor and were upgraded to a nice spacious room with bay view on the 17th floor. We had a card welcoming us to the hotel and bottled water waiting in the room, which was nice, especially after a long flight from the UK. The room was very clean and the house keeping staff came round in the evenings to offer a turn down service. They would fill the ice box with ice, prepare the beds for sleep if needed and leave a card with the weather forcast for the next day. We once left a note to asking for teaspoons in our room and this was delivered before the end of the afternoon. Room service was very good too. We only ordered tea (as I had a fllu for a few days). This cost us $14 and we got about 6 herbal tea bags with lots of honey jars and lemons to last a few days!! We used the restaurant 3 times. Twice for breakfast and once for dinner (the Miami Spice offer). We were very happy with the food and service. The breakfast in particular had a lot of variety ranging from fresh fruit to cereals, cold meats, cheeses, pastries and hot foods. We have never had such fresh pastries in a hotel before. $21 might seem like alot to some people and we thought it at first but then, for the food we got, it wasn't bad at all. Both times we had breakfast, we didn't feel hungry at all during the day and only had a snack or light meal in the evening. We didn't use the pool but did have a look and wouldn't have minded relaxing by the pool except for the weather preventing it. We spent a lot of time away from the hotel, sightseeing the everglades, Key West and Key Biscayne. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in downtown Miami and right by the water front with views of Miami Port. Transport by trains and buses are a little inconvenient (time consuming) so we hired a car for a few days so we could explore the city and beyond. If you want a lazy beach holiday here, then stay around South Beach and Miami Beach. It takes about 10-15 mins to drive to the beach area from downtown and you have to pay for parking. The Bayside Mall is just near the hotel and has restaurants, shops and boat trips. They also have live entertainment in the evenings, which is nice to enjoy. There isn't that much to do in downtown so plan your trip well and make sure you know what you're doing. Having a car is an added bonus. We were happy to stay here as we loved the relaxing grounds of the hotel and short walk to the Bayside mall. Our room was very comfortable and we loved the views we had.

Reviews.Title: “We got staff infections!”
Reviews.Author: tabadaba
Reviews.Content: We all got Pseudomona a water born staff infection caused by poorly maintained hot tubs. It causes large painful sores all over the body. The hotel staff was very nice until the illness erupted and then they were horrible. The money we spent in medical bills made the trip very expensive. They charge you to use the fitness center which we discovered after paying was under construction. During the construction the fitness center consisted of a hotel room with a few pieces of work out equipment in it. There is one overpriced restaurant, one very overpriced bar/lounge and the most expensive Starbucks I have seen outside of Japan. The fancy decor did not make up for the wicked experience we had here. I reported them and the hotel was inspected.

Reviews.Title: “Top rate hotel - stingy with service”
Reviews.Author: zsazsablanca
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great - nice view, beautifully appointed rooms BUT beware - do not touch anything in the fridge as the items are electronically monitored and if you so much as lift something up for more than 30 seconds, even if you did not consume it, it will go into your bill. You will not be able to use the fridge in the room as it is well stocked up with drinks, etc. Intercontinental offers fridge for a fee of $30 a day! Little hotels like La Quinta Inn, Best Western, etc all have fridge in their rooms and do not charge for it. Also, their website says they have internet in the rooms. This is misleading, you still have to pay for use of internet. Plus point is that it is very close to the Bayside Market place.

Reviews.Title: “Attitude at the front desk.”
Reviews.Author: CHIZLMINIZL
Reviews.Content: One of my collegues spoke to Enrique to request to have an international newspaper to be printed in advance and have it readily available at the front desk for me. I made this small request in advance because I know that it takes a good twenty minutes for this special newspaper to print; and I couldn't be late to work. Once I arrived to the front desk I speak to Lauren Perez and advise her that I'm here for the paper. She replies, "There's no paper here!" and her response was accompanied with urban hand gestures, the rolling of eyes, and a clear view that she seemed bothered. I explained that I made this request in advance about 30 minutes ago. She asked if I spoke to someone and I told her. Lauren called Enrique and asked, "Did anyone request a paper?" Once she recieved the response she hung up the phone turned to me and abruptly said, "Nope! No paper!" I continued to say that I'll still wait for the paper because I HAD to show up to work with it. I also added if there was anywhere that I can eat breakfast in the mean time. Lauren suggested Starbucks. I replied, "Is that it?"
