So then Lauren replies, "Well, everything else in here is too expensive!" That left another bad taste in my mouth. Why is she assuming its too expensive for me? Isn't she supposed to promote the hotel? Who is she to judge? Is she implying that I can't afford it? I ignored her and proceeded to the hotel restaurant for breakfast which clearly was not expensive. The restauarant was very good and the waiter Vincente was very clean, prompt, and attentative. The eggs benedict were cooked perfectly with a correct portion of potatos. Overall a good experience at the restaurant. When I was done I went back to the front desk to pick up the paper and another agent Patricia helped me. Patricia was very kind, attentive, and professional by asking if there was anything else that she can assist me with. I thanked her very much and went on my way.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views, but ready to nickel and dime you”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRedBear
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference that was split between the main convention center and opera house/hall that collectively comprise the Arsht Center (previously known as the Carnival Center). The hotel's location is probably the best location of any hotel downtown. Across the street from a Metromover station, right on the waterfront (with wonderful views of Biscayne Bay), 5-minute walk to Bayside Market. This area of downtown probably has the most restaurants/shopping of anywhere in downtown (as the area north of the causeway is a wasteland and Brickell is pretty much a business district). Not exactly convenient to Miami Beach or South Beach, but $1.50 direct bus ride gets you to both in about 1/2 hr. Didn't try the restaurant or bar as I had heard they were extraordinarily expensive. For us, the Starbucks worked as an acceptable breakfast option and all the restaurants at Bayside Market provided plenty of variety and prices ranges. Room was small but with a view to die for and convention rate was reasonably priced. Furnishings were in good condition and housekeeping was thorough (although slow, they typically didn't start working until mid to late afternoon and we needed to hang out in the lobby more than once while they were finishing up). Unfortunately, the pool is only open during daylight and one must walk through the spa in order to get to it (very odd layout). Nothing special about the pool area but attendants were attentive. Now to the nickel and diming. A $3/day housekeeping fee was added to the final bill. When asked about it, we were told that it was in lieu of a housekeeping tip and it was only added on the final five days of our stay (we were there nine nights altogether). So apparently, if you don't tip housekeeping staff, you get reported and it is added to your bill. We were also billed for a bottle of red wine (which we never even saw in the room) and a number of items from the fridge (which was opened and items removed to make space for a gallon of milk but the items were replaced by us the next day). We explained to reception that we didn't consume any of the items and that housekeeping never 'replenished' anything (as we put the original items back in the fridge) and reception was very good about taking the charges off our bill. Didn't go for the $12/day internet access because the conference provided internet terminals (what is it with 4 & 5* hotels charging an arm and a leg for wireless, but motel chains give it to you for free?). As long as your careful about the nickel and diming, this is a stylish hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “It does not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: amandel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite expensive. I was travelling on business, the hotel is luxury and well located, this is ok. However the remaining it does not worth the high prices. The service is just regular, the vallet price (if you rent a car) is out of this world - too expensive, the breakfast too. Even if you travel on business, I recommend you to save some dollars and patience staying at hyatt regency next to it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: slh1913
Reviews.Content: I got my room for $128 on Hotwire. I LOVED this hotel! We stayed there one night, during a 3 night Memorial Weekend stay with the other two nights being in SoBE. I loved loved loved this hotel! I wish we could've stayed there the entire time. Check in was painless. There was no line and no hassles at the front desk. The elevator service was quick and our room was easy to find. The lobby and room decor was brightly colored and very contemporary. The hotel has a very metropolitan feel. The guy at the front desk was great. We didn't spend much time in the room because we were in MIAMI and ready to party! My only complaint is that ordered room service late that night and they never delivered it to my room. I wasn't too upset though because I was a little tipsy so I just fell asleep. The next morning I ordered breakfast in and they delivered that very promptly. At check in they tried to charge me for the room service that never came but once I explained what happened they immediately fixed the mistake. The hotel is about a $20 cab ride from South Beach so if you stay there but plan to visit SoBe you should keep that in mind. I don't have any complaints about the hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: carafid
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean. I stayed for a conference. The pool area is nice, not quite big enough. The beach is a 15.00 cab ride away so realize that this hotel is in the city. The plus side is the bayside market.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel Close to Shopping & Cruise Port”
Reviews.Author: Beachbum37
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through easyclicktravel.com for $250 a night. I would have never paid the listed rate of $550.00! My best friend and I stayed here for 1 night before our cruise the next day. We were on the 25th floor & paid a $30 upgrade fee for a view of the cruise port ~ it was worth it. What a beautiful hotel. The staff were all super friendly & very helpful. Our room was fantastic with two very comfy queen beds and a wall of windows overlooking the bay and shopping area. The bathroom was huge with a wonderful tiled shower & big tub. The sink, vanity & closet area were separated by a door from the toilet and shower. There was also a very plush bathrobe available. Beware of the mini bar! The items inside were very expensive & if you as much as lifted them out of their spot, you were immediately charged for that item. Somehow the fridge was electronically connected to the front desk. We were able to walk right over to Bayside Marketplace for lots of shopping, restaurant choices and live music. In the morning we took advantage of the Starbucks located right in the lobby of the hotel. We went ahead & checked out early but asked if we could leave our bags with the porter. They charged us $1.00 per bag which is not much, but we felt was really not fair. We could have just left them in the room & checked out later. We said as much but they would not budge. So we just let that per bag charge be their tip for putting the luggage in the taxi when we came back. Overall a wonderful hotel & I would definitely stay there again. Very up to date with all the modern conveniences & absolutely spotless. Fantastic views. Short walk for shopping & restaurants. Five minutes from the cruise port.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ac1510
Reviews.Content: This is a good 4 star hotel for people who are going on cruises or wanting to be close to downtown Miami. It's about 10 min by taxi to South beach which was not that bad for us. If you like to sit by the pool all day DON'T stay here- the pool gets pretty well no sun in the afternoon due to a condo that is directly beside it. The service was great at the hotel and the rooms were comfortable and clean. There were a few issues with getting internet service in the rooms but guest services was quick to deal with all problems. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlisonSaskatchewan
Reviews.Content: Really glad we stayed here. The room was clean with never ending hot water. The bed was very comfortable with great linens. The gym was well supplied with equipement, and was open 24 hrs. We ate at the restaurant our 1st night there and the food was tastey and reasonably priced. The conceiges gave accurate advise. The Enterprise car rental was close by and we left the car in the hotel lot, and they picked it up, nice service. The pool area was nice and clean. We would definetly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaLima
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have shared a Deluxe Room for 8 nights in April, 2008 while we were in Miami for the Sony Ericsson tennis tournament. We are used to stay at Mandarin Oriental, but since the lowest room rate there was $794, we decided to try a new hotel. InterContinental was our choice. UPs: The room (2921) was large and comfortable. The separate bath and shower was a plus. There were plenty of closet space and I promptly got the 10 extra hangers I asked for. I missed a breakfast table with chairs, but the the business desk was very useful. The room was located at Intercontinental Club Level, which had many free amenities, like substantial continental breakfast, afternoon tea, happy hour and soft drinks throughout the day. SeÃ±or Aristides, the Club waiter, was very helpful and attentive. DOWNs: Conferences and corporate events were held there all the time, what made valet service really slow some times and gave the hotel a business atmosphere. The restaurants are not particularly attractive. The Indigo (Lobby Level) had insufficient staff and the hamburger we had at the Blue Water Cafe (pool level) was almost unbearable. The check out process took us about 40 minutes, since a double parking fee and many items from the refreshment center were wrongly added to our bill. By the way, be aware of hidden costs like daily parking fee ($34), internet access ($55 a week), breakfast buffet ($ 26) and late checkout fee ($100 till 6 pm). Conclusion: On the whole, our stay was something disappointing, since we were expecting a warmer service. The impersonality of a large hotel could be felt everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Intercontinental Miami”
Reviews.Author: DeeCee26
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of hotels in the Miami/Coconut Grove area when I visit for the Sony Ericsson tennis tournament and they were all booked, so I made a reservation at this hotel. After reading the reviews on this site, I was worried about my stay. I didn't have to be. I found everyone at the hotel friendly and helpful and the rooms quiet and clean. I ate one meal at the hotel and the food was good. I was there for 4 nights and had no negative experiences. The location of the hotel was convenient for my trips to Key Biscayne.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: tqlagold
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel only for 1 night because originally we had a reservation at Conrad Miami but they oversold our room. So they moved us to Intercontinental. I like the lobby, the front desk staff were really friendly and nice. The room is big, but kind of old looking, compare to Conrad (minimalist and modern). But the room is clean. The bath tub in the bathroom took forever to fill up. But the water pressure in the shower is great. They separate the bath tub and shower area from the sink area, which is nice. We had dinner at the restaurant downstairs. The food was awesome and the wine was delicious. Overall.....it's a pleasant stay, but I prefer more modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience to date!”
Reviews.Author: Malphaba
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this site, I went to this hotel with mixed expectations, but I ended up not being disappointed. When I first checked in, they did not have my reservations on file (even though I had email confirmation and everything to prove I had made them). However, there was no complication or hesitation and my room was upgraded to an accessible room (I use a wheelchair when I travel) with harbor view at no extra charge! I was already impressed. The room was wonderfully comfortable with a HUUUGE bathroom that had an accessible shower as well as benches. I did not use the accessible shower, but being of short stature, I found the shower chair excellent to use to reach the sink. The peep hole in the door and thermostat was also lowered which I've never see anywhere else! Bonus points! The beds were very comfortable, and the highlight of our stay was spending the late afternoon in the luxurious heated pool. The drinks were divine albeit a bit overpriced, but I just assume get what I pay for and we did! We ate in the hotel restaurant once, and the service was a bit slow, but the food was good, and the room service was outstanding. They served us the best breakfast we had the entire time we were in Florida. Absolutely divine. The towels were great, the staff was very helpful, I was able to connect to the internet successfully and hold a great connection (although I think it's unfortunate to pay for internet when you're already paying to stay there...but again it's worth it for the decent/consistent connection). Overall, I really don't have complaints except for maybe the added charges and fees, but I adore this place and would consider it in a heartbeat if I planned a trip to Florida... it is truly worth every cent!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bellmen wee the best!!”
Reviews.Author: blooney
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay! Family of 6 with a three year old in a luxury hotel! We pulled it off! Very helpful staff at the door. Room was clean, bathroom great with large area for dressing, did not feel like a hotel bathroom. Gorgeous view for a thirty dollar upgrade. This was a priceline deal, two rooms Feb 29th, 2008 for $205.00 each. It was worth it. (Didn't like view of first room we had, so husband went down and payed the thirty extra for better room.) Watched everything happening outside including helicopters flying by, cool! Regular room rates are $439. and up. Not sure I'd want to spend that. Pool was fantastic! WARM, VERY WARM! That was GOOD! Felt so relaxing and spa like. Outdoor bar area. No other children in sight. Not a super family oriented hotel, but you can make it work. Nice playground/park area steps away from hotel. Did not get a chance to get there, visit was over to quickly. Bayside was okay. Not what I thought it would be, and be careful at night. But, on the other hand my 23, 21, and 19 year old daughters LOVED bayside shopping. My daughter fell in love with a straw hat on Espanyola Way, but didn't want to spend the $38.00 on it. She found the identical hat for $15.00. My three year old grandson had his picture taken while holding huge parrots for $20.00 He loved it! He held a baby alligator and snake as well! Almost took a flying leap down the stairs of the lobby, embarrased myself and scared the life out of myself, but it seemed no one saw!! Then a few moments later the lady from the front desk came and helped me with my bags. She didn't say a word, just helped me. Nice of her. Bellman negotiated the taxi fare with driver who wanted to overcharge us. He just told the driver how it was going to be! Thank you Mr. Bellman! Sorry, can't remember his name, but again bellmen were the best! They helped us get a stroller for the day that was a lifesaver!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: sonhomeu
Reviews.Content: I planned and hosted a conference at the hotel and was very impressed with the accomodations and the staff. The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and the hotel is gorgeous. The room was luxurious, the bed comfortable, and the view of the harbor and port and Miami beach - awesome. I loved the beautiful bathroom and the shower was great. It also has a nice pool area with a heated pool and 2 jacuzzis that were very relaxing. The hotel food was also delicious. I couldn't say more great things about this hotel...I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, great pre-cruise location”
Reviews.Author: Pleasant1
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night pre-cruise. Could see our ship from the hotel. Beautiful views of the bay from the hotel poolside bar. Short walk to Bayside area - lots of shops and restaurants. Short cab ride to ship in morning. Felt very safe in area - even walking through park at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: RockChalk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterContinental during our trip to Miami for the Orange Bowl. The hotel is not on the beach, but it's in a great location in downtown Miami. Our one complaint was related to check-in. We arrived on New Year's Day, and LOTS of people were checking out and checking in that day. It took about 5 hours for the hotel to get us into our room. I know it was a busy day (and a holiday), but this seemed like an extraordinarily long time to wait. Nonetheless, the room was very spacious, and the bed was was comfortable. Our room had a great view of Biscayne Bay.

Reviews.Title: “No Value Here!”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: We were leaving on a cruise and needed one night prior in Miami for a hotel stay. I called Intercontinental and the hotel sounded like a good choice. The rated quoted was $239.00 for a double room. I went a head and booked it. I wrote down in my day planner $239.00 and gave them my credit card. When we checked in the front desk told me my rate was $525.00. I was shocked. I would have never booked a $525.00 for one pre-cruise night! The desk insisted that is what I was quoted and would not hear my plea. I wanted to find a different hotel, but was told my credit card was charged and this room was NONREFUNDABLE. I was stunned any rate for $525.00 NONREFUNDABLE. I lost the argument and we went up to the room. The room was nice for $239.00, but had no value for $525.00. It was just a standard hotel room, small, two twin beds and an average sized bathroom. The only thing special was that we had a nice view of the port. The hotel is large and full of groups and cruise passengers. I hope they all got better rates than we did! The lobby is stunning with fresh flowers and big dramtic sculptures. We had breakfast at the hotel in the lobby. The setting was dramatic and the food was good. However once again it was high priced and I felt ripped off. This is a good hotel. I have few complaints about the level of service, decor or comfort factor. I was amazed at the room rate and totally felt the hotel made a mistake. The attitude of the front desk and management was - "we don't care". If I got a better rate at this hotel I would stay here again, but never again at this rate.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stray off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: imamac2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two days before embarking on a cruise. Nice, clean, fancy hotel. Little pricey, paid $5 for a smaller then small iced tea by the poolside. A couple blocks Northeast is Bayside Mall, which was nice to see and visit-highly recommended for something to do while visiting. Nightlife at Bayside Mall was also nice, they have a couple spots that have live bands playing outside. One block West of the hotel was downtown and lots of shops, but very, very run down. Even scarey and would not want wander down that way at night in the dark. Hotel is literally a 5 minute cab ride to Miami port. Don't care much for the section of the city we stayed in but this was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler8989
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night before embarking on our Cruise. I was a little leery of all the negative comment I've read regarding the friendliness of the hotel staff; I'm happy to report that there were no unpleasant incidents at all. The lady at the front desk did not try to sell us anything additional. We were given a room facing the bay where we enjoyed the view of our cruise ship and saw dolphins playing in the water. The Bayside Marketplace and CVS were both a short walk away from the hotel to pick up any last minute items that you might have forgotten. The room itself was manificient, well-kept and quite large. We almost hated to leave to go onto the ship. I would definately stay here again should the opportuniry arrives.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: DesertButterfly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ICC Miami for about a month because of some work in Miami. I upgraded to the VIP level (at a cost of $150) because it made sense for the month. Had a nice view of the water, but didn't realize that Friday and Saturday nights at the nearby shopping area are very, very noisy - loud music playing until 2:00 in the morning that we could hear a block away. For some good sleep, I would have traded the view. My first night there, around 4:30 am, I heard someone trying to come into my room. My security lock hadn't worked, but fortunately the bolt was on. The person didn't respond when I challenged them so I called security. The maintenance man tried to tell me the security lock did work because he got it to work once. The minute he (and the security person and the manager) walked away, the lock didn't work, so I made them come back. Apparently the bellmen all have universal keys, and the bellman had come to the wrong room. Nevertheless, with no security bolt, I felt uncomfortable, so they moved me (and a month's worth of luggage that had been unpacked just hours earlier and had to be repacked for moving) to another room with the same view. A couple of days later, it turns out that President Bush's advance team camped out -- with all their electronic equipment -- on the floor I was on, so we were tripping over cables for about 3-4 days. There were other incidents over the course of the month as well, but the one that burned me most is a charge for a no-show that I have been trying to get removed now for 2 months. Each person I speak with tells me it's been removed and credited back to my card, but then it isn't. There were some good moments with some personnel who went above and beyond the call, but frankly, overall, this is not a hotel that I could recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zapladybug
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights on the club floor at the Intercontinental for a conference. My room was quite big with a sitting area, large desk & a fantastic bathroom. The bed was very comfortable. The TV had many more channels than most hotels offer. The club room had a variety of offerings including smoked salmon every morning & top shelf liquor & some pretty good wines at happy hour. They only had a couple computers for use though -- no wireless in the club room. The bar & restaurant were above average as well -- the restaurant has a fabulous wine list. Although my check in experience was initially awful -- stay away from Ana, customer service is not her strong point (I saw others suffering a similar fate later in my stay) -- Ruth cleared things up & made me feel welcome. Double-check your reservation -- ours were mixed up & I know of at least 3 others who had issues as well. The conference facilities were nice, although everyone was disappointed with the overcooked Chilean sea bass. The gym is tiny (they're turning the former gym into a spa opening January 2008); I later learned guests could access the facility across the street. I would definitely go back... and ask for Ruth when I got there.

Reviews.Title: “Bienvenido a Miami”
Reviews.Author: VitalyM
Reviews.Content: Intercontinental Miami belongs to a renowned British-owned luxury chain of hotels. I found everything there meeting very high standards one would expect from a good hotel. I would say it has a corporate inpersonal feel but at the same time it's very comfortable and immaculate. Living up to its name it felt truly international with multitude of languages heard in elevators and the spacious lobby. It seemed like it was a favorite spot for wealthy Latin Americans. While the hotel itself is great, it's location is somewhat of a compormise. The hotel is located in downtown with absolutely no attractions within walking distance. We were there for the wedding, so it suited us well, but if I came to Miami in order to enjoy the city I probably would stay in vibrant South Beach. Otherwise it takes about 10 minutes to cross the bridge in a car to get to the beaches from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “nice view”
Reviews.Author: kakow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Intercontinental Miami 2 weeks ago for few days. Overall, the stay was fine. We stayed at this hotel about 4 yrs ago when it was brand new. The rooms are showing its age. Since I am an ambassador member, got upgraded to a bay view executive room with a great view just like 4 years ago. The service I received at the club lounge was impeccable, but again, the club and its facility is showing its age. Need to be updated. The spa and gym was under renovation and the temporary work out facility was a disgrace. Last complaint. The front desk girl let a guy cut in front of the line while other people were waiting for 10 minutes. Need better training from the upper management. Other than this unpleasant incident, the stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: DKNoble
Reviews.Content: I was a little anxious about staying at this hotel after reading some of the reviews but i needn't have worried, my husband and I had a very pleasant overnight stay prior to our cruise. It was our first visit to Miami and our first cruise and after a long flight from the UK we were tired and wanted a pleasant environment to chill out in, we got it. The hotel seemed busy as there was a charity running event taking place outside the following day but the room was very quiet and comfortable. The bathroom was large with lots of very nice bathroom products. The hotel is well located with a park and bayside out the front, a leisurely five minute walk took us to the bayside shopping area where we had a nice breakfast overlooking the water. We had no hard sell for upgraded rooms and there were no probelms with the bill on check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TheGlobetraveler
Reviews.Content: I was on govt. travel with a colleague to a convention at this hotel, but after reading some of the other reviews we originally booked in Sept. at the H.I. port downtown @ $107. I realized the day before departure that a per diem change occurred 10/1 to $146 and changed to this hotel. Boy was I glad I did! My colleague stayed there and believe me the difference is night and day. The H.I. is obviously an older hotel and it shows, from the small lobby, worn furnishings, rather small spartan room & bath, and back office building view he had. In addition, he had forgotten his contractors govt. id and after presenting mine as his supervisor the second day, they assured us they would change his $165 rate, which he found out they did not when he checked out. In comparison, I've stayed in fine hotels worldwide and this one has one of the nicest art deco lobby's. I checked in at 3:45 PM on Sunday and there was no line and a friendly staff. When inquiring about my room view they did sell the "Ambassador Package" which I declined and proceeded to my art deco back-side room on the 19th floor. I had a direct view of the pool below, faced condos about 100 yards away, and a side-view of the bay. The large bathroom was all in stone tile, as well as the separate room with door for the toilet and shower, including the fixtures. The two queens beds were plush and comfortable with 6 pillows each. I especially enjoyed the soft glow from the orange lamp on the TV/Armoire, which was a very pleasant in the evenings. I signed up and utilized the HS internet service with no problems. The housekeeping was excellent and upon occasion when my scheduled varied, I called to request service upon departing, which was promptly performed with a voice mail left for me each time to follow-up. The fridge has micro-sensors recording each item moved, and there is no room for additional storage. Opening the door numerous times did not result in any charge. Public parking is available in front of the bldg. with about 30-40 spaces for a rate of $1.25/hr, however not permitted from 2-7 AM. The only problem I did encounter was when I couldn't get into my room on the third day. I obtained a new key from the desk and still couldn't get in, at which point they sent a clerk up with me. Neither my nor his house key worked, so he radioed for assistance after which the hotel detective arrived, verified my ID and sent up a locksmith, who reset the lock with his computer and let me in. This all took about 15 minutes. Somewhat annoying, but I felt reasonably dealt with. Check-out was fast and smooth with no erroneous charges and a taxi to the airport quickly obtained.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Watthree
Reviews.Content: Had the good fortune to stay at the Intercontinental as it was the host hotel for the ING Miami Marathon and Half Marathon. The hotel was packed but everything ran so smoothly it sometimes seemed like we were the only people there. The room was large and comfortable with a great view of the bay. Pillows and beds made me want to sleep all day! The service staff kept it clean with fresh sheets and towels. For a hotel this size, crowded as it was, the elevators were fast, efficient and roomy. Just about every staff member I interacted with was friendly and professional (with one minor front desk exception) and made me feel welcome. The location was great...close to the Miami Airlines arena, Bayfront Park and the downtown people mover. It was just a short drive to Miami Beach. I like Miami Beach, but appreciated the quiet of my 16th floor room when sleeping the night before the race. Would definitely stay here again. One note, the line at the Starbucks in the lobby can get very long, but there are plenty of great coffee places within a five minute walk if you don't mind a pleasant stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pre and Post Cruise Experience”
Reviews.Author: REDDY2CRUZ
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a 2-day pre and 1-day post cruise stay. The hotel was excellent ... supurb service, excellent room and bedding and amenities, great tour desk reception. Location was excellent, 10 mins/$10 cab ride to pier, and 20 mins/$20 taxi ride airport to hotel or pier. A short walk from hotel to Bayside Marketplace was great for entertainment, food, music, shopping. We booked a bus and boat tour of Miami from the hotel tour desk and were given preferential treatment getting on the bus and boat. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Miami either overnight or a longer period of time. There is a Starbucks in the lobby and a pub and dining area on site. Hotel was clean and had a beautiful lobby. PR BC/Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: rgs408
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights on business. The hotel was lovely. The room was spacious and had a nice view of the hotel pool and Biscayne Bay, as well as a tub and walk-in shower. Check-in was fast, and I was not pressured to upgrade my room at all. Housekeeping service was excellent. The hotel is located conveniently near the metro mover for easy access to most of downtown Miami. Overall, a nice experience--no complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Cruise Port”
Reviews.Author: buckley1205
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hotel Intercontinental Miami for one night pre-cruise on September 21, 2007. We found the hotel to be very nice. We booked the hotel on their website using a Government rate. At check-in we were offered a room on a higher floor with a view of the cruise port but the price was an additional $30. We went ahead and paid the difference. The room upgrade included a large glass bottle of water and a chocolate mousse with strawberries. The mousse was very tasty. We had a wonderful view of the bay and port area and had a corner room. The room probably was no larger than a regular room but the bathroom area was quite large and included a "hidden" walk-in shower behind the bathroom door and a full size tub. The sink area was outside the tub and toilet area which is a plus. The room had a tasteful decor and the bed was very comfortable. This hotel is a short walk to Bayside Marketplace and is situated right on Biscayne Bay. Bayside area has many amenities. We opted to eat dinner in the hotel bar/lounge area rather than brave the high heat and humidity. We were tired from the long flight from the West Coast. The bar area was non-smoking and it was happy hour so we got a 25% discount on food and drinks. We split a Club Sandwich and it was served on two plates with more than enough french fries. No extra charge for a split plate. The service was great and we were very happy to just relax over dinner. The next morning we walked to Bayside Marketplace and ate breakfast at the Latin American Cafe. The view is great as it is situated right next to a marina. The food left a bit to be desired here. I might try to find a different place for breakfast next time around. We checked out with no problem. The staff was more than willing to assist with luggage and getting a cab. The ride to the cruise port was very short and inexpensive at $6. I recommend this hotel for anyone but especially for a pre or post cruise stay. Perfectly wonderful staff and room.

Reviews.Title: “Definately 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: N2Living
Reviews.Content: Stayed here post cruise on a Friday (taxi from port to hotel $10). I was skeptical because of the reviews I read, but couldn't complain because I got a killer deal on hotwire. Never once did they try to upsell us on anything. We arrived early (9am) and tried to check in, but the front desk told us it would cost $100. So I declined and she told me to come back in 45 min. The bellman (Carlos) took our bags to store (tip only). 45 min. later we were able to get into a room on the 15th floor with a nice view of the city. After we got semi-settled, we started to hear a loud drilling noise from one of the other rooms. So we called the front desk to ask for another room. They were happy to switch us. They sent our bellman up (Carlos - Super nice kid), to move our luggage and we ended up on the 25th floor. Carlos said they were builidng a Spa on the 15th floor. So he happily moved us. This time our view was facing another hotel with a slight view of the bay. But our room was wonderful!!! The room and bathroom was top notch. Very clean and stylish with plush towels and a scale in the bathroom. The bed was super comfortable without any noise. We ordered internet service for $10.95 a day and it was nice and fast. Even though Starbucks is in the lobby of the hotel, they do not offer the Hotspot WiFi for T-Mobile customers. We walked over to the Bayside Marketplace and had dinner at a nice Cuban place. Then for breakfast, we walked across the street and found a nice little inexpensive cafe and shopped at the stores that were open. For some reason, on a Saturday, many of these stores are closed. Overall, I was extremely happy with my visit. I will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS for pre-cruise stay!”
Reviews.Author: yorkielover31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous! It was perfect for our pre-cruise stay, as we even saw our ship from our bayside window first thing in the morning. Staff was courteous and spoke clear English. It is just a short walk from Bayside which has numerous shops and restaurants. Our room's bathroom was impressive with marble and slate & we really enjoyed the spa-like complimentary samples.

Reviews.Title: “Very good downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: PFP
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located on the waterfront downtown. Short walk to the Bayside shopping and restaurant area. Big and bright lobby with comforable seating area. My room was a well maintained double with 2 very good queen beds. View was limited to the next building with a glimpse of Biscayne Bay. Bathroom was nice and spacious but the water pressure in the shower could have been better. Excellent and very well organized breakfast buffet in a relaxed atmosphere. A good place to stay if you want to be downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: b2bValencia
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at the InterContinental Miami for 4 days! Great location, nice rooms( need to be renovated soon) but our experience was market by the staff attitude and the service. Breakfast at the Indigo was very good, lunch buffet !!! great â€¦ you need to upgrate your pool restaurant. Starbucks in the lobby â€¦. My kids were so happy@

Reviews.Title: “VERY disappointing”
Reviews.Author: octofire
Reviews.Content: We were hesitant to book a room at this hotel due to the numerous negative reviews on TripAdvisor. What's posted on this website is usually pretty accurate and this was no exception. The hotel tries to sell itself as an upscale, five-star establishment....I could better describe it as a high-rise Econolodge with lots of marble and glitz. We decided to take a chance and stayed pre-cruise on July 27th. As we were arriving in Miami late morning, I phoned the Intercontinental the previous day to inquire about early check-in. The desk clerk who took my call informed me that an early check-in would be "no problem". Upon our arrival at 11:45, I was promptly told of course that check-in was at 4:00. I mentioned my phone phone call the previous day. The blunt reply was, "we have no room available, check back in two hours, NEXT". After several visits to the front desk throughout the afternoon, we were able to check-in at 3:30. The desk clerk made it pretty clear what a big favor he was doing us by letting us check-in "early" and giving me the wrong keys for the room on the 23rd floor. If you stay here, at least you can sit by the pool in your street clothes and have a drink. Don't forget your wallet though, two beers and a bad margarita will run you about $25. The room was fairly clean......nothing extraordinary. Overall, other than it's close proximity to Bayfront Park and the cruise terminal, the Intercontinental doesn't have much going for it. One good thing to mention, they left me a message on my answering machine in Rhode Island to let me know my room was ready! I guess they figured I went home to wait......

Reviews.Title: “Tries to be upscale but fails”
Reviews.Author: AlanLight
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for business. I got in at 10:30pm, hungry, so I called room service and ordered food. They said it would be delivered in 30 to 35 minutes. At 11:45 I called back to see where the food was. A different person answered the phone and told me they had no record of my order. I didn't want to wait, I was sleepy, so I told them to forget and went to bed. The next morning I enjoyed the water pressure in the shower but didn't enjoy the fact that the shower flooded the floor of the entire bathroom. I noticed this as I got out, and I also noticed a crack in the floor that water was disappearing down into. I wouldn't want to have been in the room below. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Twice in a month”
Reviews.Author: PHX
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the InterContinental Miami two weeks ago, on a stop over before a Royal Caribbean cruise, and immediately afterwards . My two kids and I really loved the hotel. On both stays, we've been given the same high quality treatment, and first class rooms with superb view to the Bayside. From our window, at the 37th floor, we could see our ship docking! The concierge has been really helpful, having spent half an hour before succeeding to get us a fine table at the best stone crab restaurant in town. I accepted the "ambassador plan", so we were entitled to early check-ins and extended check-outs. Travelling with teen-agers, it turned out to be very convenient. I strongly recommend it as the best (affordable) luxury hotel in downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kersti
Reviews.Content: Attention Convention/Meeting Planners: Please don't trap your attendees in this awful place!!!!! My husband and I are here for a medical meeting, and I've NEVER seen such shameless, high pressure bait and switch upselling anywhere. Is this really an InterContinental? CHECK IN: Be prepared for a long wait as everyone who checks in is given a brochure and lengthy sales pitch for their $150 "ambassador plan" that allows you to use the exercise facillities without paying and to check out at 4:00 pm at any InterContinental for 13 months. After you've declined at least 3 times, you then get pitched the $30 a night upgrade to a bay view room, which you will also have to repeatedly decline. If you are one of many conference attendees checking in at the same time, you can imagine how long it takes for the line to move -- very irritating after a long day of travelling. BUT IT GOT WORSE: We arrived early last eveing with only our confirmation number in hand -- BIG MISTAKE. We were quoted the conference rate of $198 a night for the duration of our stay (Tues-Sat nights), but when we checked in, they told us the rate for Saturday would be $398 because they are 98% full. We asked to speak to the manager, but she was "unavailable." Because we don't have the printed confirmation, they won't honor the rate. So....we endured the pitches for the ambasador plan and upgrades and finally got to our room. We reserved a King room and were given a room with 2 double beds. We called downstairs from the phone on the desk (the one between the beds didn't work). We said we would even take a smoking room with a King bed, but we had to listen to their pitches AGAIN before they would even check to see if one was available! Finally, one hour and 15 minutes after we drove up to the hotel, we were shown to the room we reserved...but it was smoking. That is absolutely unacceptable in my book. WATCH FOR EXTRA CHARGES: We went to dinner in the hotel's Indigo restaurant. The two of us had their buffet which was $25 per person. I ordered a glass of wine and my husband had iced tea. The salad bar was good...tossed green salad with all the typical toppings, chilled grilled vegetables, hummus, stone crab claws, assorted cheeses, roasted asparagus, caprese salad, ratatouille, etc. The entrees however, were awful. If you like those dry, salty boulliony cheap Vegas buffets, this will be right up your alley. We didn't have dessert, so I can't comment. Our bill should have been about $65 or so, but it was $80. "For our convenience," they added a 15% gratuity to our check ON A BUFFET FOR TWO PEOPLE!!! I have stayed at InterContinental hotels in New York, Chicago, Vegas and San Francisco, and I have never had an experience like this. I don't know if this is a new trend for the hotel chain, but I will never stay in another one.

Reviews.Title: “nice location bad staff”
Reviews.Author: GeneralInspector
Reviews.Content: I have never been to a hotel that was so money hungry. they wanted extra money for everything, parking, luggage, internet, etc. You better go with a lot of small bills for tips. I am a diabetic and when I asked about refridgeration for my medicine I was told that they charge $20/day to use thier fridge, ice was not available on every floor. When I tried to check in they had given my room away and I had to pay an upgrade charge to get a room similar to the one I booked weeks ago. The staff at the front desk in snooty, much of the rest of the staff are not nice. I was forced to stay here because my business meeting was here, I will consider commuting from another hotel if I have to return.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vegaslawbabe
Reviews.Content: One Tripadvisor summed it all up: this is the "Nickel and Dime Hotel, \"and I truly agree with him/her. Don't get me wrong, I like to stay in 5-star hotels, only want the best, and I would gladly pay for it as long as I get what I want. As a paying guest, they still want you to pay for using their sorry fitness center. They charge for late check out. They do not provide a Hotel Shuttle. Concierge are slow in getting back to you or not call you back. Front Desk folks are rude. The only thing I am impressed is the closet space being bigger than any other hotels I know. I am however not impressed with the service and rooms. I booked a bayview front hotel which was one of the best available on their website...however, beware because they do not list all the choices of rooms on their site because once you check in, they will ask if you want to upgrade and/or wait until you complain about your room. They will ask you to then "switch or upgrade" and make you pay more for a room that you should have received in the first place. Overall, as my friend always says, this place sucked. Don't be fooled with the opulent lobby and facade...trust me, their rooms are not all that! You will see once you see the size of their room doors. Lastly, here's one culture shock... Where I come from, it is rude to speak a language other than English to a colleague in front of English speaking guests as if the guests do not exist. I thought I was still in the US...but I guess this is Miami culture for you.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: mrmonkfish65
Reviews.Content: pre cruise stay for one night. we thought the hotel was very clean spacious and comfortable,would have been nice to have a few more nights there although the breakfast prices were very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: cruisedude22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre and post cruise and loved it. We booked through Priceline for $85 each night when the hotels website had the rooms listed at $225. You should never pay full price for a hotel room. Do the research, there is always a better deal out there. In 2003 we stayed at the Hyatt downtown and we liked the InterContinental much more. (although the Hyatt has balconies and the Inter doesn't). At checkin I asked for a port view and was told it would be $20 extra. Well worth it to see the ships pull into port in the morning. The rooms and bathrooms are both oversized. Bedding was terrific. We didn't eat at the hotel but did have pre-dinner and post-dinner drinks in the hotel bar. Very good service, decent priced drinks(for a hotel bar), and I even talked to basketball player Gary Peyton at the bar. Nice guy. Bellman and Front desk were both great. Didn't use the pool, but did sit in the hot tubs the last night. Talk about a view! Starbucks is nice to have in the lobby for a morning treat. There isn't much downtown except bayside marketplace and there are a couple good local restaurants there that should be tried. Would we stay here for a vacation, NO! But for a 1 night stay before a cruise there isn't a better deal in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Decent property”
Reviews.Author: mpugs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Intercontinental Miami at an ABA conference. We had a nice stay, but if we hadn't been at a conference there I would definitely stay somewhere else. LOCATION: The hotel was right downtown, which is good and bad. There are no decent restaurants nearby and the downtown area is pretty empty after work hours. There is a mall within walking distance, but the food there is mostly touristy stuff (Bubba Gump, Hard Rock, etc.) nothing decent. I was very happy we had a car, because there is great food to be had in that town -- especially in South Beach. SERVICE: we thought the room service, concierge and other services were terrific. We stayed in an concierge floor (for more money) so we were able to get a light breakfast and an evening social hour with food and drinks every day. Checkout was eassy, and we did not find any unwarranted charges on our bill as some have complained about. I opened the mini-bar but didnt take anything out, and there was no charge on the bill. ROOM: I thought the rooms were average, the bathrooms were pretty dated, but the beds were terrific. It looks like they tried to update the hotel, but didnt make it to the bathrooms. Overall I thought the hotel was fine, but I would rather be in South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in Miami”
Reviews.Author: CNPH
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well-located in downtown Miami amidst a building blitz, near the port and Bayside Mall. I was there for a conference and the conference accomodations were fine. Food was average. The room was comfortable but definitely in need of updating, especially the closet area. No real intereaction with staff, didn't use room service. Nice, small restaurant poolside. Bayside Mall is definitely miss-able, a real tourist type with cheap merchandise.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bridgechick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights pre- cruise at the end of November. We got a GREAT deal at about Â£70 per night on [--]- in fact I have checked prices since, and this really was a very good rate! I have read some of the negative reviews of this hotel, but must say that we had a very good experience. The reception staff were polite, the bell men were great and the concierge could not have been more helpful. The location is good, close to Bayside and with the metro mover very close by. We got a very comfortble room on the 26th floor over looking the bay, which meant we could see the cruise ships in the morning. Big bathroom with separate dressing area and plenty of towels and toiletries. We never ate in the hotel although we had a few drinks in the bar. For breakfast we simply strolled across to Bayside which has plenty of shops and restaurants to choose from. If you can get a good rate, I would definitely recommend staying here pre or post cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Indigo Restuarant S----”
Reviews.Author: safejourneys2007
Reviews.Content: Well the purpose of my letter and the reason I am writing to you is to let you know that two of my friends who flew in from Los Angeles, CA and were staying at your hotel and I had quite horrible service at your Indigo restaurant. I picked up my friends at Miami International Airport on Saturday, January 27th approximately at 5 PM. I drove them to your hotel to check in and then we decided we would like to eat and the concierge told us that Indigo was convenient and located on the premises. My friends and I were seated promptly. The restaurant was not busy. There werenâ€™t many people seating in the dining area. In fact, most of the tables were free. Granted the hotel was crowded with guests arriving for the Atlantis cruise, but most of them were in the bar area and not inside Indigo. We waited about 20 minutes to be greeted by a waiter. At which time we told him we were ready to order. He told us that he would take the drink order and come back for the rest of the order. We reminded him that we were ready to order and he interrupted us to only say, â€œI will only take your drink order for now!â€� About 15 minutes later our drinks arrived. The waiter then took our order. About 20 minutes passed and our drinks were empty. The waiter was no where in sight. We asked another waiter who was passing by if we could get refills, and he simply glared at us and told us that we needed to tell our server. Alas, our waiter did not return or was even visible for quite some time. Another 20 minutes passed at which time my friend got up and went to the hostess stand to request to see a manager. About 15 minutes later a dark haired man in a blue suit approached our table. We told him that we still did not receive our food or even refills. He said he would take care of things. Another 20 minutes passed at which time a lemonade was delivered to our table but no other drinks. Mind you, I was having lemonade, my friend was drinking Diet Coke, and his friend was having water with lemon. These are not alcoholic drinks from the bar. This is not something that requires this long of a time frame to prepare and deliver to the table. Another 20 minutes passed. By now we decided we would leave the hotel and go dine elsewhere. As we were leaving I informed a brunette named â€œMonicaâ€� that the service was horrible and that we were left waiting for such a long time. Meanwhile, the table next to us got seated AFTER us and they received their meal AND already had dessert and paid their check and were leaving before us! Monica merely said she knows and that there was nothing she could do. She didnâ€™t apologize or even sympathize with the situation. Obviously this must be a regular occurrence at Indigo! To make matters worse, my friend Jeff found out the hotel charged his credit card 4 times for his one night stay. Granted, they offered to upgrade him to a larger room. But this was such a horrible and unacceptable experience I wanted to make sure I informed you of what is going on in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room was dirty, stained apholstry, oblivious staff”
Reviews.Author: MissPoovey
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre-cruise. The best things about this hotel was the room service food (although Very expensive), and the location. I booked through the Royal Carribean website, but I called the hotel directly the week of our arrival. I requested a smoking room with a view, I was assured this was great. Upon arrival, no smoking available except on the street side of the hotel. I guess reservations and phone calls don't count, its first come first served, just like McDonald's. The staff was rude and unconcerned about my reservation or requests. Our room did look out on the pool not the street, however the bathroom door has scuff marks and the furniture apholstry was very stained. The windows were filthy and so was the tub. Very unexpected with the high class decor in the lobby and elevators. I don't think this hotel holds up to the Intercon'l reputation and is not worth the high priced rooms. Only stay here if you get a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business, beware of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: expatimmexico
Reviews.Content: I note that the reviews for this hotel are very varied indeed.. After staying there twice my familly, I really don't find it as bad as many reviewers before me. The service we recieved was in general very good and the staff was helpful to us. Especially the spanish speaking staff where great (we speak spanish) and very friendly. 1. There are only two restaurants, the main one offers very nice buffets for breakfast and lunch, with limited selection but excellent quality. The pool restaurant offers a simple menu with well tasting food. There is a starbucks in the lobby (!) so if you want to save a few bucks, you can get your coffee and snacks there! Room service is expensive, sometimes quite slow and the food quite greasy and average tasting, your better off running down to the starbucks. 2. The pool area is small and only has sun a few hours, so if your looking to spend your time in miami sunbathing, go elsewhere. 3. Valet parking is expensive, but there is a public parking in front of the hotel that is inexpensive (and you don't have to wait for your car). In general the rooms are very large and nice and the hotel is clean, luxurious and very well maintained The location is excellent smack in the middle of down town with easy access to everything. If you get a good deal on the room, or are going to Miami on business i would definately recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “High class hotel. Look out for the extra charges”
Reviews.Author: tocanada2
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights between two cruises. When I told the taxi driver to take me to the Intercontinental Hotel, he said that I must be rich. This is where the President stays. The first part is not true. Not sure about the second part. I paid $90 per night using Priceline. Total cost was $213.49 for two nights with taxes. This is a very nice luxurious hotel on the waterfront within close walking distance to the Bayside Market. Taxi ride to the port is about $10. Free Metromover is close by. Check in was very quick and efficient and I was able to get into my room at about 10.00am. Usual check in time is 4.00pm. Check out is noon. You should be aware of the extra charges as they can add substantially to your cost. Local and toll free calls from your room cost $1.14 including taxes. Long distance is $6.53 for the first minute and 88 cents for each additional minute. Room service continental breakfast costs $17 plus $3.50 per delivery plus 20% taxable gratuity and taxes. There is a small Business Center with one computer. Internet access from this computer costs $5 for the first 10 minutes. 50 cents for each additional minute. There is a fee to use the Fitness Center. Then there are the bellhops etc. I avoided all these charges. I ate at the Bayside Market and used a local internet cafe (99 cents for an hour of internet access and cheap phone cards). Last time, I stayed at the Holiday Inn. The Intercontinental is a much more luxurious hptel but the Holiday Inn has free internet access, free access to their Fitness Center and Priority card members get extras like $5 off meals in the dining room. andrew

Reviews.Title: “room was fine.”
Reviews.Author: bready
Reviews.Content: Overall I liked the hotel. Excellent interior, clean bed. but I did not like several things. 1. parking is terrible. If you use valet parking, it costs $29 for overnight, also hourly costs is $9. They do not have self parking. There is no choice for parking. 2. this hotel is located in down town miami. There is many one-way road. It was complicated to get there. 3.drain was bad. bath tub water did not drain, toilet water did not flash well. I booked this hotel through priceline. It was $105 but total cost came up to $170 (including tax and service fee and parking). I could have found other hotel in this price.

Reviews.Title: “Although a beautiful hotel, front desk staff makes stay bitter”
Reviews.Author: Martha2020
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very beautiful, but front desk staff made me feel not welcome...

Reviews.Title: “Its All True (unfortunately)”
Reviews.Author: Travel Richly
Reviews.Content: Sorry to report that the negative reviews that preceded this one are true. Other than the rooms being spacious and comfortable, there is nothing positive to report about this hotel. The negatives (again): unfriendly reception desk, requested room not available, a fee to use the fitness center, repeatedly having to ask for the room to be made up and amenities to be replenished, overpriced room service (high cost to start plus the ubiquitous, mandatory delivery charge of $3.50 plus 20% tip) and, last but not least, $10.95 plus tax for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for the day before the cruise”
Reviews.Author: tripalium
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we learned that we had been upgraded to the Club Intercontinental. This includes access to a lounge where there are two computers with free internet access, hors d'oeurves in the early evening with a fine selection of pour-your-own drinks (including wine and liquors--I sampled the Johnny Walker Black and Chivas Regal the evening we were there). There is also a more than "continental breakfast" that included hard boiled eggs, smoked salmon, and a good variety of breads and cereals. We were allowed to check out late--a real convenience since our ship didn't board until 3 PM. All day there are bottled water, tonic water, and various other soft drinks in a refrigerator (making me wonder why anyone would take these items out of the in-room bar and have to pay extra for them). I don't know if the Club level rooms are any better than in other parts of the hotel, but ours was certainly comfortable and had a view of the bay. It was a rainy night, and we had dinner in the hotel restaurant located in the lobby, otherwise we would have walked over the Bayside shopping center where there are a number of restaurants, including a Nicaraguan steak house that looked interesting. We did have lunch at a Cuban restaurant right on the water there and then walked back to the hotel for a 5 minute cab ride to the Port of Miami, which can be seen out in the bay. The Club Intercontinental rooms appear to be about $100 more expensive than the regular rooms on the hotel's website, but considering what you get, it's not a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: ryzmom
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a 7-day cruise onboard Royal Caribbean's Newest and Largest ship, the Freedom of the Seas. We stayed one night pre-cruise at the Hotel Intercontinental - Miami on October 7, 2006. The BAD stuff: First, I will start off by saying that the hotel is beautiful and very spacious. Upon arrival, we were checked in by the front desk clerk, Stephen, who wasn't too friendly at all. My travel agent booked this hotel room for us 1 year and 3 months ago and requested a Bay View, King Room - Non Smoking. There wasn't any Bay View rooms according to him when we arrived at noon. My travel agent recevied confirmation the day prior upon arrival stating that we had those amentities and there were not granted. If we wanted a Bay View room that is was going to cost us an additional $35 for the high floors and $25 for the lower floors, although he didn't have ANY to even give us at that time. So, I just took what we could get and settled for City View which was on the 22nd floor, first off. I did check back again hours later twice for Bay View rooms and nothing was still available. The rooms were beautiful with classy, colorful decor and the bed linens are luxurious and very comfortable! The towels were big and fluffy and the bathrooms were big, marble and nice! Although I had a few problems that needed to be mentioned and addressed to the management staff. There was one wall close to the bed that had a plate size mold-mildew stain on it and my husband is allergic to it and I also killed a massive bug in the shower. So, we told management, although they wouldn't even come up to look themselves, they sent a bellman up to retrieve our things and move us to the 27th floor, to which I still didn't receive a Bay View. I wasn't going to let this start my vacation off bad, so we moved to a different room at 1:00 in the morning. We receive a complimentary continential breakfast, which was $19 and consisted of ONLY fruits, juices and a muffin. THAT"S IT! We didn't get in the pool because we didn't have enough time. Although it was in a great location, the sun didn't shine down on it much because of all of the tall buildings around. But the view was AWESOME and some great pictures can be taken from it. The were so many boats to watch go by that I could sit there for days! The GOOD stuff: The restaraunt that was right next to the pool, I think it was called the Sea Blue cafe' was EXCELLENT. We had the best food there and great service and would go back in a heartbeat. The view is soooo nice! Bayside Market is very close and a short walk nearby with great shopping and restaraunts. I don't know how much taxi fare was because we didn't take one and only walked and we had a shuttle service from the Miami Airport to the hotel. But I would suggest to stay in a group at night because there were a lot of people out late in the evenings. All in all, it was a great trip, but I don't know if I would stay there again, since all the stuff we had to go through. But would definitely eat at the Sea Blue Cafe again!

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DGryg
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at the Intercontinental Miami for 2 days prior to a cruise. Absolutely georgeous lobby, italian marble everywhere. We were given a large room 2 doubles, fantastic view of the cruise ships and the harbor. All within walking distance of Bayside Center where's there's plenty to do and see. They had the absolute plushiest towels I've ever experienced -- even my husband noticed. Restaurant is expensive particularly for breakfast ($20 buffet). Pool was clean and warm. Didn't try the hottubs or the spa. Skyauction bid cost us $125/nite. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: newfietraveldiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental Miami for one evening prior to a cruise. In the past we have stayed at the Holiday Inn Port of Miami which was fine. However, I actually paid less for the Intercontinental through Easy-Click travel than I would have paid for the Holiday Inn. Trust me, there is no comparison. Every aspect of this hotel impressed us! The service at the front desk was courteous and prompt. Although we arrived at 12:30 pm, they had a room ready for us within 10 minutes, even though check-in time wasn't until 4 pm. The hotel itself is beautiful and very upscale. According to the porter, they cater more to the business traveller which may explain why we saw very few children around. However, I considered this a bonus! The lobby design is stunning - all marble and glass and decorated with some funky, modern furniture. Our room was huge and gorgeous. The bed was heavenly, with a feather duvet and mattress pad and the most dreamy pillows. The room also had a granite-topped desk with two high-back chairs, two comfy armchairs, a cabinet with tv. There was a nice minibar area (very expensive), two closets, and a great bathroom with separate vanity area, bathtub, and shower stall. The towels and face cloths were plush and thick as blankets. The location of the hotel is perfect...about a five minute walk along the waterfront to Bayside Marketplace, which has lots of restaurants and shopping. You can also take a tour of Millionaire's Row from Bayside - a fun activity that I would definitely recommend. In my opinion, this hotel is ideal for a night or two before or after a cruise. Any longer than that, I would personally head to the beach. But the Intercontinental Miami is perfect for a brief pre or post cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “It's Ok”
Reviews.Author: EHB
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice and clean. Great, big, comfortable beds. The service is really bad. I checked in and my boyfriend checked in later - they charged us twice for the hotel room!! If I hadnt noticed, I dont know if they would have corrected the double charge. Also, there was a party going on next door, and I called to be moved. I waited on hold for 10 minutes to speak to the front desk. I was moved though and then it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experiece!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel did a lot to accomodate me! I was given a ridiculously early check-in, allowed to check out late, was made to feel very comfortable all over the hotel. The pool deck was great, was made great drinks and food! You will also enjoy the location near Bayside Park.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Decent experience”
Reviews.Author: tpinder14
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinenal for a long memorial day weekend getaway. First requested a room with 2 double beds and when we checked in got a room with one king sized bed. Call the front desk and they immediately corrected the problem and gave us a new room. Got an excellent rate on hotwire of $101 a night which was excellent considering it was a holiday weekend. We ordered room service one night it took forever to come over an hour but food was great. The gift shop downstairs is very overpriced so go to the Walgreens like a block and a half up the street if you want snacks, toiletries etc.Valet Parking is $25 a day which is quite expensive but comparable to the other hotels in the downtown area. Overall I would definately stay here again.....especially if I get such a good deal next time :-)

Reviews.Title: “It's actually a good hotel for a conference!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelFactor
Reviews.Content: I provided an earlier review of this hotel in February as a business traveler. I just stayed there this month while running a conference, and I now have a different perspective. It's still expensive, yes. However, the group block rates are reasonable for conferences, and the conference planning staff is incredible. The staff members were attentive, friendly, and poised to make the conference a success. I plan a lot of meetings, and I left very impressed. I also had a better room on this visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: mississauga4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything I expected it would be. The room was clean, exceptionally quiet and comfortable. Beds were a bit small (I think they were doubles instead of queens) so it was a bit tight for us and our 16-year old son. The bathroom was enormous! I really liked that the toilet and shower were separate from the sink and the dressing area, making it possible for more than one person to get ready at a time. The view of the Port of Miami was incredible from our 23rd floor room. It was the highlight of the room. The gym was good but you have to pay $10 a person to use it. The pool area was shaded by a new condominum tower so it made it a bit cool. Whatever you do, don't open the minibar fridge unless you intend to purchase something! We opened the door three times and without touching anything were charged three times. The hotel reversed the charges without question but I was still surprised by that. After all, how the heck are you supposed to know if you want something from the fridge or not if you can't have a look?? The location was great. Very close to the Bayside marketplace and quieter than the hubub of South Beach. One bus takes you to South Beach for $1.50. The cab ride to the Port of Miami took 5 minutes. It is about a 25 minute ride from Miami Airport.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ducs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Intercontinental Hotel Miami for a conference for three nights in early March. Check-in took about three minutes. All staff very friendly and helpful. The bedroom and bathroom were quite spacious. The view of Biscayne Bay was spectacular. Housekeeping was unobtrusive. I was happy to have a coffee maker in the room, but the pot made two to three cups yet there was only one cream and one sugar, so only enough for one cup. The only other complaint I have is really about many hotels: Why don't they put air conditioning in the bathrooms? Especially in Miami where it's really hot and humid and even more so in the bathroom after you take a hot shower. I would definitely stay here again though. You can walk to a nice park on the water and the Bayside Marketplace with lots of shops and take a cruise around the harbor and see celebrity homes ($17 but there is a $3 off coupon in the Miami magazine in the hotel room).

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: chessiesrule
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference located at the hotel. Based on previous reviews I wasn't quite sure what to expect but I was pleasantly suprised. The room was clean and large, nice bathroom/dressing room set up. Conference facilities and food were above average. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business”
Reviews.Author: Rob113
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice in the past 8 months (both times on business trips) and was very pleased with this hotel. The meeting spaces and services were great. I had a great room both times on the upper floors. Great views and the room decor was very modern and clean. Room service was great and the breakfast was excellent. The location isn't close to South Beach but for business it was ideal. Only a 15 min drive to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: kandjw
Reviews.Content: Way better than some reviews make this out to be. We thought staff were attentive and helpful. Loved the room and the view. Definitely would book there again.
